本課程旨在建構學生參與專業動物輔助治療活動的基本知能。課程內容由動物輔助治療基本概念出發，帶領學生經歷個案評估、方案設計、與成果評值等方案規劃與執行的過程。並藉由課堂講授、討論、影片研討、實作體驗學習之活動，建構學生具備有動物輔助治療助理員能力。

Mental Health and living: Healing factors that students should know

Introduction to Life Education
生命教育主要是引導學生從觀察與分享對生、老、死之感受的過程中，體會生命的意義及存在的價值，進而培養尊重和珍惜生命的情懷。本課程透過討論，引導學生探討自我悅納、關心家庭、熱愛他人、尊重大自然及探索生命的意義，建立積極正向的人生觀，發現生命的幸福。
This course proposes students can think and reflect the issues on life , explore the meaning of life in thinking about man’s conditions in the life world, issues on destiny、love、knowledge、character、art、religion、dying and death etc. 
 The expectation of this course try to help students have positive recognition and attitude on life by way of many lectures and discussions.

Thanatology and Funeral

History of Artistic Culture
透過藝術文化的類型與不同的表現形式及中西方藝術的演進與賞析，瞭解藝術的理念、內涵與歷史演變，深入探討藝術與生命、美感與生活、藝術與文化等重要議題之意義。培養學生對藝術文化有基本的認識與高度的敏感度，提升審美素養，持續自主學習的興趣。
Through the exploration of various types and form of art and culture, as well as the evolution and appreciation of Eastern and Western art, this course provides an understanding of the concepts, meaning and historical transformations of arts. It further delves deeply into significant topics such as art and life, aesthetics and everyday life, and art and culture. Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.

Funeral Facilities
本課程介紹台灣殯葬管理條例規範的殯葬設施與殯儀館，協助學生認識國內外殯葬的各種設施、殯葬設施的管理維護、殯葬設施規劃與改變。透過議題中心教學法教導學生從殯儀館、火化場、公墓...等設施，來了解在進行完善的殯葬服務時所會使用之殯葬週邊設施，使了解其在殯葬服務的重要性及藉以來圓滿人生最後階段的需求。除經由介紹各項設施設備的名稱與沿革外，並邀請公部門及私部門講師授課教導現今殯葬設施之管理現況與未來規劃及發展、了解殯葬設施成為鄰避衝突的因素，並透過專家與地方菁英代表的訪談或是座談會，讓學生學習殯葬設施設置造成鄰避衝突的因素、化解衝突過程以及可能的解決方法。並配合本校iLMS行動學習進行網路的資料上傳、討論與分享。
This course introduces Taiwan's funeral regulations norms funeral facilities, funeral home and abroad to help students understand the various facilities, facilities maintenance management funeral, funeral planning and changing. Vocational Rehabilitation Services
本課程旨在建立學生對職業重建服務的基本理念，促進了解職業重建服務人員應注意遵守之專業倫理與職業重建服務之各項服務資源現況，並	學習身心障礙者就業與職涯輔導，以及擔任身心障礙者就業服務員的服務內涵與服務歷程，進一步學習以工作分析與職務再設計、職場支持與輔導。因而建立職業重建的概念與身心障礙者職業重建服務內涵，培養擔任職業重建服務專業人員之核心知能，並學習應用諮商輔導相關知能於職業重建服務過程，最後能綜合所學發展自身對職業重建服務領域的專業認同與職涯選擇。
This course of introduction to Vocational Rehabilitation Services aims to establish students’ basic concept of vocational rehabilitation services, promote the understanding of professional ethics and vocational rehabilitation services resources. The professionals of vocational rehabilitation services should pay attention to, and learn about employment and career counseling for the disabled. The service connotation and service process of employment attendants for the physically and mentally disabled will be further studied by job analysis and job redesign, workplace support and guidance. Therefore, we establish the concept of vocational rehabilitation and the connotation of vocational rehabilitation services for the physically and mentally handicapped, cultivate the core knowledge to serve as vocational rehabilitation services professionals, and learn to apply the relevant knowledge of counseling and counseling in the career reconstruction service process. Starting from understanding the International Classification of Functional, Disability, and Health (ICF), impact of impairment, career development of people with disabilities, and vocational rehabilitation services. The students will learn intake interview, design a vocational rehabilitation plan, and implement services, and job analysis skills. Through the process, students will be more capable vocational rehabilitation professionals. Finally integrate what they have learned to develop their own career to be the professionals of vocational rehabilitation services. Promote their Professional identity and career choice in the service field.
全18週

01
The Introduction of Art Therapy
本課程主要在介紹藝術治療的理論與實務，並且針對藝術治療如何應用於各年齡層之個案群中，進行深入的探討和研究。本課程預計分為十四個單元講授，分別介紹藝術治療的簡史、藝術治療在歐美及台灣的發展、不同的藝術治療取向、「表達性治療連續系統」(ETC)和「媒材可變特性」(MDV) 理論，了解這些理論與表達性藝術治療技法間的關係，並且透過參與藝療活動，學習和體驗藝術治療的精神，同時探討藝術治療在悲傷輔導、創傷治療、情緒障礙和行為問題之個案上的臨床運用。此課程以﹙1﹚研究著作之研讀﹙2﹚相關簡報之呈現與討論（3）表達性藝療活動之參與（４）個別和團體研究報告等方式進行，提供學生思考空間，並作為檢驗學習效果之參考。
Through the literature review, case studies and experiential art activities, this course will assist students in understanding the theories and practices in art therapy, as well as the connection between the arts and human life while gaining knowledge on how art can be used in the field of psychotherapy, life/death education, and grief counseling as a helpful tool to maintain one’s physical and mental health.
全18週

Logotherapy
幫助學生瞭解生命意義與身心靈健康的密切關係，從意義治療學的角度切入，探討安頓生命的道理，引導學生思考並實踐攸關個人成長及身心靈健康的重要課題。
The therapeutic component of Logotherapy follows the Judeo-Christian traditions, being open to anyone, and in this way ecumenical. In essence, Logotherapy aims at helping to find meaning and purpose in any life situation, actualizing the universal values set forth in the Ten Commandments and the Beatitudes. It is through finding meaning and purpose in suffering that healing and reconciliation can be attained and psychopathological symptoms can be relieved.

01
Philosophy and Life
「哲學與人生」是對「人的生命」所作的「哲學反省」。人，作為自然的、社會的、歷史的存在，在他所生活的世界中，面臨著繁複多樣、瞬息萬變的問題：處境、命運、愛情、知識、道德、藝術、宗教、臨終與死亡……其中有些問題事實上已經深深困擾著我們，另外一些則伺機突襲，在我們還來不及準備的時候，就被迫面對。生命的意義究竟是什麼？本課程嘗試以深入淺出的討論，藉由過去、當代人物的所感、所思，促進學習者進一步反省自我生命之種種。
Philosophy and Life is as a philosophical reflective thinking for the life.
Human beings, as natural, social and historical beings, face a great many complex varied and fast changing problems in the life-world, for example, love, destiny, knowledge, morality, art, religion, dying, and moreover the death so on.... Actually some of them have deeply perplexed us, while others watch for their chances to attack there would leave no time for covering our ears and we are merely compelled to confront with them. After all, what does Life mean?
Whereas this course tries to take up by the way a kind of discussion in explaining the profound in simple terms, and in making use of whatever in history, or the present age somebody's feeling and thinking, in order to promote the students to question themselves more about, and reflect further on all sorts of life-self.

01
Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
全18週

Introduction to Public Health
本課程旨在闡明廣泛性之公共衛生概念，並進而體認公共衛生之理念、原則，明白公共衛生是一門預防疾病、延長壽命、促進健康的生活科學與藝術。主要的學習經驗包括探討公共衛生之理論、發展、趨勢及實務之應用等，以符合休閒產業與健康促進的核心價值進一步了解環境衛生、健康傳播、社區衛生、流行病學等知識，以明白如何透過早期偵測、介入的方式處理健康衛生問題，並發展出相關之社會機制，保障大多數人足以擁有、維持、體現健康與長壽之權利。
This course is aimed at elucidating the overall and general concepts of public health, and thereby catches the implicated ideology, principle, science and art of it, in order to prevent diseases, lengthen life span, enhance health, and then enrich the meaning and increase the efficiency of living/life. Learners would be guided to examine and to recognize the theories, evolutions, development, trends, and practical aspects of related issues. By means of organizing forces in the community, public health will be validated by being engaged in environmental health, infection control, personal hygiene, organized medical and nursing professionals, etc, in order to early detect, intervene and handle the health and hygiene issues, and then develop related social mechanism. Health Psychology
本課程主要是讓同學了解對於一些心理及生理之間的關聯和影響、概念及因應方法，包括生活中造成的心理壓力，與疾病的關係與因應，疾病之心理社會危險因子與心理介入計劃，瞭解慢性疾病的心理社會層面，如何預防及因應。學習如何保持良好生理及心理狀態相關健康行為，並學習評估自身對壓力反應的指標，並進一步了解有效的壓力因應方式。

The purpose of this course is to introduce physiological principles and regulatory mechanisms and to help students to integrate related concepts and understand the relationship between structures and their functions. The contents include cellular physiology, physiology of nerve and muscle, central nervous system, cardiovascular system, respiratory system, renal physiology, gastrointestinal system, metabolism, endocrinology and reproduction.

Introduction of Gerontology
本課程旨在探討高齡學相關議題，包括：國家、社會、家庭、個人等不同面向．主要學習重點包含瞭解老化及老年相關之人口學、社會學、心理學、生理學等內容。學習者將會學到的老人生理層面包含：健康促進、長者運動、老年常見疾病等議題；心理層面則包含：心理健康、長者憂鬱、懷舊、面對生命最終規劃；社會層面包含：老年社會資源應用、居住安全、長期照顧安排、銀髮族相關社交與休閒的科學研究等相關議題；本課程還會特別介紹有關長壽科學與成功老化等國際科學研究之成果。
透過多層面教學與討論，將有助於學員掌握高齡相關專業知能及未來發展方向之規劃。
The goal of this course is to discuss general concepts of Gerontology related to nation, society, family, and individual. Main field will include: Demography, Sociology, Psychology, and Physiology. Learners will be familiar with important issues such as: health promotion, senior physical activity, common illness, mental health, depression of the elderly, reminiscence, hospice, social resources, safety of living, long-term care management, and researches related to benefits of leisure activity. National study of longevity and successful aging will be presented as well. Students will get profound knowledge and trend of gerontology through this comprehensive course.
全18週

Food and Health Practice
本課程以養生及餐飲衛生安全為基礎，課程涵蓋範圍包含食物中營養素的介紹、食品衛生安全管理、污染源處理原則、清潔與消毒、餐飲設施與設備介紹等，並透過菜單設計以及食材烹飪等實務操作，使同學能將理論應用於日常生活中，進而建立健康促進服務的實務能力。
This course is based the foundation of food safety and healthy eating for longevity, and covers essential topics including nutrients in food, food safety management, cleaning and disinfection, common foodborne illnesses, good hygienic practices, HACCP, cleaning and disinfection, and commercial kitchen design and equipment. The most exciting part of this course is the hands-on experience in the kitchen – all the students will be given the opportunity to design a menu and prepare meals of their choice.  After the completion of this course, our students should acquire the fundamental knowledge and skills to help them carrying out services in the health promotion sectors.

01
Tourism Service and Marketing
本課程旨在帶領學生以「問題導向學習」(Problem-Based Learning, PBL)深入探討：顧客服務、服務品質、服務策略及管理等重要議題。討論之內容包括：顧客服務的重要性、顧客抱怨的處理、如何超過顧客的期望、服務品質、顧客關係、服務管理的原理及運用、服務策略的擬定。並協助學生了解市場行銷學之各項理論，並進一步能活用各式行銷理念於觀光、餐旅及休憩之領域中。課程內容將包括：觀光行銷概論、觀光行銷環境與研究、觀光客行為、觀光市場區隔、目標市場與定位策略、觀光市場區隔、目標市場與定位策略、觀光產品與服務規劃、觀光定價決策、觀光通路決策、觀光推廣決策、觀光服務人員管理、觀光行銷實體環境管理、觀光服務流程管理、觀光生產力與服務品質管理、觀光顧客關係管理、觀光體驗行銷、觀光服務補救與異常事件管理等。
The purpose of the course is to enhance students’ understanding in customer service, service quality, service management and service strategies. The contents of the course include the importance of customer service, how to deal with customers’ complaints, how to exceed customers’ expectations, service quality, customer relationships, principles and applications of service management, and service strategies. By introducing the concepts and theories of marketing, it is to help students to apply those theories in tourism, restaurants and hotels. The contents of the course include service characteristics of tourism marketing, marketing strategic planning, marketing information system, consumer behaviors, market segmentation and positioning, customer loyalty and quality, product, price, place and sales promotion.
全18週

本課程旨在增進休閒旅遊與健康促進之工作專業能力。主要藉由與休閒健康相關機構或法人組織產業合作，輔導學生進入產業環境，能有效考量及運用各項休閒遊憩與健康促進專業知識，結合理論與實務，協助設計休閒健康促進企劃方案，可因應目前社會需求，在職場中應用相關之理論、原則、方法與資源，同時培養學生具備休閒健康促進規劃實務能力。
This course aims to equip students with the professional abilities to work in the leisure, tourism and health promotion field. The course provides students the opportunity to work with organizations and institutions related to leisure and health. Students will be able to effectively apply professional knowledge of leisure, tourism and health promotion in the workplace, which will be beneficial to their future career development.
全18週

massage and meridians release :theory and practice

Introduction to Horticultural Therapy
本課程主要培育學生對於園藝治療有基本認識與實際操作之技能，認識園藝治療是最自然的療育法，瞭解需要園藝治療的對象、目的、評估方法、園藝治療設計與實作，對於健康長者、失能長者、罹病或受傷的長者，透過園藝及照顧植物以有助於復健及維持功能的作用，透過人與植物間更親密接觸的互動，增進生活福祉並促進長者、病患、弱勢族群的健康。本課程提供學生運用植物及園藝技術於增進人類福祉的另一項專業領域。

Psychology

Human Anatomy
本課程乃配合人體解剖學課程為主要目標，包括細胞及組織的認識，骨骼、肌肉、循環、神經、內分泌、呼吸、消化、泌尿和生殖各系統構造的瞭解，以及表面解剖學之自學應用。
The purpose of this course is to introduce anatomical principles and mechanism of body
structure, and further helps students to integrate related concepts and understand the relationship
between structures and their functions. The contents include cellular anatomy, skeletal system,
anatomy of nerve and muscle, central nervous system, cardiovascular system, respiratory system,
digestive system, urinary system, reproductive system, endocrine system and applied surface
anatomy.

Introduction to Pet Therapy
本課程旨在介紹寵物治療的的相關理論、世界潮流及臨床應用，透過以建立「動物 與人和諧互動關係」之基礎，探討運用動物於人類健康照護、教育輔導、及行為矯 治等層面上之各種議題及現況，將生命教育內涵融入醫護及教育實務中，來協助學 生以尊重生命的理念，落實在人類身、心、靈、社會與環境的多面向照護上。課程 內容包括寵物治療的相關理論、寵物治療的施行模式、國內外研究趨勢、寵物治療 在健康照護、教育輔導與行為矯治等層面之應用、及動物用於提升人類生活品質之相關議題探討等。本課程希望藉由課堂講授、討論、影片研討等方式，輔以實作體 驗學習之活動，帶領學生認識動物在人類健康照護與教育輔導領域的重要性，並培 養學生尊重生命及參與推廣促進人與動物關係方案的知能。
This course is to introduce the applications of pet therapy into human health care and education, based on the theories of the life education and “human-animal interaction.” The course topics include: the theories and trends of animal welfare issues; animals and human health; the research, practice, and models of pet therapy, etc. The teaching activities include lectures, group discussions, professional visits, documentary films discussion, etc. Students are expected to be initiated their knowledge and interests in both animal welfare and pet therapy issues.

Art Therapy
本課程內容以認知的、心理的、表現的三項訴求為主。將提供視覺心理與藝術治療基礎，並連結藝術活動的機能至應用練習。課程中講解實務經驗，教導學生如何利用非言語表達方式，在輔導照顧上透過對繪畫等藝術作品的感受，建立起潛意識的自然對話，促使生理、心理、社會與心靈層面邁向良性的溝通。課程設計同時著重學生之自學、創意與問題解決的能力。
This course is inspired from our study of cognition, psychology, and expression. It will start from building a solid foundation for visual psychology and fine art therapy; then we illustrate the theory by applying art activity to practical cases. 01
Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
全18週

本課程旨在介紹我國具有民俗特色之保健活動—刮痧、拔罐、按摩推拿、灸法、耳穴保健和養生健身法。學生除了學習傳統民俗保健方法有關的基本理論之外，並藉著練習不同的技術，習得調身（姿勢）、調心（意識）及調息（呼吸）的技術，鍛鍊自己的精、氣、神，達到疏通經絡、增強抵抗力，促進自己及他人的健康層次，培養學生對中醫使用開放之態度，並將所學應用於專業照護上。
This course is to offer students the necessary knowledge and skills of Chinese traditional care methods. It is based upon the traditional theories of Ch'i, blood, visceral organs, meridians and collateral. In additional to traditional theories and techniques of scraping, cupping, massage, moxibustion, ear acupuncture and Ch'i exercises will be demonstrated. Students are required to understand the theories and to practice the techniques learned from the class in order to adjust their mind and breathing, to improve the flow of Ch'i and blood, to regulate the functions of visceral organs, and strengthen the resistance, promote the health of oneself and others, cultivate students' open attitude to the use of traditional Chinese medicine, and apply what they have learned to professional care.

本課程以教授老人健康照顧專業之知識與技能為目標，透過相關模型器材及多媒體教材之運用，培養學生熟稔老人實務照顧常用技術之原理、目的及操作，並透過討論、反思、技術練習等多元教學策略與學習方法，學習執行技術過程中，展現老人照顧之專業知識與技能。
This course aims to teach the professional knowledge and skills in the elderly health care and help the student get familiar with the principles, objectives and practice of the regular techniques for clinical care of the elderly people through relevant models and multimedia teaching materials. In addition, diversified teaching strategies and learning methods like discussions, reflections and technical trainings are carried out to show the motivation for knowledge and skills enhancement, to display the ability of safety and emergent response during learning of technical execution, to care for the elderly with communication skills, and to promote the standard of personal professional ethics and quality of care into self-directed study and lifelong education.
全18週

01
Philosophy and Life
「哲學與人生」是對「人的生命」所作的「哲學反省」。人，作為自然的、社會的、歷史的存在，在他所生活的世界中，面臨著繁複多樣、瞬息萬變的問題：處境、命運、愛情、知識、道德、藝術、宗教、臨終與死亡……其中有些問題事實上已經深深困擾著我們，另外一些則伺機突襲，在我們還來不及準備的時候，就被迫面對。生命的意義究竟是什麼？本課程嘗試以深入淺出的討論，藉由過去、當代人物的所感、所思，促進學習者進一步反省自我生命之種種。
Philosophy and Life is as a philosophical reflective thinking for the life.
Human beings, as natural, social and historical beings, face a great many complex varied and fast changing problems in the life-world, for example, love, destiny, knowledge, morality, art, religion, dying, and moreover the death so on.... Actually some of them have deeply perplexed us, while others watch for their chances to attack there would leave no time for covering our ears and we are merely compelled to confront with them. After all, what does Life mean?
Whereas this course tries to take up by the way a kind of discussion in explaining the profound in simple terms, and in making use of whatever in history, or the present age somebody's feeling and thinking, in order to promote the students to question themselves more about, and reflect further on all sorts of life-self.
全18週

01
Rehabilitation and assistive technology in elderly care
本課程主要介紹高齡照護常用的復健與輔具，課程以理論搭配實務操作為主。先介紹物理治療、職能治療、語言治療在居家、社區與機構中的功能與角色，接下來則學習針對不同對象給予適合的復健訓練。課程後半段則介紹高齡社會中常見的科技輔具，掌握基本原理、評估與操作技巧後，將以小組方式進行高齡輔具設計的提案。
This course introduces the rehabilitation and assistive technology in the elderly care fields. Lecture and clinical practice are included in this course. First, I will introduce the role of physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech therapy in home, community and institution based long term care. Second , students learn how to prescribe and execute the appropriate training program according the specific condition such as dementia, frailty or bed ridden. After mid term examination, I will introduce the assistive technology and devices in long term care fields. Students learn basic theory, evaluation and manipulation skills during 7 weeks. Finally, students need to present the proposal of gerontological product design in the form of group cooperation.
全18週

Introduction to Contemporary Art
本課程以現代性的概念，貫連二十世紀至當前的藝術潮流發展，探討當代藝術的幾個重要流派、特性與不同面向，呈現藝術發展的獨特性與創造性。培養藝術涵養及建立個人對審美的主體觀，並瞭解當前社會藝術文化脈動，對當代的文化思潮有其見地，以開展學生發展自我潛能，並將藝術融入生活，提升生命境界。
This course employs the concept of modernity as a framework to establish connections between the evolution of artistic trends from the 20th century to the present day. The course delves into various significant genres, characteristics, and different aspects of contemporary art, thereby highlighting the distinctiveness and creativity of artistic development. The objective of this course is to cultivate artistic appreciation, establish personal aesthetic perspectives and comprehend the prevailing social and cultural trends in art. The course further aims to enhance students' capacity for self-growth, integrate art into their daily lives, and elevate their overall living experience.

History of Artistic Culture
透過藝術文化的類型與不同的表現形式及中西方藝術的演進與賞析，瞭解藝術的理念、內涵與歷史演變，深入探討藝術與生命、美感與生活、藝術與文化等重要議題之意義。培養學生對藝術文化有基本的認識與高度的敏感度，提升審美素養，持續自主學習的興趣。
Through the exploration of various types and form of art and culture, as well as the evolution and appreciation of Eastern and Western art, this course provides an understanding of the concepts, meaning and historical transformations of arts. It further delves deeply into significant topics such as art and life, aesthetics and everyday life, and art and culture. Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.

Psychology
本課程主要內容是以心理學各種基礎理論、研究方法及重要實驗為主，進而擴展應用於心理衛生各種人類生活適應行為及生活層面。課程綱要包括心理學的起源與發展、基礎理論與研究方法、行為的生物學基礎、意識狀態、感覺與知覺、學習與行為、記憶、思維與智力、心理評量:人格與智力測驗、人類發展、動機與情緒、人格、壓力與衝突、異常行為、心理治療方式、社會知覺與認知、態度、社會影響與互動。
The main content of this curriculum is to expand and apply the fundamental theory, research method, and important experiment in psychology to mental health in various living line includes the origin and development of psychology, fundamental theory and research method, fundamentals of behavioral biology, consciousness, sensation and perception, leaning, cognition, memory, thinking and intelligence, psychological assessment, personality and intelligence test, human development, motivation and emotion, personality stress and conflict, abnormal behavior psychotherapeutics social perception, cognition, attitude, and social influence and interaction.

Introduction to Intelligent Exoskeleton Fundamental Practice
本課程旨在提供初階智能外骨骼實務應用相關基礎的訓練，課程內容先以基本的人類肌動學、動作控制與學習、步態分析教學做重點介紹後，再延伸出搭配智能外骨骼之復能訓練，學習智能外骨骼的原理、保養及穿戴方式，透過實際練習來感受智能外骨骼機器所帶來的助益，並搭配精準之動作分析及力量感測儀器，深入探討外骨骼機器與人和諧運作時的運動學及動理學分析，培育出新一代的跨醫學及工程領域之人才。
This course is designed to provide basic training on the practical application of intelligent exoskeleton robots. The course content starts with basic human kinematics, movement control and learning, and gait analysis, and then extends to the rehabilitation training of exoskeleton robots, learning the principles of exoskeleton robots, maintenance and wearing methods, experiencing the benefits of intelligent exoskeleton robots through practical exercises, and with precise movement analysis and strength sensing instruments, and deeply exploring the kinematics and kinetic analysis of exoskeleton robots when they operate in harmony with humans, cultivating a new generation of talents across medical and engineering fields.

This course includes a two-hour reading instruction each week. Students are placed to different levels according to their individual English ability displayed in a placement test administered beforehand.  Teaching materials covered, therefore, will differ in order to meet the needs of students of different levels.  The main contents of the course are grammar review, reading skills and practice in low-intermediate or intermediate level general English.
全18週

Economics
經濟學是從人類生活中歸納出來的經濟法則，其目的在增進每一個人的生活福祉，自然與人們生活息息相關。本課程將對經濟學中一些基本原則和供需原理加以解析，並配合部分日常生活事務的經濟分析，使修習者能夠了解經濟法則的基本原理，然後應用到日常生活當中；換言之，就是要利用經濟學的邏輯思想與觀念，依理行事來處理生活問題，這就是理性(rationality）。有了理性的生活規範與觀念，可以使個人行為、家庭生活以及社會秩序益趨合理、有效與和諧。
Economic science is the economic rules generated from human life and is naturally closely linked to people daily life because it was born to enhance the welfare of individual life. This course will analyze some fundamental rules and demand-supply theories

History of Artistic Culture
透過藝術文化的類型與不同的表現形式及中西方藝術的演進與賞析，瞭解藝術的理念、內涵與歷史演變，深入探討藝術與生命、美感與生活、藝術與文化等重要議題之意義。培養學生對藝術文化有基本的認識與高度的敏感度，提升審美素養，持續自主學習的興趣。
Through the exploration of various types and form of art and culture, as well as the evolution and appreciation of Eastern and Western art, this course provides an understanding of the concepts, meaning and historical transformations of arts. It further delves deeply into significant topics such as art and life, aesthetics and everyday life, and art and culture. Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.
全18週

fitness and basic sport skill. Lecturers instruct the concept of sports and healthy to 
the student through cardiovascular fitness and sport skill (basketball) as well as to 
promote the coordination of the body and the emphasis on teamwork of basketball. 
Freshmen not only acquire the concept of sports health, but also learn to help 
people and teamwork attitude.

Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.

Statistics application and health data analysis using open source software
本課程旨在建立學生 R 語言的能力，並具備使用 RStudio 整理並分析建康相關資料的能力。為使學生能具備上述能力，本課程將先透過分段講述的方式，使學生對 R、RStudio、套件、語法有基本認識；然後依每次資料處理與分析的主題，讓學透過實作練習整合所聽見的內容，並從親手操作的過程及具體結果間進行觀察學習。再藉由敘說操作的過程及具體結果，與同儕共同反思，以增進學生應用 R 與 RStudio 整理並分析建康相關資料的能力。本課程將涵蓋 (1) R 與 RStudio 軟體簡介，(2) 資料結構與基本資料處理策略，(3) 基礎與實用套件與語法，(4) 初等統計，(5) 統計繪圖等。
This course aims to build students' R language abilities and the ability to use RStudio to organize and analyze health-related materials. In order to enable students to possess the above-mentioned abilities, this course will first give students a basic understanding of R, RStudio, packages, and grammar through segmented narration; then, according to the theme of data processing and analysis each time, students will learn through practical Do exercises to integrate what you hear, and observe and learn from the hands-on process and specific results. Then, by describing the process and specific results of the operation, and reflecting with peers, students can improve their ability to use R and RStudio to organize and analyze health-related data. This course will cover (1) introduction to R and RStudio software, (2) data structure and basic data processing strategies, (3) basic and practical packages and syntax, (4) elementary statistics, (5) statistical drawing, etc.

Philosophy and Life
「哲學與人生」是對「人的生命」所作的「哲學反省」。人，作為自然的、社會的、歷史的存在，在他所生活的世界中，面臨著繁複多樣、瞬息萬變的問題：處境、命運、愛情、知識、道德、藝術、宗教、臨終與死亡……其中有些問題事實上已經深深困擾著我們，另外一些則伺機突襲，在我們還來不及準備的時候，就被迫面對。生命的意義究竟是什麼？本課程嘗試以深入淺出的討論，藉由過去、當代人物的所感、所思，促進學習者進一步反省自我生命之種種。
Philosophy and Life is as a philosophical reflective thinking for the life.
Human beings, as natural, social and historical beings, face a great many complex varied and fast changing problems in the life-world, for example, love, destiny, knowledge, morality, art, religion, dying, and moreover the death so on.... Actually some of them have deeply perplexed us, while others watch for their chances to attack there would leave no time for covering our ears and we are merely compelled to confront with them. After all, what does Life mean?
Whereas this course tries to take up by the way a kind of discussion in explaining the profound in simple terms, and in making use of whatever in history, or the present age somebody's feeling and thinking, in order to promote the students to question themselves more about, and reflect further on all sorts of life-self.
全18週

Operation management in Healthcare Organization
健康事業機構作業管理是醫療產業中包括醫院經營最重要的一個管理制度，無論是營利或非營利機構、公立或私立機構，作業管理是醫院管理中最重要的一環，課程中，介紹作業管理制度包含了作業管理的理論與醫院實務，目標管理制度、責任中心制度、人力資源管理、預算制度及成本控制、醫療機構的經營策略管理及醫療行銷管理等。
The purpose of the lesson is to provide students with organized understanding on daily operation of healthcare organization.

01
Healthcare Industrial Organization Observation
本課程旨在協助健康事業管理系四技學生，在修讀健管專業課程過程，對健康產業的新型態主要服務機構具備基本的瞭解。本課程配合教育部「103學年度補助遴聘業界專家協同教學計畫」，引進台北地區長期照護服務機構負責單位/主管人員協同教學，內容將包括五部份，分別是：
(1)	 本校教師介紹台灣健康照護服務體系及健康事業機構(包括長期照護)組織屬性與其管理。
(2)	 邀請長期照護機構實務管理人員，分別介紹台灣各類型長期照護服務機構之經營管理，並側重各類型長照機構業務的生命關懷面向。
(3)	 藉業界專家之協助，實地參訪台灣各類型長期照護服務機構，其中將針對參訪學習要素，於課堂進行行前輔導，包括觀察重點，資料蒐集及其分析整體技巧，團隊分工等。在此同時，也配合健康事業管理系主軸學習活動計畫，開放系上學生報名參與並納入分組，以累積學習歷程積分。
(4)	 本校教師在實地參訪前、後進行自主學習輔導，包括觀察重點、資料蒐集、分析整體技巧、團隊分工等，引發學生深入思考，並藉參訪時機深度觀察與學習。
(5)	 由同學分組發揮團隊合作精神，就實地參訪提出報告及學習心得（含對課程建議），舉行口頭期末報告，並按分組繳交書面報告乙份（含分組書面報告、簡報檔，及每人一頁（A4，至少600字）的個人學習心得），以加深學習效果。
The purpose of the lesson is to provide students with organized understanding on healthcare industrial organizations’ operation and management.
全18週

Economics
本課程主要講授經濟學的基本概念與原理，其內容包含個體與總體經濟學兩部分。個體經濟學的部分會從供給與需求入手，逐步介紹效用、需求及供給彈或、生產與成本及完全與不完全競爭市場理論。「總體經濟學」則以國民所得開始，陸續介紹貨幣供需、財政政策與貨幣政策、失業與物價、國際貿易等議題。課程著重於各章節的概念及結合生活時事，以數理模型為輔助。
This course mainly teaches the basic concepts and principles of economics, and its content includes two parts: individual economics and general economics. The part of individual economics will start with supply and demand, and gradually introduce utility, demand and supply elasticity, production and cost, and perfect and imperfect competition market theory. "General Economics" begins with national income, and then introduces issues such as money supply and demand, fiscal policy and monetary policy, unemployment and prices, and international trade. The course focuses on the concepts of each chapter and combined with current events in life, assisted by mathematical models.

01
Programming Logic
本課程教學內容分為「基本程式介紹」、「邏輯思考訓練」與「檔案的處理」
司三大主題，課程使用 C 程式語言進行教學。課程一開始，會介紹 C 語言基本
輸入輸入語法、條件敘述(Conditional Statement)與迴圈敘述(Loop Statement)，然
後進入邏輯思考訓練。
對於一程式設計者而言，無論撰寫何種程式語言，通常有超過一半的程式碼，
都會被包含於條件敘述與迴圈敘述中，此兩種敘述包含了大量的資料結構與邏輯
觀念，表面上看似簡單，但多層下的條件敘述與迴圈敘述，往往對程式初學者產
生很大的程式障礙，因此，課程將由基本的觀念開始，結合資料結構之概念，培
養同學撰寫程式所需之基本能力。
接著，課程會加入檔案的處理，並與生活中的例子結合，進行資料的擷取與
分析，以學習利用程式來簡化工作，以達到課程學以致用之目標。
Though programming is mainly associated with the field of computer
management, but writing good and optimized code is mostly an art. The purpose of
the class is to train students’ programming logic. We will begin with an installation of
Teacher’s academic code: 9996
the C language. We will then develop programs that test students’ mind skills. Also,
the course has lots of logic puzzles which have to solve. Following the class, students’
logic could be improved. In the long term, we hope that the course can improve
students’technique for every programming language.
全18週

Knowledge Management
知識管理促進個人/組織的知識、know-how、專家技藝、智慧資本及其他形態的知識的創造、再利用與散布，能從企業的學習性組織及核心競爭力中創造與獲得較大的價值。 知識管理能點出個別企業的特定問題，例如，是要創造與配送創新產品或服務；或是管理與加強跟顧客、夥伴與供應商的關係；還是改善工作流程。知識管理對企業的主要意義是整合散布在各處的知識，並將之適當地運用。
Knowledge Management (KM) refers to a range of practices and techniques used by individuals /organizations to identify, represent and distribute knowledge, know-how, expertise, intellectual capital and other forms of knowledge for creation, reuse and transfer of knowledge and e-learning across the organization.
Knowledge Management programs are typically claimed to be tied to specific organizational objectives and are intended to lead to the achievement of specific targeted results such as improved performance, competitive advantage, or higher levels of innovation.  The contents of this course include Part 1: Main Idea, Part 2:Management, Part 3: KM Flowcharts, Part 4:Information System, etc.

This course aims to help students:

3.	Learn key skills and frameworks to execute on innovation—finance, marketing, design thinking, strategy, value chain, leadership, team dynamics, and culture

Introduction to Research Methodology
本課程旨在提供學生基本的研究知識與技能。學生除了對實務情境產生質疑，並藉由討論、批判、觀摩等活動，提升團隊合作、問題解決和批判性思考等能力。課程內容包括研究與專業發展間的關係、研究基本概念、研究步驟、研究計畫的撰寫和研究文獻的批判。
This course is designed to accomplish four objectives. The course will begin with issues in scientific thinking, model building, and ethical implications. Second, it will familiarize students with major procedures in research design, such as the formation of research questions, literature review, conceptualization and operationalization of research questions, research design, questionnaire design, and sampling procedures. Third, the course will examine alternate methods in data collection and analysis with special emphasis on the evaluation of data quality such as reliability and validity. Finally, students will be divided into different research groups; each group will conduct an empirical research project.

Introduction to Contemporary Art
本課程以現代性的概念，貫連二十世紀至當前的藝術潮流發展，探討當代藝術的幾個重要流派、特性與不同面向，呈現藝術發展的獨特性與創造性。培養藝術涵養及建立個人對審美的主體觀，並瞭解當前社會藝術文化脈動，對當代的文化思潮有其見地，以開展學生發展自我潛能，並將藝術融入生活，提升生命境界。
This course employs the concept of modernity as a framework to establish connections between the evolution of artistic trends from the 20th century to the present day. The course delves into various significant genres, characteristics, and different aspects of contemporary art, thereby highlighting the distinctiveness and creativity of artistic development. The objective of this course is to cultivate artistic appreciation, establish personal aesthetic perspectives and comprehend the prevailing social and cultural trends in art. The course further aims to enhance students' capacity for self-growth, integrate art into their daily lives, and elevate their overall living experience.
全18週

Tools and Applications on Big Data Analysis
隨著資訊科技進步，現今資料累積的速度遠遠超過所能處理的速度。無論科學研究或是各種企業應用領域，許多單位都以資料分析做為組織未來的重要發展方向。R和 Python是開放源碼軟體，為資料分析使用的工具相當適合。期望提供學生一個良好的大數據軟體學習路徑，幫助初學者運用軟體，學習資料探勘工作與視覺化應用。
課程內容從軟體基本概念與資料整理入手，介紹與健康及醫療相關之巨量資料的基本知識與方法，資料的理解與統計等基本觀念的建立，介紹資料挖礦與大數據分析的理論方法與應用，並進行實機演練程式設計，進而提升學生大數據分析和數位決策能力。
With the advancement of information technology, data now accumulated much faster than that we can handle. In science or a variety of enterprise organizations, data analysis has become an important direction for decision making. R and Python are open source software, and is suitable to be used as analysis tools. In this course, we expect to provide students with a good learning path for software used on helping beginners to learn data visualization and data mining. Course contains the basic concepts of software and data compilation, the basic knowledge and methods of health and medical information, the basic concepts of statistics, the theory and method of data mining and analysis, and hands-on programming exercises. Students abilities of the big data analytics and digital decision-making will be enhanced.
全18週

Management and Practice of Health care Institutions
本課程旨在協助學生將過去所學如何運用於健康照護機構實際管理。課程內容以健康照護機構所面臨問題及實務演練為主，範圍從健康照護管理的簡介開始，再依循管理的過程分別介紹健康照護機構管理有關的主題如健康照護體系面臨經營環境、健康照護管理發展策略規劃、組織運作、績效管理與激勵、人力資源管理、品質管理、財務管理、風險管理及危機應變等之實務層面，期學生能藉此課程，對健康照護管理有更深入地認識，以激發自己在醫院管理方面之興趣。
This course aims to enhance students' practice ability of health care management.  Focusing on health care system and the problems faced by health care institutions, discusses how to resolve and manage including theory and practice of health care management. Introduces key topics and concepts related to the management of health care institutions such as health care system, case studies in strategy management and decision making, managing health care organizations,  administrative management responsibilities of health care environments, quality assurance management methods, human resources management, approaches to performance improvement financial management, risk or crisis management and response. Particular emphasis is placed on integrating analytic skills and conflict resolution methods into the practice of health care management. A portion of the class is devoted to simulation exercise in which general concepts and methods are demonstrated and practiced.  By the end of the course, it is expected that students will more understand and be inspired interest in hospital management.
全18週

Philosophy and Life
「哲學與人生」是對「人的生命」所作的「哲學反省」。人，作為自然的、社會的、歷史的存在，在他所生活的世界中，面臨著繁複多樣、瞬息萬變的問題：處境、命運、愛情、知識、道德、藝術、宗教、臨終與死亡……其中有些問題事實上已經深深困擾著我們，另外一些則伺機突襲，在我們還來不及準備的時候，就被迫面對。生命的意義究竟是什麼？本課程嘗試以深入淺出的討論，藉由過去、當代人物的所感、所思，促進學習者進一步反省自我生命之種種。
Philosophy and Life is as a philosophical reflective thinking for the life.
Human beings, as natural, social and historical beings, face a great many complex varied and fast changing problems in the life-world, for example, love, destiny, knowledge, morality, art, religion, dying, and moreover the death so on.... Actually some of them have deeply perplexed us, while others watch for their chances to attack there would leave no time for covering our ears and we are merely compelled to confront with them. After all, what does Life mean?
Whereas this course tries to take up by the way a kind of discussion in explaining the profound in simple terms, and in making use of whatever in history, or the present age somebody's feeling and thinking, in order to promote the students to question themselves more about, and reflect further on all sorts of life-self.
全18週

E-Commerce
隨著網際網路及資訊技術的不斷進步，流通業者在科技工具的運用上就愈發成熟與專業，如此除了能提昇企業經營效益外，最重要的是能分析消費者需求，進而提供消費者更好的產品及服務。課程主要為教導學生瞭解現行電子商務的範疇及導入的模式，從電子商務架構概論、開創市場機會、經營模式、市場行銷等單元介紹，進而切入企業電子化角度介紹企業資源於電子商務之應用，同時以實例探討，期望學生能清楚地瞭解電子商務的發展、技術與策略，並激發其對該領域的實作、研究及分析評估能力。
The digital economy, also known as the Internet economy, is an economy based on online transactions, mostly e-commerce. It includes digital wireline or wireless communication networks (e.g., the Internet, intranets, extranets, and VANs), computers, software, and other related information technologies.
In our course, we will lead to understand the phenomena, both technological, economic and social, behind these rapid changes, and how organizations successfully conduct Internet-based activities. This course provides an overview of e-commerce from both technological and managerial perspectives. It introduces e-commerce frameworks, and technological foundations; and examine basic concepts such as strategic formulation for e-commerce enterprises, management of their capital structures and public policy. This course is designed to familiarize students with current and emerging electronic commerce technologies using the Internet. Topics include Internet technology for business advantage, managing electronic commerce funds transfer, reinventing the future of business through electronic commerce, business opportunities in electronic commerce, electronic commerce Web site design, social, political and ethical issues associated with e-commerce, and business plans for technology ventures.
全18週

Psychology
心理學是一門研究人性 (包括心智活動或心理歷程) 的學科，更是大學教育中的必修通識科目之一。心理學和一般自然科學的共同源頭都是哲學，自然科學研究的內容是大自然可見的各種現象，心理學則探討人類行為和人性變化的機制和成因。學習以科學方法為研究手段的現代心理學，可以幫助學生認識生命的價值，使其瞭解自我存在的意義，並關心他人和珍惜所處環境。
Psychology is a professional discipline studying the humanity, including mind activity and psychological processing.  As the course  required in college/university education, psychology investigates the mechanisms and consequences of human behaviors and humanistic changes.  This is different from the general scientific courses that study the visible phenomena in nature.  Learning the modern psychology based on scientific approaches can help students being aware of the values of life.  It can also make students to understand the insides in themselves, care about others, and appreciate the environment surrounding them.

Introduction to physical activity and Health Promotion
本課程主要讓學生了解運動訓練與身體活動之基本概念，對於學生在未來從事不同族群之運動訓練應用與實務操作具備有應有的基本原則。課程中分為學科與實務操作部分，在身體活動之學科部分簡述運動訓練法、營養與健康與不同族群體適能指導原則，術科以實務操作方式進行不同族群體適能量測原理與操作課程(以國民體適能指導員-初級考核能力為主)；在健康促進課程部分，會以公共衛生之角度說明台灣在人口老化與長照政策之變革、族群健康與疾病發展與運動健康促進計畫為課程主軸，並以運動健康促進之觀點設計健康促進計畫。
This course mainly allows students to understand the basic concepts of exercise training methods and principles for improvement of physical activities in different populations. The course is divided into discipline and practical operation parts. In the discipline part of exercise training for physical activities, the physiological adaptation, nutrition management, specific physical fitness analysis and special population fitness will be briefly described. Besides, it will also introduce the ageing of Taiwan's population and long-term care policies, ageing and disease development, exercise health promotion plans, and physical activity assessments as the perspective of public health. Taken together, the exercise health promotion plans will be designed according to the principles of exercise training and periodization.

01
Psychology
心理學是一門研究人性 (包括心智活動或心理歷程) 的學科，更是大學教育中的必修通識科目之一。心理學和一般自然科學的共同源頭都是哲學，自然科學研究的內容是大自然可見的各種現象，心理學則探討人類行為和人性變化的機制和成因。學習以科學方法為研究手段的現代心理學，可以幫助學生認識生命的價值，使其瞭解自我存在的意義，並關心他人和珍惜所處環境。
Psychology is a professional discipline studying the humanity, including mind activity and psychological processing.  As the course  required in college/university education, psychology investigates the mechanisms and consequences of human behaviors and humanistic changes.  This is different from the general scientific courses that study the visible phenomena in nature.  Learning the modern psychology based on scientific approaches can help students being aware of the values of life.  It can also make students to understand the insides in themselves, care about others, and appreciate the environment surrounding them.
全18週

01
Introduction to physical activity and Health Promotion
本課程主要讓學生了解運動訓練與身體活動之基本概念，對於學生在未來從事不同族群之運動訓練應用與實務操作具備有應有的基本原則。課程中分為學科與實務操作部分，在身體活動之學科部分簡述運動訓練法、營養與健康與不同族群體適能指導原則，術科以實務操作方式進行不同族群體適能量測原理與操作課程(以國民體適能指導員-初級考核能力為主)；在健康促進課程部分，會以公共衛生之角度說明台灣在人口老化與長照政策之變革、族群健康與疾病發展與運動健康促進計畫為課程主軸，並以運動健康促進之觀點設計健康促進計畫。
This course mainly allows students to understand the basic concepts of exercise training methods and principles for improvement of physical activities in different populations. The course is divided into discipline and practical operation parts. In the discipline part of exercise training for physical activities, the physiological adaptation, nutrition management, specific physical fitness analysis and special population fitness will be briefly described. Besides, it will also introduce the ageing of Taiwan's population and long-term care policies, ageing and disease development, exercise health promotion plans, and physical activity assessments as the perspective of public health. Taken together, the exercise health promotion plans will be designed according to the principles of exercise training and periodization.
全18週

Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.

Aquatic Activity and Sport Instruction

“Aquatic Activity and Sport Instruction” is a course that covers a variety of water sports such as swimming, water volleyball, canoeing, SUP stand-up paddling and snorkeling. It is designed to help students master basic skills, understand safety and training methods, and improve their confidence and proficiency in water leisure activity and sport. The goals of this course are: students will be able to master the basic skills of swimming, water volleyball, canoeing, SUP paddling and snorkeling, including stance, breathing, arm and leg movements, passing, catching, jumping, dunking, canoe control, SUP paddling, and snorkeling positions. Students will be able to understand the safety knowledge and emergency disposal methods of water sports, how to choose safety equipment and keep themselves safe, and take emergency measures in emergency situations. Students will be able to master the training methods of water sports, including skill training, physical training, tactical training, etc., to improve their skills and competition ability. Through this course, students will not only learn the fun of water sports, but also improve their physical fitness and water sports skills, so that they can be more confident and safer in guiding water activities.

applications of doubles tactics. To learn “the model of doubles tactics theory”

comprehensive, rapid and variable playing skills to obtain effective results or 
triumph.

Functional Training Instruction
功能性訓練指導課程有五大部分，包括基礎理論、核心穩定訓練、運動訓練處方，以及基礎理論和技巧實踐。基礎理論部分介紹了功能性訓練的概念和原理；核心穩定訓練則讓學員學習如何發展身體核心穩定性；運動訓練處方教學，讓學生了解如何量身打造訓練方案，針對客戶個人需求提供專業的訓練建議。最後，基礎理論和技巧實踐部分讓學生實踐所學並了解常見訓練技巧，讓學生能夠應用在日常訓練及工作職場中。
The Functional Training Instruction has five main components, including basic theory, core stability training, exercise training prescription, and basic theory and technique practice. The fundamental theory section introduces the concepts and principles of functional training; the core stability training section allows students to learn how to develop core stability; and the sports training prescription section provides students with an understanding of how to tailor training programs to provide professional training advice to meet the needs of individual clients. Finally, the fundamental theory and skills in practice section allows students to practice what they have learned and understand common training techniques that they can apply in their daily training and in the workplace.

本課程目地為建立學生的言語科學基礎。主要的範圍為言語產生的解剖學與生理學。討論的範圍有呼吸(聲門下)系統、喉部系統、構音(共鳴) 系統。學生也同時學習言語產生之理論。
This course aims to help graduate students to establish a solid foundation in the field of speech sciences, especially the anatomy, physiology, and theory of speech sciences.  Four major areas including speech breathing, laryngeal physiology, articulatory and resonance mechanisms are discussed thoroughly.  In addition, the physiological equipments to monitor the respiratory, laryngeal and supralaryngeal systems during speech production are introduced.

Phonetics and Acoustic Phonetics
本課程是為未來聽語臨床工作者所設計之基礎語音學及語音聲學課程。在這門課中，透過不同語言中的語音實例，探討人類的發音器官、語音本質、產生語音的方法及說話時的語音聽知覺與聲學變化。學生在這門課中亦將學習國際音標符號，並使用這些音標及符號標示及描述或記錄語音。本課程亦將帶領學生學習語音聲學分析，學生將熟悉語音聲學分析的學理基礎、以及語音分析軟體的實務操作。
This is an introduction to areas of phonetics of languages in the world geared towards speech-language pathologists and audiologists. Students will explore their articulators and learn how individuals produce and perceive speech sounds. They will also explore various topics regarding speech sounds and learn to describe and transcribe sounds in spoken languages.
This course is also designed to introduce the acoustic aspects of speech production and speech perception.  Students will learn software implementation of acoustic analysis.  This course covers the acoustic theory of speech production, and the practical applications for the acoustic analysis of speech.  The acoustic characteristics of Mandarin speech sounds will also be included.

Swallowing  Disorders Practicum

From knowledge of swallowing problems of head and neck cancer and neurologic impairments, the students should learn compensatory strategies, direct therapy and indirect therapy from hands on practice to build up their clinical skills for swallowing disorders.

History of Artistic Culture
透過藝術文化的類型與不同的表現形式及中西方藝術的演進與賞析，瞭解藝術的理念、內涵與歷史演變，深入探討藝術與生命、美感與生活、藝術與文化等重要議題之意義。培養學生對藝術文化有基本的認識與高度的敏感度，提升審美素養，持續自主學習的興趣。
Through the exploration of various types and form of art and culture, as well as the evolution and appreciation of Eastern and Western art, this course provides an understanding of the concepts, meaning and historical transformations of arts. It further delves deeply into significant topics such as art and life, aesthetics and everyday life, and art and culture. Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.

Adult  Hearing Clinical Practicum
該課程主要目的要培養學生的臨床道德觀念，並將課堂上所習得之理論實際運用於成人語言、言語、吞嚥障礙的臨床評估和治療。透過實習課程，讓學生對成人語言、言語、吞嚥的臨床評估和治療有更完整的概念。
This course aims to provide students with the skills and knowledge to be competent in assessing  adults  with suspected disorders of hearing and  provide intervention services based on assessment to individuals with hearing loss.

Freshman English I
本課程為一學期兩小時兩學分的閱讀課程。教學重點為文法重點複習、閱讀技巧及練習、普通英文文章閱讀。於該課程中學生能熟練高初級至初中級(high beginning ~ low-intermediate level)基本文法重點，學習並運用各種英文閱讀技巧，閱讀並理解高初級至初中級(high beginning ~ low-intermediate level)普通英文文章。
This is a one-semester course which is worth two credits and includes a two-hour reading instruction each week. The main contents of the course consist of: grammar review, reading skills and practice, and general English text reading. In this course, students are expected to become familiar with English grammar (from high beginning ~ low-intermediate level), learn different reading skills, and apply the skills to their comprehension of English texts (from high beginning ~ low-intermediate level).
全18週

Pediatric Physiology
本課程以學生在高職學校學得之生物學知識為基礎，協助其更進一步瞭解人體生理學原理及探討比較幼兒生理功能之基本知識，並強調各器官系統間之調節機轉。內容包括細胞生理學、神經與肌肉生理學、循環生理學、呼吸生理學、消化道生理、腎臟生理學、代謝之調節、生殖生理及內分泌學。
The purpose of this course is to introduce basic conception of pediatric physiological development, function and regulatory mechanisms in every system. Let students use physiologic knowledge to infant and child care in the future. The contents include cellular physiology, pediatric physiology of nervous system, skeletal and muscular system, cardiovascular system, respiratory system, gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and endocrine system.

people and teamwork attitude.

遊戲係嬰幼兒生活中的主要活動。嬰幼兒不但從遊戲中得到樂趣，更透過遊戲來瞭解周遭生活世界，消化日常生活經驗。在遊戲中嬰幼兒之體能、創造力、認知能力、社會情緒能力等各方面均得以發展；即遊戲促進嬰幼兒身心健康且與學習緊密結合。本課程主要內容包含遊戲之基本概念、遊戲理論、遊戲與身心發展之關係、遊戲行為之發展、遊戲之觀察、遊戲素材與安全、物理環境設計、以及成人在嬰幼兒遊戲中應當扮演之角色；學生應根據課堂所學，依嬰幼兒之發展差異進行遊戲活動設計。
Play enhances both physical and mental health of children and is the Way it learns. The major contents for this class include：theories of play； the relationship between play and the physical-mental development；development of play behavior；play observation；play materials；physic environmental design. Students will also be able to design play for children in its different development stages by using what they learned in this course.
全18週

History of Artistic Culture
透過藝術文化的類型與不同的表現形式及中西方藝術的演進與賞析，瞭解藝術的理念、內涵與歷史演變，深入探討藝術與生命、美感與生活、藝術與文化等重要議題之意義。培養學生對藝術文化有基本的認識與高度的敏感度，提升審美素養，持續自主學習的興趣。
Through the exploration of various types and form of art and culture, as well as the evolution and appreciation of Eastern and Western art, this course provides an understanding of the concepts, meaning and historical transformations of arts. It further delves deeply into significant topics such as art and life, aesthetics and everyday life, and art and culture. Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.

01
Philosophy and Life
「哲學與人生」是對「人的生命」所作的「哲學反省」。人，作為自然的、社會的、歷史的存在，在他所生活的世界中，面臨著繁複多樣、瞬息萬變的問題：處境、命運、愛情、知識、道德、藝術、宗教、臨終與死亡……其中有些問題事實上已經深深困擾著我們，另外一些則伺機突襲，在我們還來不及準備的時候，就被迫面對。生命的意義究竟是什麼？本課程嘗試以深入淺出的討論，藉由過去、當代人物的所感、所思，促進學習者進一步反省自我生命之種種。
Philosophy and Life is as a philosophical reflective thinking for the life.
Human beings, as natural, social and historical beings, face a great many complex varied and fast changing problems in the life-world, for example, love, destiny, knowledge, morality, art, religion, dying, and moreover the death so on.... Actually some of them have deeply perplexed us, while others watch for their chances to attack there would leave no time for covering our ears and we are merely compelled to confront with them. After all, what does Life mean?
Whereas this course tries to take up by the way a kind of discussion in explaining the profound in simple terms, and in making use of whatever in history, or the present age somebody's feeling and thinking, in order to promote the students to question themselves more about, and reflect further on all sorts of life-self.
全18週

Education for Young Children with Special Needs
此課程主要幫助學生認識特殊幼兒教育及早期療育實施依據，了解特殊需求幼兒類別、鑑定方式及流程；各類別特殊需求幼兒之學習特質、輔導策略及相關資源，並學習設計個別化教育計畫，理解學前融合教育之重要，及涵養學生對於特殊需求幼兒接納關懷之正向態度。
The focus of this course is to help students to know special education for children and the practice basis for early intervention, as well as understanding the categories of children with special needs, the assessment methods, and the process; also the learning traits, counseling strategies, and relevant resources for children with special needs in each category. The students are also learning to design individualized education program, to realize the importance of
early integrated education, and to cultivate their positive attitudes of acceptance and care towards children with special needs.

PE-Table Tennis3
此課程是先學習與養成良好的基本技術與接發球技術後
再加強雙打戰術理論與應用。學習「雙打戰術理論模式」就是以理論為基礎，以提升雙
打戰術觀念。而雙打注重的是技術與兩位球員搭配之默契並運用各種戰術以全面、快速、
變化之打法獲得有效之成果或在比賽中贏取勝利。
In this course, a player should learn and cultivate good basic skills and the 
skills in receiving and serving the ball first, and then reinforce the theory and 
applications of doubles tactics. To learn “the model of doubles tactics theory” 
is to enhance the concept of doubles tactics based on theories. In doubles, the 
skills and the unspoken consensus of cooperation between the two players 
are emphasized; also, various kinds of tactics are applied, so as to use 
comprehensive, rapid and variable playing skills to obtain effective results or 
triumph.

Contents of this course include principles for the design of classrooms and other learning spaces, guidelines for the design and arrangement of learning centers, and observation and evaluation skills of learning centers. Students will explore, plan, arrange, and evaluate the design of various learning areas.
全18週

Infant and Child Care Practicum II

01
Gender and Healthcare
本課程以性別主流化的概念為基礎，透過個體啟蒙、意識覺醒與行為實踐的過程，將引導學生論述於不同醫學專科領域之性別議題，且能辨識家庭、工作職場、社會福利和醫療環境中的性別平等政策。以期使學生能發展具有性別平等的概念，並應用於健康照護的情境中。
This course is based on the concept of gender mainstreaming. We hope that through the process of enlightenment, awareness and practice that could help student to understand the gender perspective in different area of medical specialties, and to identify the relation for gender concept among family, workplace, social welfare, and health policy. The student would develop the vision and ability of gender analysis, and take action with gender perspective which applies in nursing care.
全18週

Freshman English I
本課程為一學期兩小時兩學分的閱讀課程。教學重點為文法重點複習、閱讀技巧及練習、普通英文文章閱讀。於該課程中學生能熟練高初級至初中級(high beginning ~ low-intermediate level)基本文法重點，學習並運用各種英文閱讀技巧，閱讀並理解高初級至初中級(high beginning ~ low-intermediate level)普通英文文章。
This is a one-semester course which is worth two credits and includes a two-hour reading instruction each week. The main contents of the course consist of: grammar review, reading skills and practice, and general English text reading. In this course, students are expected to become familiar with English grammar (from high beginning ~ low-intermediate level), learn different reading skills, and apply the skills to their comprehension of English texts (from high beginning ~ low-intermediate level).

本課程為每學期兩學分。教學內容包括已熟練的基本文法運用、新聞英語文章的閱讀技巧，理解高級英語對話，能了解並運用複雜的英語句型會話、聽懂報導及節目，並能用英語口語溝通。強調英語上課環境，學生用英語參與討論演說。班級人數可為小班制。
The course is designed for students who are prepared to take GEPT (high-intermediate level), and able to pass it successfully after this course. This course will help students improve their ability to communicate in English in a wide range of situations. Students will undergo all the necessary presentation and communication skills and will have a great of opportunities to speak loud in classroom with confidence. Students will thus know how to use the communication skills which they need to succeed in business or at office and will enlarge their knowledge of the business world. 

Students will develop essential communication skills such as making presentations, taking part in meetings, negotiating, telephoning, and using English in social situations. Students will become more confident in using English at the job market and increase their career prospects.
全18週

Human Development
本課程主要目的在探討人類自生命發生至終結整個過程中，各發展階段之重要現象、影響因素及後續反應。主要之理論架構包涵生理、心理、社會文化及靈性層面各種重要觀點，課程特別強調發展危機和任務及健康需求，期能使學習者獲得全面性之觀念與實務性之經驗探討，以增進學生具備了解「人」的基本知識與能力。
This course proposes students can understand a developmental process of human, and characteristics of individual's behavior patterns in each development stages. Then students can learn the strategies of prevention and adjustment for themselves. The development process of human starts from fertilization to death, that includes the beginning of life , infancy , toddler , childhood , adolescent , adulthood ,middle age , old age and death.

Chemistry
本課程旨在從基本之化學概念，引導學生進入自然科學之領域。由最簡單之物質概述“原子”闡述，漸序進入更大分子領域，進而對有關人體之各巨觀化學現象的了解。並以深入淺出之教學方法，並配合日後生物化學等相關課程，將著重於加強有機化學，分析化學等內容作更深入的探討。
Students of the biological sciences require a good grounding in chemistry if they are to fully 
understand key aspects of their courses.  The course is divided into 17 sections containing 59 topics. Each topic consists of a key notes panel with concise statements of the key points covered. These are expanded on in the main part of the topic which includes simple and clear black and white figures which many readily be reproduced for essays or examinations for example.

01
Psychology
本課程主要內容是以心理學各種基礎理論、研究方法及重要實驗為主，進而擴展應用於心理衛生各種人類生活適應行為及生活層面。課程綱要包括心理學的起源與發展、基礎理論與研究方法、行為的生物學基礎、意識狀態、感覺與知覺、學習與行為、記憶、思維與智力、心理評量:人格與智力測驗、人類發展、動機與情緒、人格、壓力與衝突、異常行為、心理治療方式、社會知覺與認知、態度、社會影響與互動。
The main content of this curriculum is to expand and apply the fundamental theory, research method, and important experiment in psychology to mental health in various living line includes the origin and development of psychology, fundamental theory and research method, fundamentals of behavioral biology, consciousness, sensation and perception, leaning, cognition, memory, thinking and intelligence, psychological assessment, personality and intelligence test, human development, motivation and emotion, personality stress and conflict, abnormal behavior psychotherapeutics social perception, cognition, attitude, and social influence and interaction.
全18週

Chinese Literature I

In this course students will study representative works of classical and modern literature, with an imphasise on improving verbal skills such as reading, writing, speaking and appreciation for Chinese literature. 01
Human Anatomy
本課程是以學習人體解剖學課程內容為主要目標，包括: 細胞及組織的認識，骨骼、肌肉、循環、神經、呼吸、消化、泌尿、內分泌和生殖系統構造的瞭解，並靈活應用於護理專業基礎及專業核心課程之學習。
The purpose of this course is to introduce anatomical principles  and mechanism of body 
structure, and further helps students to integrate related concepts and understand the relationship 
between structures and their functions. The contents include cellular anatomy, skeletal system, 
anatomy of nerve and muscle, central nervous system, cardiovascular system, respiratory system, 
digestive system, urinary system, reproductive system, endocrine system and applied surface 
anatomy

Laboratory of Human Anatomy

understanding microscopic anatomy, the structure of skeletal system, nerve and muscle, central

Information Literacy and Network Application

01
History of Artistic Culture
透過藝術文化的類型與不同的表現形式及中西方藝術的演進與賞析，瞭解藝術的理念、內涵與歷史演變，深入探討藝術與生命、美感與生活、藝術與文化等重要議題之意義。培養學生對藝術文化有基本的認識與高度的敏感度，提升審美素養，持續自主學習的興趣。
Through the exploration of various types and form of art and culture, as well as the evolution and appreciation of Eastern and Western art, this course provides an understanding of the concepts, meaning and historical transformations of arts. It further delves deeply into significant topics such as art and life, aesthetics and everyday life, and art and culture. Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.

Caring and Communication
本課程旨在培養學生具備關懷與溝通的能力。課程內容包含了解關懷的內涵、引導學生從認識自己、關懷自我，延伸至關懷家人及關懷他人，並在人際互動中展現關懷與溝通的技巧與行為。
The aims of the course are to improve the self- awareness of the student, to nurture the competence of communication and caring. P E-Fundamental Movement Capacities

Chinese Literature I
本課程摘選古典文學及現代文學之代表作品，著重培養學生閱讀、欣賞、寫作、口語表達等語言文字能力，並提升學生閱讀興趣、拓展人文視野，增進學生人文精神與文化涵養，進而落實至生活中，以培養獨立思考、理性自主的健全人格。
In this course students will study representative works of classical and modern literature, with an imphasise on improving verbal skills such as reading, writing, speaking and appreciation for Chinese literature. Human Anatomy
本課程是以學習人體解剖學課程內容為主要目標，包括: 細胞及組織的認識，骨骼、肌肉、循環、神經、呼吸、消化、泌尿、內分泌和生殖系統構造的瞭解，並靈活應用於護理專業基礎及專業核心課程之學習。
The purpose of this course is to introduce anatomical principles  and mechanism of body 
structure, and further helps students to integrate related concepts and understand the relationship 
between structures and their functions. The contents include cellular anatomy, skeletal system, 
anatomy of nerve and muscle, central nervous system, cardiovascular system, respiratory system, 
digestive system, urinary system, reproductive system, endocrine system and applied surface 
anatomy

History of Artistic Culture
透過藝術文化的類型與不同的表現形式及中西方藝術的演進與賞析，瞭解藝術的理念、內涵與歷史演變，深入探討藝術與生命、美感與生活、藝術與文化等重要議題之意義。培養學生對藝術文化有基本的認識與高度的敏感度，提升審美素養，持續自主學習的興趣。
Through the exploration of various types and form of art and culture, as well as the evolution and appreciation of Eastern and Western art, this course provides an understanding of the concepts, meaning and historical transformations of arts. It further delves deeply into significant topics such as art and life, aesthetics and everyday life, and art and culture. Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.
全18週

Caring and Communication
本課程旨在培養學生具備關懷與溝通的能力。課程內容包含了解關懷的內涵、引導學生從認識自己、關懷自我，延伸至關懷家人及關懷他人，並在人際互動中展現關懷與溝通的技巧與行為。
The aims of the course are to improve the self- awareness of the student, to nurture the competence of communication and caring. The art of caring, caring and nursing, critical attributes of communication, communication model and related factors. The course emphasizes self-refection, student will be able to integrate the knowledge, attitude and skills of communication and caring, to aware self’s pattern of communication, analyze the influences in daily life and nursing performance, willing to change, and demonstrate communication skill and caring in daily life.

Human Development
本課程主要目的在探討人類自生命發生至終結整個過程中，各發展階段之重要現象、影響因素及後續反應。主要之理論架構包涵生理、心理、社會文化及靈性層面各種重要觀點，課程特別強調發展危機和任務及健康需求，期能使學習者獲得全面性之觀念與實務性之經驗探討，以增進學生具備了解「人」的基本知識與能力。
This course proposes students can understand a developmental process of human, and characteristics of individual's behavior patterns in each development stages. Then students can learn the strategies of prevention and adjustment for themselves. The development process of human starts from fertilization to death, that includes the beginning of life , infancy , toddler , childhood , adolescent , adulthood ,middle age , old age and death.

Chemistry
本課程旨在從基本之化學概念，引導學生進入自然科學之領域。由最簡單之物質概述“原子”闡述，漸序進入更大分子領域，進而對有關人體之各巨觀化學現象的了解。並以深入淺出之教學方法，並配合日後生物化學等相關課程，將著重於加強有機化學，分析化學等內容作更深入的探討。
Students of the biological sciences require a good grounding in chemistry if they are to fully 
understand key aspects of their courses.  The course is divided into 17 sections containing 59 topics. Each topic consists of a key notes panel with concise statements of the key points covered. These are expanded on in the main part of the topic which includes simple and clear black and white figures which many readily be reproduced for essays or examinations for example.

Psychology
本課程主要內容是以心理學各種基礎理論、研究方法及重要實驗為主，進而擴展應用於心理衛生各種人類生活適應行為及生活層面。課程綱要包括心理學的起源與發展、基礎理論與研究方法、行為的生物學基礎、意識狀態、感覺與知覺、學習與行為、記憶、思維與智力、心理評量:人格與智力測驗、人類發展、動機與情緒、人格、壓力與衝突、異常行為、心理治療方式、社會知覺與認知、態度、社會影響與互動。
The main content of this curriculum is to expand and apply the fundamental theory, research method, and important experiment in psychology to mental health in various living line includes the origin and development of psychology, fundamental theory and research method, fundamentals of behavioral biology, consciousness, sensation and perception, leaning, cognition, memory, thinking and intelligence, psychological assessment, personality and intelligence test, human development, motivation and emotion, personality stress and conflict, abnormal behavior psychotherapeutics social perception, cognition, attitude, and social influence and interaction.
全18週

Caring and Communication
本課程旨在培養學生具備關懷與溝通的能力。課程內容包含了解關懷的內涵、引導學生從認識自己、關懷自我，延伸至關懷家人及關懷他人，並在人際互動中展現關懷與溝通的技巧與行為。
The aims of the course are to improve the self- awareness of the student, to nurture the competence of communication and caring. The course contents include the relationships among people to people, people to society, people to environment and spirit. The art of caring, caring and nursing, critical attributes of communication, communication model and related factors. The course emphasizes self-refection, student will be able to integrate the knowledge, attitude and skills of communication and caring, to aware self’s pattern of communication, analyze the influences in daily life and nursing performance, willing to change, and demonstrate communication skill and caring in daily life.
全18週

Human Development
本課程主要目的在探討人類自生命發生至終結整個過程中，各發展階段之重要現象、影響因素及後續反應。主要之理論架構包涵生理、心理、社會文化及靈性層面各種重要觀點，課程特別強調發展危機和任務及健康需求，期能使學習者獲得全面性之觀念與實務性之經驗探討，以增進學生具備了解「人」的基本知識與能力。
This course proposes students can understand a developmental process of human, and characteristics of individual's behavior patterns in each development stages. Then students can learn the strategies of prevention and adjustment for themselves. The development process of human starts from fertilization to death, that includes the beginning of life , infancy , toddler , childhood , adolescent , adulthood ,middle age , old age and death.

Chemistry
本課程旨在從基本之化學概念，引導學生進入自然科學之領域。由最簡單之物質概述“原子”闡述，漸序進入更大分子領域，進而對有關人體之各巨觀化學現象的了解。並以深入淺出之教學方法，並配合日後生物化學等相關課程，將著重於加強有機化學，分析化學等內容作更深入的探討。
Students of the biological sciences require a good grounding in chemistry if they are to fully 
understand key aspects of their courses.  The course is divided into 17 sections containing 59 topics. Each topic consists of a key notes panel with concise statements of the key points covered. These are expanded on in the main part of the topic which includes simple and clear black and white figures which many readily be reproduced for essays or examinations for example.

Psychology
本課程主要內容是以心理學各種基礎理論、研究方法及重要實驗為主，進而擴展應用於心理衛生各種人類生活適應行為及生活層面。課程綱要包括心理學的起源與發展、基礎理論與研究方法、行為的生物學基礎、意識狀態、感覺與知覺、學習與行為、記憶、思維與智力、心理評量:人格與智力測驗、人類發展、動機與情緒、人格、壓力與衝突、異常行為、心理治療方式、社會知覺與認知、態度、社會影響與互動。
The main content of this curriculum is to expand and apply the fundamental theory, research method, and important experiment in psychology to mental health in various living line includes the origin and development of psychology, fundamental theory and research method, fundamentals of behavioral biology, consciousness, sensation and perception, leaning, cognition, memory, thinking and intelligence, psychological assessment, personality and intelligence test, human development, motivation and emotion, personality stress and conflict, abnormal behavior psychotherapeutics social perception, cognition, attitude, and social influence and interaction.
全18週

Human Anatomy
本課程是以學習人體解剖學課程內容為主要目標，包括: 細胞及組織的認識，骨骼、肌肉、循環、神經、呼吸、消化、泌尿、內分泌和生殖系統構造的瞭解，並靈活應用於護理專業基礎及專業核心課程之學習。
The purpose of this course is to introduce anatomical principles  and mechanism of body 
structure, and further helps students to integrate related concepts and understand the relationship 
between structures and their functions. The contents include cellular anatomy, skeletal system, 
anatomy of nerve and muscle, central nervous system, cardiovascular system, respiratory system, 
digestive system, urinary system, reproductive system, endocrine system and applied surface 
anatomy

History of Artistic Culture
透過藝術文化的類型與不同的表現形式及中西方藝術的演進與賞析，瞭解藝術的理念、內涵與歷史演變，深入探討藝術與生命、美感與生活、藝術與文化等重要議題之意義。培養學生對藝術文化有基本的認識與高度的敏感度，提升審美素養，持續自主學習的興趣。
Through the exploration of various types and form of art and culture, as well as the evolution and appreciation of Eastern and Western art, this course provides an understanding of the concepts, meaning and historical transformations of arts. It further delves deeply into significant topics such as art and life, aesthetics and everyday life, and art and culture. Students will acquire a foundational comprehension and heightened sensitivity of art and culture, enhance their aesthetic literacy, and foster a sustained commitment to self-directed education.

本課程為一學期兩小時兩學分的課程。由英語中級程度提昇至中高級之訓練課程。教學重點為職場英語常用字彙、句法、對話技巧及其應用。於該課程中學生能熟悉並練習職場英語常用字彙、句法、對話技巧。
This is a two-hour weekly and one-semester course which is worth two credits. This is an intermediate to high-intermediate level English course. The main contents of the course consist of: common English vocabulary in workplace, business English dialogue expressions, communication skills in workplace, and the application of communication skills. In this course, students are expected: (a) to become familiar with common English vocabulary in workplace, business English dialogue expressions, and communication skills; and (b) to apply common English vocabulary in workplace and business English dialogue expressions to their everyday English conversations.

Journalistic English
本課程為每學期兩學分。教學內容包括熟練新聞句法、新聞用字及新聞英語中文章的閱讀技巧及其應用，是突破中級程度進階至中高級或高級之最佳訓練課程，學生能聽懂新聞廣播、閱讀新聞報導及收看新聞節目。
This course includes two hours of instruction each week and is worth two credits. This course focuses on the application of different listening and reading strategies for comprehending the latest news, including those related to nursing and health sciences published in Times as well as at BBC, CNN, and New York Times websites. Students are expected to learn the information related to the news and become familiar with the vocabulary and sentence structures contained in the news. Students are also expected to participate in the following activities: discussing issues related to the news, giving presentations, and criticizing each piece of news as well as other peers’ presentation performances in the classroom. In addition, students also need to study the materials at http://140.131.85.13/enginfo/myABC/index.htm for NTUNHS Joint Exams.
全18週

Physical Examination and Practice
本課程旨在提供已具有解剖、生理、病理及心理學知識的學習者，學習身體評估之知識與技巧。課程目標在增進學生身體評估技術的正確性與完整性，進而培育學生關懷、溝通與合作的專業素養; 教學策略將針對不足之學理，進行澄清和討論，各項評估能力則利用角色扮演並藉由示教及分組練習，使學生能有系統的進行個案整體性的身體評估。課程內涵強調以人為本及整體觀，使學生能於設計的模擬情境中展現臨床決策、溝通能力、關懷與專業倫理，並應用於護理情境中。
This course is designed to provide students who already have knowledge of anatomy and physiology to learn the knowledge and skills of physical examination. The goal of the course is to improve the correctness and completeness of students' physical examination techniques, thereby develop students' professional qualities of care, communication, and cooperation. The teaching strategy will be to clarify and discuss deficiencies in academic theory, and to practice physical examination through role-play, demonstration, and group practice. Thereafter, students can systematically conduct a comprehensive physical examination of different cases. The content of the course emphasizes a person-centered and holistic view, enabling students to demonstrate clinical decision-making, communication skills, caring and professional ethics in designed simulated situations, and allow students to apply them in actual nursing situations.

01
Pathology
病理學是探討疾病的原因、機轉、病理變化及過程、預後等的一門學問 課程分二大部分1.概論2.各論。 概論主要介紹外來的傷害與疾病的刺激對細胞與組織所造成的共通的變化、與反應與機轉。詳細內容包括細胞傷害與死亡、炎症與癒合、細胞生長發育的異常、體液代謝障礙、免疫與腫瘤、遺傳、代謝與營養疾病。 各論討論各器官系統其各類疾病的致病原因、機轉，病理變化及臨床表現等。詳細 的內容包括心臟血管系統疾病、呼吸系統疾病、肝臟及膽管系統疾病、消化系統及 胰臟疾病、內分泌系統疾病、血液與淋巴系統疾病、腎臟疾病、男性生殖系統疾病、
The scientific focus of pathology is on the etiology of disease, the mechanisms of pathogenesis, and the pathways by which morphologic changes occur.  Pathogenesis of diseases will be discussed on the molecular basis to facilitate the understanding of difficult concepts. The content of this coursed are design to fit the requirement for who will be working in the field of nursing.   
The curriculum is divided into 2 major parts: (1) General Pathology and (2) Systemic Pathology.      General Pathology introduces the effects of exogenous injurious agents on the cells and tissues, and the resultant cellular changes, reactions and diseases.  The contents include: introduction, cell injury and cell death, metabolic disturbances of the body fluids, immunologic disorders, inflammation and repair, neoplasia, genetic disorders, chemical and physical injuries and metabolic and nutritional diseases.    
Systemic pathology discusses the etiology and pathogenesis of various disease entities from the aspects of each organ system.  This covers the diseases of the cardiovascular system,  the respiratory system, the digestive system, the musculoskeletal system and nervous system;   the disorders of the endocrines, the kidneys, the male reproductive organs, the breast and the female reproductive organs and the skin.
全18週

Nutrition & Nutrition Experiment
本課程是以營養學為基礎，搭配如理想體重、飲食指南、飲食指標、DRIs、食物代換表、營養標示等單元介紹，並以六大類營養素為主軸結合疾病療養學的應用，例如介紹熱量的概念後，以體重控制為例；介紹碳水化合物的生理功能後，搭配糖尿病的飲食保健；介紹脂肪的生理功能時，搭配心血管疾病的飲食保健；在蛋白質單元課程則與慢性腎衰竭營養治療飲食原則結合；維生素單元以抗氧化劑的介紹為搭配；礦物質的介紹則以骨質疏鬆症的營養保健搭配；另一方面介紹住院病人營養評估、營養支持與腸道營養配方等單元，讓學生可以把基礎營養學與相關的疾病營養照護的概念聯成一氣，培育保健照護產業中關懷助人及敬業樂群的護理專業實務人才。

as body weight management, dietary guideline, dietary goal, DRIs, exchange list, 
nutrition label.The second part introduces the nutritional care and the diet therapy on 
various diseases, such as obesity, DM, atherosclerosis disease, chronic renal failure, 
osteoporosis, nutritional deficiency (such anemia) etc.

01
Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
