Data analysis and decision making in health care and management
本科目於教學設計上，乃著眼於進階資料庫管理與統合健康資料分析方法之實務操作，目標在於提昇學生臨床資料分析、獨立個案分析、管理與分析統計相關資料之能力。課程中將運用SAS統計套裝軟體來學習以下統計資料管理與分析策略：1)建立資料庫關聯檔案並進行資料庫整合工作；2)迴歸分析統計策略；3)分類與診斷分析; 4)臨床試驗分析等。整體而言，選修本課程之學生，將透過課程講授、實際練習操作統計套裝軟體及實例研討等方法，落實學習進階計量資料分析與管理。
The objective of this course is to provide students with advanced practical applications of bio-statistical methods by running the SAS statistical software. Several clinical data in the health related agendas will demonstrate and analyze effectively. Major topics and headings will include (1) overview of SAS statistical software, (2) data arrangement, (3) regression analysis, (4) classification and diagnosis analysis, (5) clinical trial. The advance ability toward the management of quantity data will be the core of teaching plan and interactive procedure. The aims of this course are to promote and reinforce students actually understand the whole-spectrum of advanced statistics and its practical directions.

過去由於健康照護產業的高度專業化及資訊的不對等，在醫療及健康照護服務輸送過程中，病人或服務使用者通常扮演著弱勢的角色，其需求與期望往往不受到服務提供者的重視。然而近年來，處在消費者意識高漲的氛圍下，以及由於以病人為導向的健康照護(patient-centered health care)模式獲致良好的臨床成效，同時健康照護產業競爭趨於白熱化等因素，健康照護服務提供者開始重視以市場為導向的健康照護服務輸送模式，行銷的概念於焉形成。本課程運用服務業行銷(Service Marketing)之概念、理論、與實務
The purpose of the lesson is to provide students with organized understanding on essential elements and principles of marketing and its practices in health care.

Introduction of Professional Law
本課程醫護法學之介紹，使學生對法律結構、法學理念及我國現行法有一整體性的認知，以奠定法學啟發基礎。從醫護正義概念出發，就醫護法規、醫護法制、護理法律責任與訴訟、醫護人員切身法律問題等，深入淺出有系統的介紹，以培養現代醫護人員正確的法律觀。並從醫護業務與法律實務的角度，點出護理人員與其他醫事人員的責任分際、臨床醫護人員與公共衛生醫護人員面臨法律問題的不同、醫病糾紛的預防與處理等，以強化醫護人員處理法律問題的能力。
This subject is taught by way of the introduction of the basic law to let the students to understand the whole outline of the construction of law，the virtue of the jurisprudence and the  present law in Taiwan.  It begins as the teaching of the concept of the professional justice and is succeeded by introducing the medical and nursing law，the institution of the professional law，the responsibility and litigation as well as the professional liability of the member of professional society to ensure the students to know the exact concept of the law and to develop problem-solving abilities .

Healthcare Marketing
過去由於健康照護產業的高度專業化及資訊的不對等，在醫療及健康照護服務輸送過程中，病人或服務使用者通常扮演著弱勢的角色，其需求與期望往往不受到服務提供者的重視。然而近年來，處在消費者意識高漲的氛圍下，以及由於以病人為導向的健康照護(patient-centered health care)模式獲致良好的臨床成效，同時健康照護產業競爭趨於白熱化等因素，健康照護服務提供者開始重視以市場為導向的健康照護服務輸送模式，行銷的概念於焉形成。本課程運用服務業行銷(Service Marketing)之概念、理論、與實務
The purpose of the lesson is to provide students with organized understanding on essential elements and principles of marketing and its practices in health care.

Introduction of Professional Law
本課程醫護法學之介紹，使學生對法律結構、法學理念及我國現行法有一整體性的認知，以奠定法學啟發基礎。從醫護正義概念出發，就醫護法規、醫護法制、護理法律責任與訴訟、醫護人員切身法律問題等，深入淺出有系統的介紹，以培養現代醫護人員正確的法律觀。並從醫護業務與法律實務的角度，點出護理人員與其他醫事人員的責任分際、臨床醫護人員與公共衛生醫護人員面臨法律問題的不同、醫病糾紛的預防與處理等，以強化醫護人員處理法律問題的能力。
This subject is taught by way of the introduction of the basic law to let the students to understand the whole outline of the construction of law，the virtue of the jurisprudence and the  present law in Taiwan.  It begins as the teaching of the concept of the professional justice and is succeeded by introducing the medical and nursing law，the institution of the professional law，the responsibility and litigation as well as the professional liability of the member of professional society to ensure the students to know the exact concept of the law and to develop problem-solving abilities .
全18週

PE-Table Tennis2
學習與養成良好的各種基本技術後並加強比賽技術、戰
術的應用與結合，以期能在桌球比賽中獲得有效成果。如有優質的各種基本技術及搭配
單打戰術應用就能在比賽中直接得分與攻擊。在比賽技術中有良好優質的接發球戰術就
能先發制人，且能有效控制對方直接攻擊得分，其贏球機率高。因此在單打技術、戰術
應用桌球技術中佔有極重要性。
After learning and cultivating various kinds of basic skills, 
a player should reinforce the applications and combinations of singles and 
tactics, aiming to have effective results in table tennis games. If a player has 
various kinds of superior basic skills combined with the applications of singles 
tactics, he/she can score and attack directly in a game. In terms of singles, if a 
player has superior tactics for receiving and serving the ball, he/she can take 
the initiative and control his/her opponent effectively to attack and score 
directly, so that he/she will have a greater chance to win the game; therefore, 
such tactics has great importance in table tennis skills regarding singles and 
tactics applications.

The course also briefs the current state of technology applications, and identifies the possibility of cross-domain integration that includes the domains on health tourism, management, information technology, the long-term care, and speech language pathology and audiology. Based on the understanding of cross-domain background, students can propose business plan to fulfill the requirement of cross-domain applications on healthcare domain.

01
Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
全18週

01
Health Economics
不同於經濟學原理的理論基礎，健康經濟學課程
強調經濟學於健康照護的應用。由於我國已實施全民健康保險，健康照護產
業的生態，形成衛福部健保署與醫療產業間資本要素的獨買型態。因此，本
課程將針對此一特性，分別先導入健康和醫療照護，再分別介紹醫療照護、
醫療保險的需求，以及醫療照護生產及成本，最後再帶入政府所扮演的角
色。之後再分別介紹健康照護相關的產業，並針對我國長期照護及全民健康
保險制度加以著墨，期使同學修習完本課程之後，能對健康經濟學的應用有
初步的認識。
Health economics is a branch of economics concerned with issues related to efficiency, effectiveness,value and behavior in the production and consumption of health and healthcare. It is worth to be mentioned, the demand for health is unlike most other goods because individuals allocate resources in order to both consume and produce health. This course focus on allocating health care resource reasonably and making an effort to avoid catching the common cold affects people other than the decision maker or finding sustainable, humane and effective solutions to the opioid epidemic.
全18週

Internet of Things on Healthcare
本課程將以物聯網資訊促進健康發展為基礎導論，分別由健康、亞健康以及失能照護等分階段進行簡介，其中特別著重高齡照護議題，藉由專家訪談、案例分享，及進行課堂討論，讓學員認識健康照護物聯網的應用之效益。
在資訊技術的導引方面，物聯網的概念已從傳統式的單一產品與技術導向，進而邁向大規模生活應用、醫療健康、與資料分析的發展模式；本課程將引導學員從物聯網基本架構、裝置開發實務進行個案了解，並以此延伸開始認識三段五級的健康促進與預防等概念，進而激發學員發揮健康照護與醫療資訊跨領域的創新結合。
This course mainly discusses the theory of healthcare on elderly who are classified as healthy, partial healthy, and disabled. Through case analysis, trend analysis, and expert interview, students are able to explore the application of Internet of Things (IOT) technology on healthcare of elderly and the current development of healthcare industry. Internet of Things refers to the interactive activities among machines. In this course, we introduce the basic concept and the application of IOT technology, the trend and challenge of IOT technology, how to connect IOT technology and healthcare service, and the application of IOT technology on healthcare of elderly.
全18週

Mobile Application Development
本課程為教導學生撰寫行動應用軟體(Application software, Mobile
application, 或簡稱 App)。近年來，行動裝置已非常普及，無論智慧型手機
或平板電腦，這些行動裝置上的應用軟體，皆有很大的需求，因此，行動應
用軟體可說是目前當紅的應用軟體開發領域。
本教學著重於 Android 系統上的軟體開發，因此，同學應熟悉 Java 程
式語言(不熟悉的同學可一邊上課學 Android，一邊利用課外時間惡補 Java)，
上課開發環境為 Android Studio，課程包含學習使用介面、事件處理與其他
進階功能，以讓學生能具備開發行動應用軟體之能力。
Technology continues to evolve and provide us with increasingly powerful
mobile devices. Computers are no longer confined to desks and laps but instead live
in our pockets and hands. The purpose of this course is to teach students how to build
Teacher’s academic code: 9996
mobile apps for Android operating platform. We learn to write both web apps and
native apps for Android using Eclipse and the Android SDK. Moreover, the course
teaches students to think about the unique design and deployment issues that must be

Introduction of Professional Law
本課程醫護法學之介紹，使學生對法律結構、法學理念及我國現行法有一整體性的認知，以奠定法學啟發基礎。從醫護正義概念出發，就醫護法規、醫護法制、護理法律責任與訴訟、醫護人員切身法律問題等，深入淺出有系統的介紹，以培養現代醫護人員正確的法律觀。並從醫護業務與法律實務的角度，點出護理人員與其他醫事人員的責任分際、臨床醫護人員與公共衛生醫護人員面臨法律問題的不同、醫病糾紛的預防與處理等，以強化醫護人員處理法律問題的能力。
This subject is taught by way of the introduction of the basic law to let the students to understand the whole outline of the construction of law，the virtue of the jurisprudence and the  present law in Taiwan.  It begins as the teaching of the concept of the professional justice and is succeeded by introducing the medical and nursing law，the institution of the professional law，the responsibility and litigation as well as the professional liability of the member of professional society to ensure the students to know the exact concept of the law and to develop problem-solving abilities .

單打戰術應用就能在比賽中直接得分與攻擊。在比賽技術中有良好優質的接發球戰術就

After learning and cultivating various kinds of basic skills,

tactics, aiming to have effective results in table tennis games. If a player has 
various kinds of superior basic skills combined with the applications of singles 
tactics, he/she can score and attack directly in a game. In terms of singles, if a 
player has superior tactics for receiving and serving the ball, he/she can take 
the initiative and control his/her opponent effectively to attack and score 
directly, so that he/she will have a greater chance to win the game; therefore, 
such tactics has great importance in table tennis skills regarding singles and 
tactics applications.

(2) 運用企業社會資源，讓學生進行實習，拓展學生在專業實務方面之知識與經驗；
(3) 實習指導老師提供相關諮詢與輔導。
(4) 評估實習之學習成效。
(1) Let students be familiar with working environment and cultivate correct concepts and work ethic. 
(2) School utilizes social resources to have students expand their knowledge and experience in the areas of professional practice; 
(3) Instructors provide consulting and counseling. 
(4) Instructors assess students’ learning outcomes.

User Experience Design
本課程旨在介紹學生使用者體驗(UX)與使用者介面(UI)設計中使用的方法和工具。使用者體驗設計專注於產品生命週期的早期設計階段，旨在確保產品滿足使用者需求；涵蓋的範例工具和方法包括角色、場景、故事板、焦點團體、線框圖、原型設計等，以及InVision、Áxure、Balsamiq等軟體。
在本課程中，學生將透過三個團隊活動實際演練當今行動科技的產品設計中一個或多個使用者體驗設計的方法，藉以讓學生清楚瞭解使用者體驗與使用者介面設計的概括全貌。
This course provides an introduction to the fields of UX research and design. Students will gain an understanding of what is involved in UX research, including conducting interviews, evaluating systems, and analyzing systems using principles of good design. Students will also learn about the work involved in UX Design, including the generation of promising design solutions and the creation of prototypes at multiple levels of fidelity. By interleaving successive phases of UX Research and Design, students will see how to learn from inevitable mistakes and improve towards a product with a great UX.

Technology and Life
以學生現有的數理、生物背景為基礎，引導學生進入科技應用的領域。現代科技進步快速，世界日新月異，學生需具備有敏銳之觀察力與學習能力，始能跟上時代之潮流。本課程將目前先進之科技作一概念性的介紹；涵蓋有太空科技、能源應用、材料科技、生物技術、資訊科技等內容，期能一窺世界之奧妙，進而引發學習新知之動機與興趣。
At the dawn of the twenty-first century today, as every citizen of the world should have a basic scientific concept and knowledge which can serve people to make the decisions, participate in civic and cultural affairs, and join economic production activities. Also, beside the professional expertise and technology, the most important thing for the citizens is to care about humanities, develop themselves actively, and benefit the people and serve the community.
The major purpose of this course is from the new technology of modern life to induced the students knowing the basic applied science and technique concept. From the simpler chemistry, physics and biologic technology, step by step , let students know more the world and more interesting about the new matters and new technology.
The studentswho finish this course will know the basic applied science and technology and more understanding about the world we lived.
第1~14週

01
Philosophy and Life
「哲學與人生」是對「人的生命」所作的「哲學反省」。人，作為自然的、社會的、歷史的存在，在他所生活的世界中，面臨著繁複多樣、瞬息萬變的問題：處境、命運、愛情、知識、道德、藝術、宗教、臨終與死亡……其中有些問題事實上已經深深困擾著我們，另外一些則伺機突襲，在我們還來不及準備的時候，就被迫面對。生命的意義究竟是什麼？本課程嘗試以深入淺出的討論，藉由過去、當代人物的所感、所思，促進學習者進一步反省自我生命之種種。
Philosophy and Life is as a philosophical reflective thinking for the life.
Human beings, as natural, social and historical beings, face a great many complex varied and fast changing problems in the life-world, for example, love, destiny, knowledge, morality, art, religion, dying, and moreover the death so on.... Actually some of them have deeply perplexed us, while others watch for their chances to attack there would leave no time for covering our ears and we are merely compelled to confront with them. After all, what does Life mean?
Whereas this course tries to take up by the way a kind of discussion in explaining the profound in simple terms, and in making use of whatever in history, or the present age somebody's feeling and thinking, in order to promote the students to question themselves more about, and reflect further on all sorts of life-self.
全18週

player has superior tactics for receiving and serving the ball, he/she can take 
the initiative and control his/her opponent effectively to attack and score 
directly, so that he/she will have a greater chance to win the game; therefore, 
such tactics has great importance in table tennis skills regarding singles and 
tactics applications.

以學生現有的數理、生物背景為基礎，引導學生進入科技應用的領域。現代科技進步快速，世界日新月異，學生需具備有敏銳之觀察力與學習能力，始能跟上時代之潮流。本課程將目前先進之科技作一概念性的介紹；涵蓋有太空科技、能源應用、材料科技、生物技術、資訊科技等內容，期能一窺世界之奧妙，進而引發學習新知之動機與興趣。
At the dawn of the twenty-first century today, as every citizen of the world should have a basic scientific concept and knowledge which can serve people to make the decisions, participate in civic and cultural affairs, and join economic production activities. Also, beside the professional expertise and technology, the most important thing for the citizens is to care about humanities, develop themselves actively, and benefit the people and serve the community.
The major purpose of this course is from the new technology of modern life to induced the students knowing the basic applied science and technique concept. From the simpler chemistry, physics and biologic technology, step by step , let students know more the world and more interesting about the new matters and new technology.
The studentswho finish this course will know the basic applied science and technology and more understanding about the world we lived.
全18週

01
Introduction of Professional Law
本課程醫護法學之介紹，使學生對法律結構、法學理念及我國現行法有一整體性的認知，以奠定法學啟發基礎。從醫護正義概念出發，就醫護法規、醫護法制、護理法律責任與訴訟、醫護人員切身法律問題等，深入淺出有系統的介紹，以培養現代醫護人員正確的法律觀。並從醫護業務與法律實務的角度，點出護理人員與其他醫事人員的責任分際、臨床醫護人員與公共衛生醫護人員面臨法律問題的不同、醫病糾紛的預防與處理等，以強化醫護人員處理法律問題的能力。
This subject is taught by way of the introduction of the basic law to let the students to understand the whole outline of the construction of law，the virtue of the jurisprudence and the  present law in Taiwan.  It begins as the teaching of the concept of the professional justice and is succeeded by introducing the medical and nursing law，the institution of the professional law，the responsibility and litigation as well as the professional liability of the member of professional society to ensure the students to know the exact concept of the law and to develop problem-solving abilities .

01
PE-Swimming
教育部針對高中職以下學校，鼓勵其應落實游泳
教學及提昇學生之游泳能力。然而許多高中職學生進入大專院校後，並非全
部達到基本游泳能力之要求。本課程旨在引導學生認識水的危險和水上安全
等相關知識，進一步則教導學生學會並增進游泳之基本能力，包括基本潛
水、韻律呼吸、自由式、蛙式、仰式、蝶式等。
The Ministry of Education proposed that all students under 12 should learn 
swimming and achieve certain criteria in individual swimming levels. However, 
many Taiwan students those have entered colleges appear to not develop 
their skills in swimming. The course is to awaken students to the safety and 
danger about waters. The instructor will help students to develop and improve 
their swimming skills, such as underwater swimming, rhyming and efficient 
breathes, freestyle, breaststroke, backstroke, and butterfly stroke.

01
PE- Modern dance
在舞蹈的領域中，現代舞強調「探索」與「醒思」這
兩項精神，人體的自我探索、人在時間與空間中的醒思，因此本課程著重於身體
運作的認知與探索，課程目標強調經由肢體活動做身體能力的察覺與開發。課程
內容以漸進的練習原則，探索累積學習者的身體經驗。
Among all dancing areas, modern dance emphasizes on both “exploration” 
and “disillusion” spirits, self-exploring on human body, consciousness about 
human within time and space. Therefore, this course emphasizes on 
recognition and discovery of body operation, and the curricular goal stresses 
on the awareness and development of body competence through body 
activities. The course content is to explore the body experiences of 
cumulative learners by proper sequential practices.

功能強化運動主要是針對身體的狀況， 結合適當的運動計畫執行之後，改善原本功能退化的狀況，進而讓身體在運動計畫的訓練之後，能夠恢復到健康的狀態。本課程的理論基礎是以運動改善下半身的循環促進，並進而帶動全身的循環以促進健康。從下肢訓練開始設計不同強度的訓練模式，並進而連接到各個部位所需要的運動如50肩 、坐骨神經痛、足底筋膜炎、尿失禁、經前症候群等等。透過適當的運動訓練計畫，讓身體再找回健康，是這門課的主軸。
Functional strengthening exercise is mainly aimed at the physical condition, combined with the implementation of the appropriate exercise plans, to improve the original function degradation condition, so that the body can recover to a healthy state after the training of the exercise plan. The theoretical basis of this course is to improve the circulation of the lower body by exercise, and then drive the circulation of the whole body to promote health. To start from the lower limb training, different intensity training modes are designed, and then connected to the required exercises of various parts such as 50 shoulders, sciatica, plantar fasciitis, urinary incontinence, premenstrual syndrome and so on. Through the appropriate sports training plan, let the body regain health, is the main axis of this course.

01
Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
全18週

01
Introduction to Emergent Literacy
本課程目地為建立兒童讀寫萌發概念及如何促進兒童早期閱讀與書寫能力之實物操作能力。範圍包括兒童的讀寫發展、早期讀寫經驗及讀寫知識。研究範圍包括1. 如何有效的與兒童共讀繪本、2.父母在家裡如何提供閱讀經驗及、3.社會文化對閱讀的價值觀及4如何評估兒童的敘事能力。同時也探討兒童如何從這些經驗逐漸萌發對讀寫的興趣，漸漸累積建立整體的讀寫與語言敘事知識，這些早期讀寫知識包括：1.文字符號系統的知識、2.對母語語言聲音音韻的覺察認識、3. 理解語言文體的結構、4.瞭解印刷體與讀音的對應關係及5.對印刷文字字體的認識。
The purpose of the “Introduction of Emergent Literacy” is to establish students the concept of early literacy in children and how to facilitate early literacy and clinical practices in early reading and writing. The scope of this course includes：　
1.	The effectiveness of share book reading,
2.	How parents can provide reading experience at home,
3.	The social and culture values for reading, 
4.	How to assess the children’s narrative ability.

Introduction to Contemporary Art
本課程以現代性的概念，貫連二十世紀至當前的藝術潮流發展，探討當代藝術的幾個重要流派、特性與不同面向，呈現藝術發展的獨特性與創造性。培養藝術涵養及建立個人對審美的主體觀，並瞭解當前社會藝術文化脈動，對當代的文化思潮有其見地，以開展學生發展自我潛能，並將藝術融入生活，提升生命境界。
This course employs the concept of modernity as a framework to establish connections between the evolution of artistic trends from the 20th century to the present day. The course delves into various significant genres, characteristics, and different aspects of contemporary art, thereby highlighting the distinctiveness and creativity of artistic development. The objective of this course is to cultivate artistic appreciation, establish personal aesthetic perspectives and comprehend the prevailing social and cultural trends in art. The course further aims to enhance students' capacity for self-growth, integrate art into their daily lives, and elevate their overall living experience.
全18週

Early Intervention and School Service in Communicative Disorders

01
Clinical Speech-Language Pathology
語言是人類用來做思想溝通知識交流經驗傳承的工具與能力。這工具的獲得是透過中樞神經學習機制在適當的環境刺激下逐步建立。所牽涉到的機制是感官對外界刺激的感知和解碼，以及進入中樞神經之後的知覺聯繫，以及利用神經認知記憶系統的統整活動所產生。臨床語言障礙包羅萬象，涵蓋病人年齡層由小至老，言治療師必須習得基礎的中樞神經運作機制與臨床語言異常症狀配合，方能在日後做病理的判斷和治療方針的擬定有合宜的思考。
Language is the ability and tool to share and inherence experiences and thoughts. With central neuro-mechanism, language is learnt with proper environmental stimuli, which involves sensory perception and encoding. Clinical speech and language pathology concerns with patient ranging from children to adults. Therefore, the class is designed to help students combine the knowledge with neuro-mechanism and language disorders for the future diagnosis and treatment.
全18週

Cochlear Implants
本科目之教學設計為橫向整合內耳前庭功能評量與復健、臨床聽力學、電生理聽力學，縱向銜接聽力科學、聽力障礙學。
This course aims to provide students with an understanding of clinical and scientific aspects of cochlear implants. Central topics related to cochlear implants will be covered. These topics will include: basic surgical and engineering aspects of cochlear implants, clinical considerations, device safety, efficacy outcomes, and aural rehabilitation in adult and pediatric implant users. We will also discuss the trends in cochlear implants, such as issues related to bilateral implantation, combined electric and acoustic stimulation, virtual channels, etc. Students who take this course will develop skills in integrating various sources of information and apply it to
clinical practice and research.

01
Philosophy and Life
「哲學與人生」是對「人的生命」所作的「哲學反省」。人，作為自然的、社會的、歷史的存在，在他所生活的世界中，面臨著繁複多樣、瞬息萬變的問題：處境、命運、愛情、知識、道德、藝術、宗教、臨終與死亡……其中有些問題事實上已經深深困擾著我們，另外一些則伺機突襲，在我們還來不及準備的時候，就被迫面對。生命的意義究竟是什麼？本課程嘗試以深入淺出的討論，藉由過去、當代人物的所感、所思，促進學習者進一步反省自我生命之種種。
Philosophy and Life is as a philosophical reflective thinking for the life.
Human beings, as natural, social and historical beings, face a great many complex varied and fast changing problems in the life-world, for example, love, destiny, knowledge, morality, art, religion, dying, and moreover the death so on.... Actually some of them have deeply perplexed us, while others watch for their chances to attack there would leave no time for covering our ears and we are merely compelled to confront with them. After all, what does Life mean?
Whereas this course tries to take up by the way a kind of discussion in explaining the profound in simple terms, and in making use of whatever in history, or the present age somebody's feeling and thinking, in order to promote the students to question themselves more about, and reflect further on all sorts of life-self.
全18週

Introduction of Professional Law
本課程醫護法學之介紹，使學生對法律結構、法學理念及我國現行法有一整體性的認知，以奠定法學啟發基礎。從醫護正義概念出發，就醫護法規、醫護法制、護理法律責任與訴訟、醫護人員切身法律問題等，深入淺出有系統的介紹，以培養現代醫護人員正確的法律觀。並從醫護業務與法律實務的角度，點出護理人員與其他醫事人員的責任分際、臨床醫護人員與公共衛生醫護人員面臨法律問題的不同、醫病糾紛的預防與處理等，以強化醫護人員處理法律問題的能力。
This subject is taught by way of the introduction of the basic law to let the students to understand the whole outline of the construction of law，the virtue of the jurisprudence and the  present law in Taiwan.  It begins as the teaching of the concept of the professional justice and is succeeded by introducing the medical and nursing law，the institution of the professional law，the responsibility and litigation as well as the professional liability of the member of professional society to ensure the students to know the exact concept of the law and to develop problem-solving abilities .

Freshman English II
本課程包括每週兩小時的閱讀。教學重點為文法重點複習、閱讀技巧及練習，普通英文閱讀。於該課程中學生能熟練基本文法重點，學習並運用各種英文閱讀技巧，閱讀並理解初中級～中級(low-intermediate ~ intermediate level) 普通英文文章。
This course includes a two-hour reading instruction each week. Students are placed to different levels according to their individual English ability displayed in a placement test administered beforehand.  Teaching materials covered, therefore, will differ in order to meet the needs of students of different levels.  The main contents of the course are grammar review, reading skills and practice in low-intermediate or intermediate level general English.
全18週

Introduction to Contemporary Art
本課程以現代性的概念，貫連二十世紀至當前的藝術潮流發展，探討當代藝術的幾個重要流派、特性與不同面向，呈現藝術發展的獨特性與創造性。培養藝術涵養及建立個人對審美的主體觀，並瞭解當前社會藝術文化脈動，對當代的文化思潮有其見地，以開展學生發展自我潛能，並將藝術融入生活，提升生命境界。
This course employs the concept of modernity as a framework to establish connections between the evolution of artistic trends from the 20th century to the present day. The course delves into various significant genres, characteristics, and different aspects of contemporary art, thereby highlighting the distinctiveness and creativity of artistic development. The objective of this course is to cultivate artistic appreciation, establish personal aesthetic perspectives and comprehend the prevailing social and cultural trends in art. The course further aims to enhance students' capacity for self-growth, integrate art into their daily lives, and elevate their overall living experience.

01
Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
全18週

Introduction to Illness in Infant and Child
本課程包括有認識正常嬰幼兒的成長與發育，以及生長發育異常兒童之發現與處理方式，新生兒篩檢，嬰幼兒異常症狀早期發現之要點，兒童各器官系統正常與異常情況之理學評估和比較，並需實習身體評估與照護之要領。課程之平時作業為每位同學回顧及探討自身的出生史、生長史、預防注射紀錄、疾病史和家族史，藉此能知己而後知彼、將心比心，深刻了解生長發育與疾病之要義。學期中亦安排分組專題報告、特殊疾病之專家演講，參訪醫院或嬰幼兒保育機構，以及新生兒篩檢實驗室。

Guidance of Child Behavior Problems
本課程介紹有關兒童行為觀察與輔導基本概念，以及兒童行為輔導的策略與技巧，配合課堂補充講義學習兒童行為觀察量表之使用與了解問題行為發生原因，進一步應用行為輔導介入之策略。課程內容包含常見問題行為特徵與輔導策略介紹，以及認識有特殊需求兒童之行為輔導（包括智能障礙、語言障礙、身體病弱、情緒障礙、多重障礙、自閉症、注意力缺陷過動症、發展遲緩等特殊兒童之教育與輔導策略）。藉由本課程內容安排，期盼可以培養學生對兒童行為輔導工作的熱誠與能力，並將所學運用於實際教學環境中。
This course was base on theories of psychology and sociology .The major purpose was to discuss some effective strategies for solving the problems of child behavior, so that will be useful to the students in their professional career. This curriculum includes three parts, the first is theories and skills of child behavior guidance; the second is problems of behavior which were found on most of child, it includes: aggressive behavior, feeding problem, toilet training, sleeping problem, emotional problem, hyper-activity, social behavior, etc.; the third is behavior disorder of childhood, it includes: anxiety disorders, depression and peer relations, learning disabilities, over-activity disorder, mental retardation autism and childhood schizophrenia, etc.

Assessment of development and learning for young children
本課程旨在認識嬰幼兒發展與學習評量的理論與其在幼兒園實作的基本概念、方法及議題，並熟悉資料的收集、分析解釋與溝通報告的方法。除瞭解常見的嬰幼兒發展評量工具外，亦探討如何與幼兒園教保活動課程大綱結合，進行嬰幼兒的學習及教保服務人員的教學兩方面的評量。
This course addresses the assessment of young children from birth to age eight. The assessment process takes into account the whole child: cognition, communication, sensory, perceptual, motor, social/moral development within the context of family, school and cultural environments. Emphasis is on the use of observation and authentic assessment strategies to evaluate learning. Analyzing and interpreting assessment results to enhance learning outcomes and determine program effectiveness is also a key component of this course. In order to complete the assignments, students must have access to children.

01
The Design and Practice for Children's Science-Education Course
科學概念的啟蒙與培養，應從幼兒學前教育階段為佳。但現行教育保育人
員本身科學相關知能的訓練稍嫌不足，恐怕難深談對幼兒科學活動的設計。
本課程是以幼教或幼保系學生現有的科學知能背景為考量，安排科學基礎
課程來加強、提昇學生本身相關的科學素養。另外將設計一系列可供學生發
揮並能達到幼兒科學觀念培養的相關教材，讓學生實際操作與演練。將科學
基礎課程與幼教專業實務間作一聯結，以期學生能將科學知能與態度應用於
幼教學理中。
The cultivation of science education should begin way before children enter
elementary school. However, nowadays many preschool teachers do not possess enough
science knowledge or acquire systematic scientific trainings for them to design and
implement appropriate science curriculum for young children. As we know, teacher’s
Teacher’ s academic code：078
attitude toward certain course subject will influence how students look at the subject,
thus will affect their leaning results and related achievement. Therefore, it will be hard
for preschool kids to be able to enjoy science learning or to engage themselves in any
type of science experiments if their teacher does not like science at all.
This project intends to help college students in the department of infant and child
care (who will be preschool teachers after graduation) learn both basic science
knowledge and the design of science curriculum for young children. Furthermore,
students will have the opportunities to explore many real-life science experiments and
to practice their skills in designing scientific experiments for young children as they
attend basic science course plus advanced curriculum design course. In addition, they
will also have the chances to observe and learn from other college students as they
participate in the integrated preschool science-learning-activity design competition.
全18週

Montessori Method
本課程之宗旨為讓學生知道蒙特梭利教學法的理論與實務之大概以及啟發學生深入學習蒙特梭利教學法的興趣。蒙特梭利教學法雖於1907年開始萌芽，經各國文化與社會變遷的洗禮，能和諧地融入各國文化與社會。台灣幼兒教育的主流教學模式為以主題為中心的單元、主題或方案課程，蒙式則以學習區的教具操作為主，目前台灣已能將主題中心教學模式與蒙特梭利的教學相互融合。本課程從整體觀的概念介紹蒙特梭利教學法的理論與實務，並說明與主題中心式教學模式融合的可能性。
The purposes of the course are understanding theory of Montessori education and to familiar with the practice of Montessori Method and integrating theme teaching and Montessori method.

to be. The positive discipline skills center in developing mutual respect, cooperation and 
responsibilities in the classroom.
Learning proper management techniques is the key to having a pre-school classroom that's 
free from chaos and confusion. The techniques that a preschool teacher uses to manage her 
classroom can have far-reaching effects, not only on a student's self-esteem and motivation to 
excel, but also on the teacher's mental well-being. For any technique to be successful, it must be 
one that resonates with the teacher so it can grow organically along with the teacher-student .

01
Curriculum Models for Infant & Child Care
本課程旨在介紹並探討不同類型之教保課程模式。教保課程模式於本課程中被定義為嬰幼兒園所依循一教育理念，並將其實踐於課程與教學中而形成的一種教學與保育的模式。課程內容包含對重要教育理念的介紹，及依循不同教育理念衍生出之各類型教保模式之探討。針對各類型教保模式，探討其教育理念、對兒童看法、教學方式、教師角色、與反映在教育方法上的異同等。並就各教學模式於當前台灣幼兒園之實施現況，進行分析與評論。
The purpose of this course is to explore approaches and models related to infant and childcare.  Curriculum content includes introduction of major educational theories, and exploration of various teaching models such as the project approach and the Reggio Emilia.  When examining each teaching approach, the class will explore its educational belief, beliefs about children regarding how they learn and develop, its teaching methods, teacher’s roles, and differences from other approaches.  One aim of this course is to know the current applications of these teaching models in Taiwan.
全18週

01
Introduction of Professional Law
本課程醫護法學之介紹，使學生對法律結構、法學理念及我國現行法有一整體性的認知，以奠定法學啟發基礎。從醫護正義概念出發，就醫護法規、醫護法制、護理法律責任與訴訟、醫護人員切身法律問題等，深入淺出有系統的介紹，以培養現代醫護人員正確的法律觀。並從醫護業務與法律實務的角度，點出護理人員與其他醫事人員的責任分際、臨床醫護人員與公共衛生醫護人員面臨法律問題的不同、醫病糾紛的預防與處理等，以強化醫護人員處理法律問題的能力。
This subject is taught by way of the introduction of the basic law to let the students to understand the whole outline of the construction of law，the virtue of the jurisprudence and the  present law in Taiwan.  It begins as the teaching of the concept of the professional justice and is succeeded by introducing the medical and nursing law，the institution of the professional law，the responsibility and litigation as well as the professional liability of the member of professional society to ensure the students to know the exact concept of the law and to develop problem-solving abilities .
全18週

PE- Body Movement Creation
透過身體伸展、舞蹈動作，以引導與循序漸進的方式，
搭配呼吸與身體延展的肢體動作，及強化肌耐力之動作練習，讓肌肉在練習間，
透過感知與身體達到身心平衡的狀態。透過身體實作，體驗肢體的可能性及認識

manner, combined with breathing and body extension limb movements, and 
exercise exercises to strengthen muscle endurance, the muscles can reach a 
state of physical and mental balance through perception and body during 
exercises. Through physical practice, experience the possibilities of the body 
and learn about dance performance art.Based on the concept of physical 
development, through dance and games, develop the body's perception ability 
and use methods, and establish the understanding and use of the body.

Teaching Materials and Methods for Young ChildrenⅡ
課程設計與教學能力係屬幼兒教保工作人員之專業能力，為提升教保品質之基本條件，不可或缺。衡量當今幼兒教育思潮、幼兒發展需求與社會發展狀況，本課程從統整理念出發，依據「幼兒園教保活動與課程大綱」（新課綱）之精神及內涵，幫助學生建立以幼兒為中心之幼兒教材教法觀念、培養學生實際進行幼兒教保活動之能力。主要內容包含瞭解幼兒園教學之理念與實務，認識新課綱身體動作與健康領域、語文領域、社會領域之課程目標與學習指標，以及各領域之教學內容與教學方法，包含學習區教學。學生應能根據課堂所學，設計教學活動並實施，之後進行檢討。
The purposes of this course are to explore the characteristics, contents, and trends of teaching methods and materials for preschoolers. Due to the limitation of course schedule, this course will focus on six major child development aspects. The contents focus both theories and practices in this topics. Students will also be able to design different lesson plans for children in its different development stages by using what they learned in this course.

Perceptual-motor Play
本課程主要目的在使學生能將知覺動作遊戲之理論實際應用至嬰幼兒保育及幼兒園的課程設計上。課程的實施是以理論架構之介紹及實際操作應用兩者相互搭配，首先介紹知覺動作遊戲之理論基礎、嬰幼兒知覺動作之正常及異常發展，再依據知覺動作遊戲之設計及操作原則，讓學生直接至遊戲教室參與並設計知覺動作遊戲，最後再介紹特殊障礙兒童之知覺動作遊戲設計、實施原則並實際示範，以期望學生能將知覺動作遊戲理論實際應用至一般及特殊嬰幼兒之保育上。
Babies are born to learn from experimenting the relationship between their body and the environment.  Based on the tactile and other sensory systems they are born with, this curriculum aims to help students learn how to design sensory and motor activities for parents and babies.  The various baby activities aim to build up a vocabulary of sensory experiences (e.g. visual, auditory and tactile), to enhance physical contact (massage, reflexology, touching, cuddling and rocking) and motor interaction between parents and their baby.
第1~14週

Technology and Life
以學生現有的數理、生物背景為基礎，引導學生進入科技應用的領域。現代科技進步快速，世界日新月異，學生需具備有敏銳之觀察力與學習能力，始能跟上時代之潮流。本課程將目前先進之科技作一概念性的介紹；涵蓋有太空科技、能源應用、材料科技、生物技術、資訊科技等內容，期能一窺世界之奧妙，進而引發學習新知之動機與興趣。

The Seminar in The Topics of Early Child Care
課程目標在於激勵學生能夠選擇與觀察嬰幼兒教保育現場的相關問題，以當代家庭、托育服務提供及社會等相關議題或時事作深入探討。學生各自組成團隊並針對議題進行資料收集、分析、研討與報告撰寫，任課老師與業界專業人員則擔任「導師」的角色協助團隊找出解決策略，進而建構出實做能力與成果。在經歷團隊合作的過程後，完成專題發表的經驗，期望可以讓學生累積並建構未來邁入職場的探索與統整能力。
The goal of the course is to motivate students to choose and observe relevant issues in the field of infant and child care, and to conduct in-depth discussions on relevant issues or current events such as contemporary families, childcare service provision, and society. Students form their own teams to collect data, analyze, discuss and write reports on the issues. Teachers and professional practitioners act as "mentors" to help the team find solutions and then build practical capabilities and results. After experiencing the process of teamwork, the experience of completing the topic publication is expected to allow students to accumulate and build the ability to explore and integrate into the workplace in the future.
第1~14週

本課程為一學期兩小時兩學分的課程。教學重點為文法重點複習、閱讀技巧及練習、普通英文文章閱讀，於該課程中學生能熟練中級至中高級(intermediate ~high intermediate level)基本文法重點、學習並運用各種英文閱讀技巧、閱讀並理解中級至中高級(intermediate ~high intermediate level)英文文章。
This is a two-credit, one-semester course. Included in the instruction for students of all levels are grammar review, basic sentence structure, introduction and application of English reading skills to high-intermediate reading articles, outlining and summarizing, as well as general or professional conversational English, talks, lectures, reports, and programs.

English Presentation
本課程為每學期兩學分。教學內容包括熟練英語口語表達、簡報技巧及視覺輔助工具的使用等，協助學生能以全英語做簡報。
This is a two-credit course with two-hour instruction per week. This course is designed to introduce students to oral presentation skills and techniques, presentation language, effective use of visual aids and all that to be known in doing an oral presentation. One important goal of this course is that students will be able to understand what an effective presentation should consist of. Another important goal is that they will be able to step out of their comfort zone and complete a presentation in English with what they have learned.

English for the Work Place
本課程為一學期兩小時兩學分的課程。由英語中級程度提昇至中高級之訓練課程。教學重點為職場英語常用字彙、句法、對話技巧及其應用。於該課程中學生能熟悉並練習職場英語常用字彙、句法、對話技巧。
This is a two-hour weekly and one-semester course which is worth two credits. This is an intermediate to high-intermediate level English course. The main contents of the course consist of: common English vocabulary in workplace, business English dialogue expressions, communication skills in workplace, and the application of communication skills. In this course, students are expected: (a) to become familiar with common English vocabulary in workplace, business English dialogue expressions, and communication skills; and (b) to apply common English vocabulary in workplace and business English dialogue expressions to their everyday English conversations.

English Speech and Communication
本課程為一學期每週兩小時的英語口語表達能力之培養課程。主要教學內容為教授英語演講的各種技巧，包括演講的目的，主題的挑選，傳達的形式, 肢體語言與聽眾的反應之回應等等口語表達技巧。在這些技巧中也涵蓋了口語溝通的技巧，包括如何開頭以及如何結尾等用詞等的練習。課程中也有教授撰寫講稿的格式與內容的指引。提供學生完整英文講演的書面與口頭訓練的教學內容。
This course includes a two-hour instruction each week and is worth two credits. This course focuses on the skills of making a speech and communication, such as the selection a proper topic, interaction with audience, the types of oral presentation and body language. In addition, the course also includes the guidance of the format and content of a speech. The purpose of this course is to help students to learn the skills of oral presentation so as to deliver clear messages to their audience or listeners in the public. This course is also designed to train students to choose proper topics or themes to a variety of audience with different backgrounds and therefore have a good interaction with audience.
全18週

Journalistic English
本課程為一學期每週兩小時的聽、說、讀、寫全方位英語練習。教學重點為運用各種聽力與閱讀策略，理解BBC、CNN、New York Times等新聞網站上與護理健康照護有關的科技新知、常用字彙與句型，並進行口語討論與簡報。此外，學生亦必需利用所習得的聽力與閱讀策略以及電腦科技知識進入本校相關學習網站學習全校英文會考內容。
This course includes two hours of instruction each week and is worth two credits. This course focuses on the application of different listening and reading strategies for comprehending the latest news related to nursing and health sciences published in Times as well as at BBC, CNN, and New York Times websites. Students are expected to learn the information related to the news and become familiar with the vocabulary and sentence structures contained in the news. Students are also expected to participate in the following activities: discussing issues related to the news, giving presentations, and criticizing each piece of news as well as other peers’ presentation performance in classroom. In addition, students also need to study the materials at http://140.131.85.13/enginfo/myABC/index.htm for NTUNHS Joint Exams.
全18週

Physiology
本課程以基礎醫學的觀點，由淺入深詳細探討人體生理學原理，尤其加強各器官系統間之調節機轉，進而切入於生理失衡之分辨及科技新知之相關應用。內容包括生理機制概論、細胞生理學、神經系統功能、肌肉生理、內分泌之調控、心臟及血流動力循環生理學、呼吸、消化生理及代謝之調節、腎臟生理學、生殖與幹細胞之展望。
The purpose of this course is to introduce physiological principles and regulatory mechanisms in terms of cells, organs and systems, further helps students to integrate concepts of diverse normal human functions, and applied to related disease mechanism.

01
Microbiology and Immunology
醫用微生物與免疫學隸屬基礎醫學門，為醫學與護理之專業核心科目之一。近二十多年來,因分子生物學之蓬勃發展，使得微生物學與免疫學之內容日趨複雜。唯有以分子生物學為基礎來解說本課程,才能脫離以往只能說明表相之教學窠臼。
本課程之設計配合前述趨勢，內容傾向臨床應用,並使學生易於瞭解。先由宿主與寄生者間競爭優勢之生態看感染性疾病之發生，免疫反應在此過程中決定了疾病之形成與否,由此介紹人體免疫的基本構成成員與免疫反應的種類與運作。再以人體之器官系統為主軸，分別介紹各種傳染性疾病及其病原體。由分子生物學之觀點探討疾病機制及現象，以預防醫學之角度看傳染性疾病之發生與控制。
傳染性疾病由微生物造成，生態環境與生活方式之改變，使得傳染性疾病之面貌與半世紀前大不相同。傳染性疾病之控制，包括預防與醫療成為重要課題，微生物學著重此方向之探討。人體除藉由免疫系統防禦感染並負起消除不正常細胞之重責，因而健全之生理得以維持。萬一免疫系統之運作失調，除了無法對付感染之外，還可能反而造成對自身之傷害，現已知許多疾病即肇因於此。因此免疫學同列為本課程教學內容。
The knowledge in the field of both medical microbiology and immunology has accumulated amazingly. Taking into account the changes that are currently taking place in the teaching of medical microbiology in medical schools worldwide, the content of this course is geared towards making the subject more accessible and relevant to clinical practice.
At the beginning of this course, we introduce infectious diseases regarding the conflict between the host and the parasite. Immunology plays a central role in this conflict, as a given microbe can infect and cause disease only if it can survive under the multitude of the immune response of the host. From this point of view, current basic concepts of immunology and the pathogenesis of immune disorders are introduced in the second section of this course. In the third part, clinically based accounts of infectious diseases are classified according to the particular organ system involved. We also place particular emphasis on pathogenesis, clinical symptom, control, and prevention as well as possible molecular mechanisms of the diseases. Moreover, we discuss the infectious diseases that burst out locally or somewhere in the world at present.
全18週

Introduction to Nursing Profession
本課程旨在使學生對護理專業有初步認識，瞭解護理人員在目前健康照護體系中所扮演角色與功能，並培養專業護理人員應有的智能與態度。同時認識目前護理專業發展現況及影響因素，能體認護理專業未來發展趨勢，以激發學生投入護理專業的興趣與意願。
This course will assist students to understand the basic concepts of nursing profession, realize the professional nursing role and functions in health care delivery system, and foster the competence and attitudes of professional nurses. In addition, students would understand nursing profession development, contemporary challenges and influencing factors to nursing profession and can realize the future trends in nursing profession. Through this course, students are encouraged to the interest and will to invest the nursing profession.
全18週

PE-Table Tennis2
學習與養成良好的各種基本技術後並加強比賽技術、戰術的應用與結合，以期能在桌球比賽中獲得有效成果。如有優質的各種基本技術及搭配單打戰術應用就能在比賽中直接得分與攻擊。在比賽技術中有良好優質的接發球戰術就能先發制人，且能有效控制對方直接攻擊得分，其贏球機率高。因此在單打技術、戰術應用桌球技術中佔有極重要性。
After learning and cultivating various kinds of basic skills,
a player should reinforce the applications and combinations of singles and tactics, aiming to have effective results in table tennis games. If a player has various kinds of superior basic skills combined with the applications of singles tactics, he/she can score and attack directly in a game. In terms of singles, if a player has superior tactics for receiving and serving the ball, he/she can take the initiative and control his/her opponent effectively to attack and score directly, so that he/she will have a greater chance to win the game; therefore, such tactics has great importance in table tennis skills regarding singles and tactics applications.

本課程以基礎醫學的觀點，由淺入深詳細探討人體生理學原理，尤其加強各器官系統間之調節機轉，進而切入於生理失衡之分辨及科技新知之相關應用。內容包括生理機制概論、細胞生理學、神經系統功能、肌肉生理、內分泌之調控、心臟及血流動力循環生理學、呼吸、消化生理及代謝之調節、腎臟生理學、生殖與幹細胞之展望。

微生物學為護理系學生之必修科, 微生物學實驗係配合微生物學,讓學生親自觀察、試驗的課程. 實驗內容以學生將來執行護理工作上可能遇到的項目為主. 本課程之教學活動為學習培養微生物的基本技術、觀察及鑑別微生物的基本方法. 進而學習自環境及人體採樣的方法,體認微生物的存在; 試驗消滅微生物的方法,包括各種物理方法及化學方法; 觀察微生物染色玻片,認識致病性細菌的形態; 操作運用免疫學原理的臨床血清學常用的試驗方法,並由錄影帶教學中學習免疫學之分子生物學學理.

Introduction to Nursing Profession
本課程旨在使學生對護理專業有初步認識，瞭解護理人員在目前健康照護體系中所扮演角色與功能，並培養專業護理人員應有的智能與態度。同時認識目前護理專業發展現況及影響因素，能體認護理專業未來發展趨勢，以激發學生投入護理專業的興趣與意願。
This course will assist students to understand the basic concepts of nursing profession, realize the professional nursing role and functions in health care delivery system, and foster the competence and attitudes of professional nurses. In addition, students would understand nursing profession development, contemporary challenges and influencing factors to nursing profession and can realize the future trends in nursing profession. Through this course, students are encouraged to the interest and will to invest the nursing profession.
全18週

PE-Table Tennis2

After learning and cultivating various kinds of basic skills,
a player should reinforce the applications and combinations of singles and tactics, aiming to have effective results in table tennis games. If a player has various kinds of superior basic skills combined with the applications of singles tactics, he/she can score and attack directly in a game. In terms of singles, if a player has superior tactics for receiving and serving the ball, he/she can take the initiative and control his/her opponent effectively to attack and score directly, so that he/she will have a greater chance to win the game; therefore, such tactics has great importance in table tennis skills regarding singles and tactics applications.

Physiology
本課程以基礎醫學的觀點，由淺入深詳細探討人體生理學原理，尤其加強各器官系統間之調節機轉，進而切入於生理失衡之分辨及科技新知之相關應用。內容包括生理機制概論、細胞生理學、神經系統功能、肌肉生理、內分泌之調控、心臟及血流動力循環生理學、呼吸、消化生理及代謝之調節、腎臟生理學、生殖與幹細胞之展望。
The purpose of this course is to introduce physiological principles and regulatory mechanisms in terms of cells, organs and systems, further helps students to integrate concepts of diverse normal human functions, and applied to related disease mechanism.

Service Learning
本課程設計旨在協助學生培養服務的精神，藉由至服務機構提供服務，落實課堂所學之服務知識與理念，並進而從服務中學習、瞭解服務於社區之重要性與體驗服務之意義，培養正向的服務態度，以期自我省思、瞭解自我進而促進自我成長與肯定生命價值。
This course is provided to introduce the basic concepts of volunteer, and help the students with fundamental understanding in non-profit organization (NPO). By the end, the students will have basic understanding on concepts, principle, and management model in volunteer works and NPO. These will be helpful students for their future jobs and their quality of life.

01
Microbiology and Immunology
醫用微生物與免疫學隸屬基礎醫學門，為醫學與護理之專業核心科目之一。近二十多年來,因分子生物學之蓬勃發展，使得微生物學與免疫學之內容日趨複雜。唯有以分子生物學為基礎來解說本課程,才能脫離以往只能說明表相之教學窠臼。
本課程之設計配合前述趨勢，內容傾向臨床應用,並使學生易於瞭解。先由宿主與寄生者間競爭優勢之生態看感染性疾病之發生，免疫反應在此過程中決定了疾病之形成與否,由此介紹人體免疫的基本構成成員與免疫反應的種類與運作。再以人體之器官系統為主軸，分別介紹各種傳染性疾病及其病原體。由分子生物學之觀點探討疾病機制及現象，以預防醫學之角度看傳染性疾病之發生與控制。
傳染性疾病由微生物造成，生態環境與生活方式之改變，使得傳染性疾病之面貌與半世紀前大不相同。傳染性疾病之控制，包括預防與醫療成為重要課題，微生物學著重此方向之探討。人體除藉由免疫系統防禦感染並負起消除不正常細胞之重責，因而健全之生理得以維持。萬一免疫系統之運作失調，除了無法對付感染之外，還可能反而造成對自身之傷害，現已知許多疾病即肇因於此。因此免疫學同列為本課程教學內容。
The knowledge in the field of both medical microbiology and immunology has accumulated amazingly. Taking into account the changes that are currently taking place in the teaching of medical microbiology in medical schools worldwide, the content of this course is geared towards making the subject more accessible and relevant to clinical practice.
At the beginning of this course, we introduce infectious diseases regarding the conflict between the host and the parasite. Immunology plays a central role in this conflict, as a given microbe can infect and cause disease only if it can survive under the multitude of the immune response of the host. From this point of view, current basic concepts of immunology and the pathogenesis of immune disorders are introduced in the second section of this course. In the third part, clinically based accounts of infectious diseases are classified according to the particular organ system involved. We also place particular emphasis on pathogenesis, clinical symptom, control, and prevention as well as possible molecular mechanisms of the diseases. Moreover, we discuss the infectious diseases that burst out locally or somewhere in the world at present.
全18週

01
Microbiology and Immunology
醫用微生物與免疫學隸屬基礎醫學門，為醫學與護理之專業核心科目之一。近二十多年來,因分子生物學之蓬勃發展，使得微生物學與免疫學之內容日趨複雜。唯有以分子生物學為基礎來解說本課程,才能脫離以往只能說明表相之教學窠臼。
本課程之設計配合前述趨勢，內容傾向臨床應用,並使學生易於瞭解。先由宿主與寄生者間競爭優勢之生態看感染性疾病之發生，免疫反應在此過程中決定了疾病之形成與否,由此介紹人體免疫的基本構成成員與免疫反應的種類與運作。再以人體之器官系統為主軸，分別介紹各種傳染性疾病及其病原體。由分子生物學之觀點探討疾病機制及現象，以預防醫學之角度看傳染性疾病之發生與控制。
傳染性疾病由微生物造成，生態環境與生活方式之改變，使得傳染性疾病之面貌與半世紀前大不相同。傳染性疾病之控制，包括預防與醫療成為重要課題，微生物學著重此方向之探討。人體除藉由免疫系統防禦感染並負起消除不正常細胞之重責，因而健全之生理得以維持。萬一免疫系統之運作失調，除了無法對付感染之外，還可能反而造成對自身之傷害，現已知許多疾病即肇因於此。因此免疫學同列為本課程教學內容。
The knowledge in the field of both medical microbiology and immunology has accumulated amazingly. Taking into account the changes that are currently taking place in the teaching of medical microbiology in medical schools worldwide, the content of this course is geared towards making the subject more accessible and relevant to clinical practice.
At the beginning of this course, we introduce infectious diseases regarding the conflict between the host and the parasite. Immunology plays a central role in this conflict, as a given microbe can infect and cause disease only if it can survive under the multitude of the immune response of the host. From this point of view, current basic concepts of immunology and the pathogenesis of immune disorders are introduced in the second section of this course. In the third part, clinically based accounts of infectious diseases are classified according to the particular organ system involved. We also place particular emphasis on pathogenesis, clinical symptom, control, and prevention as well as possible molecular mechanisms of the diseases. Moreover, we discuss the infectious diseases that burst out locally or somewhere in the world at present.
全18週

Introduction to Contemporary Art
本課程以現代性的概念，貫連二十世紀至當前的藝術潮流發展，探討當代藝術的幾個重要流派、特性與不同面向，呈現藝術發展的獨特性與創造性。培養藝術涵養及建立個人對審美的主體觀，並瞭解當前社會藝術文化脈動，對當代的文化思潮有其見地，以開展學生發展自我潛能，並將藝術融入生活，提升生命境界。
This course employs the concept of modernity as a framework to establish connections between the evolution of artistic trends from the 20th century to the present day. The course delves into various significant genres, characteristics, and different aspects of contemporary art, thereby highlighting the distinctiveness and creativity of artistic development. The objective of this course is to cultivate artistic appreciation, establish personal aesthetic perspectives and comprehend the prevailing social and cultural trends in art. The course further aims to enhance students' capacity for self-growth, integrate art into their daily lives, and elevate their overall living experience.

Introduction of Professional Law
本課程醫護法學之介紹，使學生對法律結構、法學理念及我國現行法有一整體性的認知，以奠定法學啟發基礎。從醫護正義概念出發，就醫護法規、醫護法制、護理法律責任與訴訟、醫護人員切身法律問題等，深入淺出有系統的介紹，以培養現代醫護人員正確的法律觀。並從醫護業務與法律實務的角度，點出護理人員與其他醫事人員的責任分際、臨床醫護人員與公共衛生醫護人員面臨法律問題的不同、醫病糾紛的預防與處理等，以強化醫護人員處理法律問題的能力。
This subject is taught by way of the introduction of the basic law to let the students to understand the whole outline of the construction of law，the virtue of the jurisprudence and the  present law in Taiwan.  It begins as the teaching of the concept of the professional justice and is succeeded by introducing the medical and nursing law，the institution of the professional law，the responsibility and litigation as well as the professional liability of the member of professional society to ensure the students to know the exact concept of the law and to develop problem-solving abilities .
全18週

PE-Badminton2
本課程透過對羽球基本技能及相關知識的介紹，幫助學生認識羽球活動的各種技巧，並以引導學生充分運動及享受羽球運動樂趣為主軸，建立學生終身運動之基礎。授課內容包括單、雙打比賽技能與比賽觀念、比賽規則演變與羽壇現況的講解，以及實際引導學生體驗各種不同形式的比賽，使學生建立對羽球活動的基本技能與終身興趣。
This course is to help students know the various skills of badminton activities through the introduction of badminton basic skills and related knowledge aiming to have students fully exercise and enjoy the fun of badminton, and establish the foundation for lifelong exercise. Curriculum includes game techniques of singles and doubles and the explanation of game concepts, game rule evolution and status of badminton development, and to actually lead students to experience games of different forms, and establish the fundamental techniques and lifelong interest of badmintons.
全18週

Medical-Surgical Nursing and practice I
本課程目的為增進學生照顧住院內外科疾病個案的護理知識，瞭解個案因疾病、檢查及治療所產生的生理、心理及社會的行為反應，培養運用批判性思考及護理過程，在實作課程中進行整體需要評估，確立健康問題，依個別需要，計劃和執行可行的護理措施，以提供內外科疾病個案之整體性護理，並認識未來臨床護理實務發展趨勢。
This course is designed to enhance students’ nursing knowledge and skills for hospitalized clients with medical and surgical conditions. Students could learn to apply critical thinking and nursing process to identify clients’ physiological, psychological, and social behavioral responses related to disease, diagnostic tests, and treatment in nursing lab. After health problems are identified, students will make individualized care plans and feasible nursing interventions to meet the needs of clients. In addition, students could better understand the trend of clinical practice.
全18週

Introduction of Biostatistics
授與提昇研究能力與增進閱讀學術文獻有關統計能力之知識與概念。其內容包括敘述統計學（集中趨勢量數、離中趨勢量數、分布、作圖與作表）以及推論統計學（區間估計與考驗之過程，Z score、pooled-t test、paired-t test、卡方、one-way ANOVA、皮爾遜積差相關、線性迴歸與無母數分析等）。課中利用EXCEL資料分析工具及各式小型科學電算器如Casio 36PV等協助運算，期能達成理論與實務之結合為目的。
This course is to offer fundamental statistical concepts related to the practice of nursing. The contents include population & samples descriptive statistics; probability; sampling; statistical distributions; estimation; hypothesis testing; pooled samples
全18週

Fundamental Nursing Clinical Practice Practicum

01
Introduction to Contemporary Art
本課程以現代性的概念，貫連二十世紀至當前的藝術潮流發展，探討當代藝術的幾個重要流派、特性與不同面向，呈現藝術發展的獨特性與創造性。培養藝術涵養及建立個人對審美的主體觀，並瞭解當前社會藝術文化脈動，對當代的文化思潮有其見地，以開展學生發展自我潛能，並將藝術融入生活，提升生命境界。
This course employs the concept of modernity as a framework to establish connections between the evolution of artistic trends from the 20th century to the present day. The course delves into various significant genres, characteristics, and different aspects of contemporary art, thereby highlighting the distinctiveness and creativity of artistic development. The objective of this course is to cultivate artistic appreciation, establish personal aesthetic perspectives and comprehend the prevailing social and cultural trends in art. The course further aims to enhance students' capacity for self-growth, integrate art into their daily lives, and elevate their overall living experience.
全18週

PE-Basketball2
本課程透過對籃球運動二人、三人進攻和防守組合的戰術與技術介紹，增進學生半場賽對抗的技能，並享受團隊互助合作與默契的樂趣，以及裁判能力的養成。課程內容包括二人組合進攻、防守戰術與技術，三人組合進攻、防守戰術與技術。規則部分各種違例、犯規的介紹，半場比賽裁判執法演練。

match.

學習與養成良好的各種基本技術後並加強比賽技術、戰術的應用與結合，以期能在桌球比賽中獲得有效成果。如有優質的各種基本技術及搭配單打戰術應用就能在比賽中直接得分與攻擊。在比賽技術中有良好優質的接發球戰術就能先發制人，且能有效控制對方直接攻擊得分，其贏球機率高。因此在單打技術、戰術應用桌球技術中佔有極重要性。
After learning and cultivating various kinds of basic skills,
a player should reinforce the applications and combinations of singles and tactics, aiming to have effective results in table tennis games. If a player has various kinds of superior basic skills combined with the applications of singles tactics, he/she can score and attack directly in a game. In terms of singles, if a player has superior tactics for receiving and serving the ball, he/she can take the initiative and control his/her opponent effectively to attack and score directly, so that he/she will have a greater chance to win the game; therefore, such tactics has great importance in table tennis skills regarding singles and tactics applications.
全18週

Medical-Surgical Nursing and practice I
本課程目的為增進學生照顧住院內外科疾病個案的護理知識，瞭解個案因疾病、檢查及治療所產生的生理、心理及社會的行為反應，培養運用批判性思考及護理過程，在實作課程中進行整體需要評估，確立健康問題，依個別需要，計劃和執行可行的護理措施，以提供內外科疾病個案之整體性護理，並認識未來臨床護理實務發展趨勢。
This course is designed to enhance students’ nursing knowledge and skills for hospitalized clients with medical and surgical conditions. Students could learn to apply critical thinking and nursing process to identify clients’ physiological, psychological, and social behavioral responses related to disease, diagnostic tests, and treatment in nursing lab. After health problems are identified, students will make individualized care plans and feasible nursing interventions to meet the needs of clients. In addition, students could better understand the trend of clinical practice.
全18週

01
Introduction of Biostatistics
授與提昇研究能力與增進閱讀學術文獻有關統計能力之知識與概念。其內容包括敘述統計學（集中趨勢量數、離中趨勢量數、分布、作圖與作表）以及推論統計學（區間估計與考驗之過程，Z score、pooled-t test、paired-t test、卡方、one-way ANOVA、皮爾遜積差相關、線性迴歸與無母數分析等）。課中利用EXCEL資料分析工具及各式小型科學電算器如Casio 36PV等協助運算，期能達成理論與實務之結合為目的。
This course is to offer fundamental statistical concepts related to the practice of nursing. The contents include population & samples descriptive statistics; probability; sampling; statistical distributions; estimation; hypothesis testing; pooled samples
全18週

Maternal-Newborn Nursing Care and Practice
本課程旨在培養學生婦嬰照護的專業能力，課程內容強調正確臨床決策、不傷害的概念、以服務對象為中心的人際互動、護理指導、婦嬰實務及尊重文化差異等。課程結構以運用模擬情境為主，透過情境教學討論培養學生分析、綜合、批判、思考、創意等能力，並能於虛擬情境中融合婦嬰照護的專業知識、技能與態度完成護理過程。
The purpose of this course is to assist the students having the professional abilities of Maternal-Newborn nursing Care which including precious decision-making, client-centered interrelationships, nursing direction, clinical practice and respecting cultural differences. 
The structure of this course is emphasized on the modified clinical situation where the students could generate the knowledge, skills, and attitude related to Maternal-Newborn Nursing Care to apply nursing processes and perform the professional abilities in helping woman and her family to adapt the processes of pregnancy and childbirth. The contents include: 
1. Family-centered maternity nursing care,
2. Physical assessment,
3. Childbirth education,
4. Child-parental attachment, 
5. Breast feeding, and
6. Culture and birth.

01
Introduction to Contemporary Art
本課程以現代性的概念，貫連二十世紀至當前的藝術潮流發展，探討當代藝術的幾個重要流派、特性與不同面向，呈現藝術發展的獨特性與創造性。培養藝術涵養及建立個人對審美的主體觀，並瞭解當前社會藝術文化脈動，對當代的文化思潮有其見地，以開展學生發展自我潛能，並將藝術融入生活，提升生命境界。
This course employs the concept of modernity as a framework to establish connections between the evolution of artistic trends from the 20th century to the present day. The course delves into various significant genres, characteristics, and different aspects of contemporary art, thereby highlighting the distinctiveness and creativity of artistic development. The objective of this course is to cultivate artistic appreciation, establish personal aesthetic perspectives and comprehend the prevailing social and cultural trends in art. The course further aims to enhance students' capacity for self-growth, integrate art into their daily lives, and elevate their overall living experience.
全18週

01
Introduction of Professional Law
本課程醫護法學之介紹，使學生對法律結構、法學理念及我國現行法有一整體性的認知，以奠定法學啟發基礎。從醫護正義概念出發，就醫護法規、醫護法制、護理法律責任與訴訟、醫護人員切身法律問題等，深入淺出有系統的介紹，以培養現代醫護人員正確的法律觀。並從醫護業務與法律實務的角度，點出護理人員與其他醫事人員的責任分際、臨床醫護人員與公共衛生醫護人員面臨法律問題的不同、醫病糾紛的預防與處理等，以強化醫護人員處理法律問題的能力。
This subject is taught by way of the introduction of the basic law to let the students to understand the whole outline of the construction of law，the virtue of the jurisprudence and the  present law in Taiwan.  It begins as the teaching of the concept of the professional justice and is succeeded by introducing the medical and nursing law，the institution of the professional law，the responsibility and litigation as well as the professional liability of the member of professional society to ensure the students to know the exact concept of the law and to develop problem-solving abilities .
全18週

01
Human Anatomy
本課程是以學習人體解剖學課程內容為主要目標，包括: 細胞及組織的認識，骨骼、肌肉、循環、神經、呼吸、消化、泌尿、內分泌和生殖系統構造的瞭解，並靈活應用於護理專業基礎及專業核心課程之學習。
The purpose of this course is to introduce anatomical principles  and mechanism of body 
structure, and further helps students to integrate related concepts and understand the relationship 
between structures and their functions. The contents include cellular anatomy, skeletal system, 
anatomy of nerve and muscle, central nervous system, cardiovascular system, respiratory system, 
digestive system, urinary system, reproductive system, endocrine system and applied surface 
anatomy

Incident Management and First Aid
本課程旨在培養學生獲得緊急處置之知能及公共安全問題之認知。課程內容主要包括：緊急救護法規及政策、緊急救護系統、災難處置、逃生知識及傷病患疏散、救護等緊急處置。使其在發生緊急事故或災害之際，能冷靜、評估且迅速的做適當處理，使生命的傷害及財產損失降至最低。
The emphasis in this course is on the enhancement of the knowledge base and skill for 
public security. The content includes legal aspects of hospital      disaster management, 
emergency care systems, prevention and management of common incidents seen in 
hospital and related facilities, and ways of escape from dangerous scenes. In addition, the 
practice of bandage and mobilization is provided. The student is expected to be able in 
managing unexpected incidents critically and minimizing loss of health, lives, and 
properties.

Introduction of International Health
本課程的目的在介紹有關全球健康議題相關概念給對於全球化有興趣的大學層級學生。課程主題包括全球健康議題，不同族群的健康焦點，包括全球不同地理區域的兒童、婦女、青少年、老人與原住民，以及傳染性疾病。學生將透過檢視國際健康資料庫以瞭解健康相關的衝擊與非政府組織之影響。
The course aims to provide introductory content in global health related issues useful for baccalaureate level of students who interests in the era of globalization, regardless of whether they personally plan to live or work. The themes introduced include global health issues, health foci in different aggregates which include children, women, adolescents, elderly and aboriginal health problem across geographic regions, communicable disease. Students will examine international documents that have the potential to impact health, and non-governmental organizations.

Cancer Care
本課程目標在協助學生獲得有關成人癌症的知識與技能，能評估癌症個案身、心、社會的需要與問題，並能識別個案家庭因癌症所造成之影響；綜合運用護理過程、教與學原理等相關知識與技能，協助癌症個案滿足身、心、社會的需要與家庭健康的照顧。課程內容包括：癌症的疾病基本概念，癌症的治療與其副作用護理，癌症病人常見的症狀評估與護理，如：感染、凝血障礙、營養、噁心嘔吐、疼痛、呼吸困難等。腫瘤急症護理及末期病人之安寧照護亦為本課程教授之重點。
This course aims to provide  advanced knowledge  about care for the adult oncology patients and 
their family and  to strengthen concepts of continuity care and  the importance of multidisciplinary  in 
cancer care. The concept of holistic nursing care and the trajectory of cancer experience will be utilized 
as frameworks to introduce nursing care for oncology patients. Course contents include general concepts 
of cancer, cancer treatment modalities, symptom control, psycho-social needs of cancer patients, family
impact in cancer care. Symptoms that are commonly seen in adult oncology patients will be emphasized.
全18週

Epidemiology
本課程是介紹流行病學的基本概念和理論，強調學生能培養獨立思考判斷，具備發現及解決問題的能力。在課程設計方面除了使學生能練習操作在資料收集過程中，判斷資料的正確性及整合資訊的能力，並能針對社區及醫院中常見的問題討論及提出因應之道，課程內容除了介紹流行病學的基本知識外，學習疾病自然史、致病因即健康與疾病狀態的測量及監測，瞭解流行病學的方法及相關領域的知識，並進而能靈活應用在專業的實務工作中。
This course is aimed to consider the application of epidemiological concepts and methods to health care, planning, intervention and evaluation and to facilitate and develop skills of epidemiology into different community and clinical settings. The course content includes introduction to epidemiology, the nature history of disease, measuring and monitoring health and disease, types of epidemiological study, confounders and biases. By the end of this course, students should have:

(a)developed an appreciation of the advantages and limitations of epidemiology in assessing health needs, determining priorities, establishing interventions and evaluating these;
(b)consolidated their understanding of applied epidemiological concepts and methods, relating these to health problems in both community and clinical settings, and
(c)participated actively in debates concerning the value of epidemiological evidence in health policy decision-making and considered how this might apply to health problems with which the course participant may be concerned.
全18週

This course is to offer students the necessary knowledge and skills of nursing that apply holistic nursing care to provide direct patient care in critical care units. This course is based on the nursing management process, including planning, organizing, human resources management, leadership and controlling, etc. The curriculum focuses on the physiology, pathology, treatment and drug therapy. It is also demonstrate equipments and nursing care in critical care as well. Students are expected to initiate their knowledge and interests in nursing administration, and utilize these knowledge and skills in the future nursing career.

Introduction of Case Management in Long-Term Care
本課程主在介紹長期照護個案管理的基本知能，包括：個案管理/照護管理名詞、緣起與發展、個案管理在長期照護常見應用領域與樣態、個管實務操作流程與原則、個案管理人員的角色功能、個管服務成效以及國外個管發展的應用經驗等議題。學習者在引導下，同時透過長期照護不同服務情境與案例，運用反思進行討論，同時也發揮關懷態度及團隊合作能力完成課程指定學習活動，使學生能夠在既有專業基礎上增加長期照護個案管理相關知能。
The purpose of this course is to help students to gain the basic knowledge and skill that related to the case management in Long Term Care. It include the concept, models, process and the application and practice of case management in long term care.Under the guidance, learners through multi-teaching strategies and learning methods (for example: through reflection, group discussion and sharing, self-learning activities, etc.) to acquire the knowledge of case management. Learners take the initiative to show concern and work as a team to complete the classroom assignments to achieve learners' awareness of case management in long-term care services. After complete the course, the students will be able: (1) to understand the knowledge of case management; (2) to apply the case management values and principles in long term care practices; (3) to identify the role/competency, and the function of a case manager in long term care. It can be applied to the field of long-term care practice role, execution and management in the existing professional foundation.

01
Games and Strategies
「賽局理論」對多數人來說或許都是一個遙不可及的名詞。也許有一部份人從《美麗境界(a beautiful mind)》這部電影所描述的John Forbes Nash, Jr.生平事蹟獲得一些概念，也許一部份概念來自諾貝爾經濟學獎自1994頒發給包括Nash的三位專攻賽局的經濟學家（以及其後包括2005年的 ROBERT J. AUMANN 與THOMAS C. SCHELLING和2007年的LEONID HURWICZ , ERIC S. MASKIN , 與ROGER B. MYERSON）。儘管有這些訊息，賽局這個概念對多數人還是非常模糊。
簡單地說，賽局在討論決策者在特定情境下的互動關係。從前面所提到這些學者的背景可以知道，賽局的研究在經濟學（以及數學）的應用相當重要而廣泛。事實上，賽局理論更明確的角色與地位應該屬於一種分析工具（或思考邏輯）。從這樣的界定裡，賽局的應用將更寬廣。不論是前面提到的經濟學、數學或是政治學、社會學、管理學乃至於生物學都可以看到賽局的蹤跡。
Game theory has become an enormously important field of study. It is now a vital methodology for researchers in many disciplines, including economics, business, political science, biology and law. The goals of the course are to provide a basic level of introduction of the subject and applications. We start from some familiar examples and application that we may easily observe. Along the introduction and discussion of the examples, we will incorporate some basic yet important concepts and terminologies of game theory.
全18週

Medical-Surgical Nursing Practicum  II
本實習課程主要是協助學生整合基礎醫學及內外科護理學I、II知識應用於臨床情境中。實習中學生能以護理專業知識為基礎，運用批判性思考及護理過程處理個案常見之健康問題，並判斷優先順序，擬定及執行個別性的護理措施，同時能提供個案及家屬所需的護理指導，並評值護理措施的成效。學生在實習過程中展現自我學習及參與醫療團隊的互動，藉以學習溝通合作能力，並分享其臨床實習之感受與角色適應。
This course aims to facilitate students to integrate knowledge learned in basic medicine courses and Medical and Surgical Nursing I and II in clinical situation. Students will be able to apply concepts of critical thinking and nursing process based on knowledge of nursing to identify health problems, design proper nursing activities and health education, and evaluate outcomes to clients with medical and surgical disorders. Observation activity in OR, recovery room or special exam rooms may be arranged if it can enhance students learning. Students also have opportunities to demonstrate self-directed learning, participate in interactions with medical team, and practice communication and cooperation abilities. Students are encouraged to share their feelings and role adaptation through the process of clinical practice.

本課程旨在透過講述、e 化、翻轉、自主和案例省思等教學與學習方法，協助學生獲得護理行政管理之知識、態度與技能。課程內容以護理管理過程為架構，主要包括：規劃、組織、人力資源管理、領導及控制等，以期啟發學生對自我管理及護理行政管理之認識與興趣，並能實際運用於臨床業務。
This course is designed for students to acquire the knowledge and skills of nursing administration, and it contents nursing management process, planning, organization, human resource management, leadership, control, and so on. Each student is encouraged to initiate her or his knowledge and interest in nursing administrative field and to utilize the course knowledge and skills in nursing career in the future.

PE- Body Movement Creation
透過身體伸展、舞蹈動作，以引導與循序漸進的方式，搭配呼吸與身體延展的肢體動作，及強化肌耐力之動作練習，讓肌肉在練習間，透過感知與身體達到身心平衡的狀態。透過身體實作，體驗肢體的可能性及認識舞蹈表演藝術。以肢體開發的概念，透過舞蹈與遊戲的方式，開發身體感知能力與使用之方式，建立對身體的了解與使用。

01
Clinical Practice in Child Health Nursing
本課程設計旨在協助學生運用基礎生物醫學科學、一般臨床護理技能與批判性思考技巧於兒童及家庭之照護。課程內容以「家庭為中心」及「兒童發展理論」為主軸，探討各年齡層兒童生理、心理、社會發展及常見之健康議題，於臨床討論中展現關懷與克盡職責能力及對護理倫理議題之關注，透過臨床實作、反思、小組討論與分享等多元教學策略，發揮溝通合作與培養終身學習之能力，以達成本實習目標。
This course focuses on the application of nursing process in prevention, maintenance and restoration of common children health problems. The content includes etiology, pathophysiology, treatment and nursing modalities of these health problems. Application of theoretical concepts of growth and development related to nursing care of the child and his/her family is strongly emphasized.
第4~18週

01
Technology and Life
以學生現有的數理、生物背景為基礎，引導學生進入科技應用的領域。現代科技進步快速，世界日新月異，學生需具備有敏銳之觀察力與學習能力，始能跟上時代之潮流。本課程將目前先進之科技作一概念性的介紹；涵蓋有太空科技、能源應用、材料科技、生物技術、資訊科技等內容，期能一窺世界之奧妙，進而引發學習新知之動機與興趣。
At the dawn of the twenty-first century today, as every citizen of the world should have a basic scientific concept and knowledge which can serve people to make the decisions, participate in civic and cultural affairs, and join economic production activities. Also, beside the professional expertise and technology, the most important thing for the citizens is to care about humanities, develop themselves actively, and benefit the people and serve the community.
The major purpose of this course is from the new technology of modern life to induced the students knowing the basic applied science and technique concept. From the simpler chemistry, physics and biologic technology, step by step , let students know more the world and more interesting about the new matters and new technology.
The studentswho finish this course will know the basic applied science and technology and more understanding about the world we lived.
全18週

Principles of Teaching and Learning in Nursing Practice
本課程旨在培養學生基本的教學能力，使學生能運用教學原理進行個人、家庭與社區等照護對象健康指導之教學過程，同時讓學生體認在健康照護實務中的功能及應有的態度。學生修習本課程中，必須實際完成教學計劃的擬定、執行與評值過程。課程單元包括：教學在健康照護中的角色與功能、教與學的原則、教學設計、學習評估、教學計畫、各種教學方法、教學媒體、教學評值等。
This course will assist student to develop basic competencies in health teaching for individuals, families and communities and to experience the teaching function and attitude in health care practice. Actual student teaching projects will be developed, implemented, and evaluated.
The course content includes the interdisciplinary nature of health teaching, principles of teaching and learning, instructional design, assessment of learning needs, teaching plan, instructional strategies, instructional media and instructional evaluation.

Practicum on Psychiatric Nursing
本實習課程旨在協助學生應用壓力適應模式與精神衛生護理相關理論，提供個案精神衛生之基本照顧活動與服務，含：建立治療性人際關係，進行整體性護理評估，提供精神衛生照顧與護理指導，探索精神衛生護理人員的角色與功能、認識與精神衛生治療相關的模式、法律知識、社區資源，進而體會到精神衛生對個人健康的重要性，並展現自我覺察、自治、自學的態度。
The purpose of this course is to cultivate the student an individual Psychiatric nursing ability. This course emphasis on that the students apply their psychiatric nursing knowledge and nursing skill in the clinical psychiatric nursing situation. The students are expected to experience the process of the therapeutic nurse- patient relationship, realize the therapeutic use of self, help client to develop a positive self-concept and corrective relationship、view and emulate the role and function of the psychiatric nurse.

Psychiatric Nursing and Practice
本課程旨在培養四年制學生具備執行精神衛生護理的關懷、溝通與合作與批判思考等基本能力。課程內容包括我國精神衛生有關的政策、法律、業務與推展現況、基本理念、常用的精神衛生照護模式及處置，並期許學生增進精神衛生護理知識、態度與技能。
This course provides nursing students with the basic knowledge and skills about psychiatric patient nursing care. The major elements include the policies, laws, regulations, theories and skills of advanced psychiatric mental health nursing, and missions of psychiatric nursing organizations. Students are required to identify and establish their own philosophy of nursing as well as to recognize psychiatric mental health nurse’s roles and functions. Nursing assessment, interventions and evaluation used by psychiatric clinicians are presented and discussed in this class.

Clinical Practice of Maternal-Newborn Nursing Care
本課程旨在提供學生有關孕期、分娩及產後的婦女及家庭真實的臨床護理情境，使學生能融合婦嬰照護的知識、技能與態度，完成護理過程並展現專業能力。
The purposes of this clinical course are designed to provide the students with a variety of clinical experiences （OPD, BR, DR, and postpartum units） in order to enhance their childreading/childbearing knowledge base. It also provides the opportunities for students to provide nursing care to the childbearing family during the antepartum, intrapartum, and postpartum periods.

01
Maternal-Newborn Nursing Care and Practice
本課程旨在培養學生婦嬰照護的專業能力，課程內容強調正確臨床決策、不傷害的概念、以服務對象為中心的人際互動、護理指導、婦嬰實務及尊重文化差異等。課程結構以運用模擬情境為主，透過情境教學討論培養學生分析、綜合、批判、思考、創意等能力，並能於虛擬情境中融合婦嬰照護的專業知識、技能與態度完成護理過程。
The purpose of this course is to assist the students having the professional abilities of Maternal-Newborn nursing Care which including precious decision-making, client-centered interrelationships, nursing direction, clinical practice and respecting cultural differences. 
The structure of this course is emphasized on the modified clinical situation where the students could generate the knowledge, skills, and attitude related to Maternal-Newborn Nursing Care to apply nursing processes and perform the professional abilities in helping woman and her family to adapt the processes of pregnancy and childbirth. The contents include: 
1. Family-centered maternity nursing care,
2. Physical assessment,
3. Childbirth education,
4. Child-parental attachment, 
5. Breast feeding, and
6. Culture and birth.
第1~3週

01
Principles of Teaching and Learning in Nursing Practice
本課程旨在培養學生基本的教學能力，使學生能運用教學原理進行個人、家庭與社區等照護對象健康指導之教學過程，同時讓學生體認在健康照護實務中的功能及應有的態度。學生修習本課程中，必須實際完成教學計劃的擬定、執行與評值過程。課程單元包括：教學在健康照護中的角色與功能、教與學的原則、教學設計、學習評估、教學計畫、各種教學方法、教學媒體、教學評值等。
This course will assist student to develop basic competencies in health teaching for individuals, families and communities and to experience the teaching function and attitude in health care practice. Actual student teaching projects will be developed, implemented, and evaluated.
The course content includes the interdisciplinary nature of health teaching, principles of teaching and learning, instructional design, assessment of learning needs, teaching plan, instructional strategies, instructional media and instructional evaluation.
全18週

Medical Organization and Management
本課程旨在透過講述、e 化、翻轉、自主和案例省思等教學與學習方法，協助學生獲得護理行政管理之知識、態度與技能。課程內容以護理管理過程為架構，主要包括：規劃、組織、人力資源管理、領導及控制等，以期啟發學生對自我管理及護理行政管理之認識與興趣，並能實際運用於臨床業務。
This course is designed for students to acquire the knowledge and skills of nursing administration, and it contents nursing management process, planning, organization, human resource management, leadership, control, and so on. Each student is encouraged to initiate her or his knowledge and interest in nursing administrative field and to utilize the course knowledge and skills in nursing career in the future.

PE- Pickleball
利用循序漸進的教學方式，教導學生匹克球的基本動作，透過對匹克球基本動作的熟練，進而提昇學生對匹克球比賽的興趣、享受匹克球運動的樂趣。講授匹克球運動的規則及比賽策略。強調運動員必須在規則範圍內做合法的競賽，透過匹克球運動來幫助學生守法、守分與合作的精神，並協助運動習慣的養成，期望學生能以匹克球運動作為終身運動。
The content of course is to instruct students’ Pickleball skill by using step-by-step teaching method. Over the basic movement of the skilled is to enhance the students' interest in Pickleball game and enjoyment the fun of Pickleball. The rules and strategies of teaching Pickleball to emphasize that athletes must be legitimate competition in the scope of the rules through the sport of Pickleball to help students to obey the law, be law-abiding and cooperation spirit, Therefor, students are expected to develop the habit of exercise and to choice Pickleball as a lifetime of activity.
