01
Pathology
病理學是探討疾病的原因、機轉、病理變化及過程、預後等的一門學問 課程分二大部分1.概論2.各論。 概論主要介紹外來的傷害與疾病的刺激對細胞與組織所造成的共通的變化、與反應與機轉。詳細內容包括細胞傷害與死亡、炎症與癒合、細胞生長發育的異常、體液代謝障礙、免疫與腫瘤、遺傳、代謝與營養疾病。 各論討論各器官系統其各類疾病的致病原因、機轉，病理變化及臨床表現等。詳細 的內容包括心臟血管系統疾病、呼吸系統疾病、肝臟及膽管系統疾病、消化系統及 胰臟疾病、內分泌系統疾病、血液與淋巴系統疾病、腎臟疾病、男性生殖系統疾病、
The scientific focus of pathology is on the etiology of disease, the mechanisms of pathogenesis, and the pathways by which morphologic changes occur.  Pathogenesis of diseases will be discussed on the molecular basis to facilitate the understanding of difficult concepts. The content of this coursed are design to fit the requirement for who will be working in the field of nursing.   
The curriculum is divided into 2 major parts: (1) General Pathology and (2) Systemic Pathology.      General Pathology introduces the effects of exogenous injurious agents on the cells and tissues, and the resultant cellular changes, reactions and diseases.  The contents include: introduction, cell injury and cell death, metabolic disturbances of the body fluids, immunologic disorders, inflammation and repair, neoplasia, genetic disorders, chemical and physical injuries and metabolic and nutritional diseases.    
Systemic pathology discusses the etiology and pathogenesis of various disease entities from the aspects of each organ system.  This covers the diseases of the cardiovascular system,  the respiratory system, the digestive system, the musculoskeletal system and nervous system;   the disorders of the endocrines, the kidneys, the male reproductive organs, the breast and the female reproductive organs and the skin.
全18週

The main teaching activities are problem based learning, though the clinical cases reports, interactive discussions and conferences, the student recognize the pathological phenomenon of human diseases.

Basic Nursing and Practicum
本課程培養學生具有護理專業之基本知識與技能。課室內容包括觀察與專業性人際關係、醫療環境、個案各種基本需要之護理等。學生透過討論、反思、技術練習、回示教、自主學習體驗活動等多元教學策略與學習方法，學習主動展現關懷、基本護理學相關知識及技能並發揮團隊合作完成課室指定之報告，以達成學生對基本護理學之知識、態度與技能的學習，並能運用於臨床實務中。
This course provided for developing students' foundational knowledge and skills in nursing. The content includes professional interpersonal relationships, healthcare environments, and the fundamental needs of patients. Employing a rich array of teaching methodologies, including discussions, reflection, technical practice, guided instruction, and independent learning experiences, students are actively encouraged to demonstrate compassionate care, acquire pertinent knowledge and skills, and collaborate within teams. Ultimately, the objective is to equip students with the capability to apply their acquired knowledge, attitudes, and skills in real-world clinical practice.
全18週

01
Nutrition & Nutrition Experiment
本課程是以營養學為基礎，搭配如理想體重、飲食指南、飲食指標、DRIs、食物代換表、營養標示等單元介紹，並以六大類營養素為主軸結合疾病療養學的應用，例如介紹熱量的概念後，以體重控制為例；介紹碳水化合物的生理功能後，搭配糖尿病的飲食保健；介紹脂肪的生理功能時，搭配心血管疾病的飲食保健；在蛋白質單元課程則與慢性腎衰竭營養治療飲食原則結合；維生素單元以抗氧化劑的介紹為搭配；礦物質的介紹則以骨質疏鬆症的營養保健搭配；另一方面介紹住院病人營養評估、營養支持與腸道營養配方等單元，讓學生可以把基礎營養學與相關的疾病營養照護的概念聯成一氣，培育保健照護產業中關懷助人及敬業樂群的護理專業實務人才。
The course of Clinical Nutrition is design for the 4- year program of Nursing 
Department consists two parts. The first part introduces the concept of nutrition. Such 
as body weight management, dietary guideline, dietary goal, DRIs, exchange list, 
nutrition label.The second part introduces the nutritional care and the diet therapy on 
various diseases, such as obesity, DM, atherosclerosis disease, chronic renal failure, 
osteoporosis, nutritional deficiency (such anemia) etc.

01
Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
全18週

Pharmacology
本課程之設計係以四技護理系學生為授課對象，課程內容著重於培養學生對臨床用藥的認知及應能力；故以深入淺出之方式探討物於人體理作機轉，並介紹與臨床應用有關之藥品動力、交互作副及物中毒解等課程單元內容包括：藥理學概論、自主神經系統作用劑心臟血管中樞劑、自泌素相關藥物影響內分及新陳代謝以化學治療等。
This pharmacology is a two credit hour course and designed especially for students of nursing. This curriculum emphasizes on the clinical applications and action mechanisms of various drugs. The curriculum training will start from more details and bring a completely concepts, including general concepts of clinical pharmacokinetics, drugs interaction and antidote of drugs. The course outlines include of autonomic nervous system, cardiovascular system, central nervous system, endocrine and metabolism system, autacoids and chemotherapy related drugs.

01
Physical Examination and Practice
本課程旨在提供已具有解剖、生理、病理及心理學知識的學習者，學習身體評估之知識與技巧。課程目標在增進學生身體評估技術的正確性與完整性，進而培育學生關懷、溝通與合作的專業素養; 教學策略將針對不足之學理，進行澄清和討論，各項評估能力則利用角色扮演並藉由示教及分組練習，使學生能有系統的進行個案整體性的身體評估。課程內涵強調以人為本及整體觀，使學生能於設計的模擬情境中展現臨床決策、溝通能力、關懷與專業倫理，並應用於護理情境中。
This course is designed to provide students who already have knowledge of anatomy and physiology to learn the knowledge and skills of physical examination. The goal of the course is to improve the correctness and completeness of students' physical examination techniques, thereby develop students' professional qualities of care, communication, and cooperation. The teaching strategy will be to clarify and discuss deficiencies in academic theory, and to practice physical examination through role-play, demonstration, and group practice. Thereafter, students can systematically conduct a comprehensive physical examination of different cases. The content of the course emphasizes a person-centered and holistic view, enabling students to demonstrate clinical decision-making, communication skills, caring and professional ethics in designed simulated situations, and allow students to apply them in actual nursing situations.
全18週

01
Pathology
病理學是探討疾病的原因、機轉、病理變化及過程、預後等的一門學問 課程分二大部分1.概論2.各論。 概論主要介紹外來的傷害與疾病的刺激對細胞與組織所造成的共通的變化、與反應與機轉。詳細內容包括細胞傷害與死亡、炎症與癒合、細胞生長發育的異常、體液代謝障礙、免疫與腫瘤、遺傳、代謝與營養疾病。 各論討論各器官系統其各類疾病的致病原因、機轉，病理變化及臨床表現等。詳細 的內容包括心臟血管系統疾病、呼吸系統疾病、肝臟及膽管系統疾病、消化系統及 胰臟疾病、內分泌系統疾病、血液與淋巴系統疾病、腎臟疾病、男性生殖系統疾病、
The scientific focus of pathology is on the etiology of disease, the mechanisms of pathogenesis, and the pathways by which morphologic changes occur.  Pathogenesis of diseases will be discussed on the molecular basis to facilitate the understanding of difficult concepts. The content of this coursed are design to fit the requirement for who will be working in the field of nursing.   
The curriculum is divided into 2 major parts: (1) General Pathology and (2) Systemic Pathology.      General Pathology introduces the effects of exogenous injurious agents on the cells and tissues, and the resultant cellular changes, reactions and diseases.  The contents include: introduction, cell injury and cell death, metabolic disturbances of the body fluids, immunologic disorders, inflammation and repair, neoplasia, genetic disorders, chemical and physical injuries and metabolic and nutritional diseases.    
Systemic pathology discusses the etiology and pathogenesis of various disease entities from the aspects of each organ system.  This covers the diseases of the cardiovascular system,  the respiratory system, the digestive system, the musculoskeletal system and nervous system;   the disorders of the endocrines, the kidneys, the male reproductive organs, the breast and the female reproductive organs and the skin.
全18週

Pathology Experiment
病理學實驗教學旨在使學生融合病理知識與疾病的臨床表徵. 課程內容包括: 實驗病理學、感染性疾病、,臨床病理學、心臟血管系統疾病、呼吸系統疾病、肝臟及膽管系統疾病、消化系統及肝胰臟疾病、 內分泌系統疾病、血液與淋巴系統疾病、腎臟疾病、男性生殖系統疾病、乳房及女性生殖系統疾病、骨骼肌肉系統、神經系統疾病、皮膚疾病的病例說明與病理討論。
The curriculum introduce the main works of anatomic pathology and clinical pathology first , then follows the courses which cover the diseases of cardiovascular system, respiratory system,  digestive system, lymphoid and hemopoietic system, the disorders of the kidneys, the male reproductive organs, the breast and the female reproductive organs, and the diseases of central nerve system. The main teaching activities are problem based learning, though the clinical cases reports, interactive discussions and conferences, the student recognize the pathological phenomenon of human diseases.

Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
全18週

Pharmacology

This pharmacology is a two credit hour course and designed especially for students of nursing. This curriculum emphasizes on the clinical applications and action mechanisms of various drugs. The curriculum training will start from more details and bring a completely concepts, including general concepts of clinical pharmacokinetics, drugs interaction and antidote of drugs. The course outlines include of autonomic nervous system, cardiovascular system, central nervous system, endocrine and metabolism system, autacoids and chemotherapy related drugs.

01
Physical Examination and Practice
本課程旨在提供已具有解剖、生理、病理及心理學知識的學習者，學習身體評估之知識與技巧。課程目標在增進學生身體評估技術的正確性與完整性，進而培育學生關懷、溝通與合作的專業素養; 教學策略將針對不足之學理，進行澄清和討論，各項評估能力則利用角色扮演並藉由示教及分組練習，使學生能有系統的進行個案整體性的身體評估。課程內涵強調以人為本及整體觀，使學生能於設計的模擬情境中展現臨床決策、溝通能力、關懷與專業倫理，並應用於護理情境中。
This course is designed to provide students who already have knowledge of anatomy and physiology to learn the knowledge and skills of physical examination. The goal of the course is to improve the correctness and completeness of students' physical examination techniques, thereby develop students' professional qualities of care, communication, and cooperation. The teaching strategy will be to clarify and discuss deficiencies in academic theory, and to practice physical examination through role-play, demonstration, and group practice. Thereafter, students can systematically conduct a comprehensive physical examination of different cases. The content of the course emphasizes a person-centered and holistic view, enabling students to demonstrate clinical decision-making, communication skills, caring and professional ethics in designed simulated situations, and allow students to apply them in actual nursing situations.

01
Pathology
病理學是探討疾病的原因、機轉、病理變化及過程、預後等的一門學問 課程分二大部分1.概論2.各論。 概論主要介紹外來的傷害與疾病的刺激對細胞與組織所造成的共通的變化、與反應與機轉。詳細內容包括細胞傷害與死亡、炎症與癒合、細胞生長發育的異常、體液代謝障礙、免疫與腫瘤、遺傳、代謝與營養疾病。 各論討論各器官系統其各類疾病的致病原因、機轉，病理變化及臨床表現等。詳細 的內容包括心臟血管系統疾病、呼吸系統疾病、肝臟及膽管系統疾病、消化系統及 胰臟疾病、內分泌系統疾病、血液與淋巴系統疾病、腎臟疾病、男性生殖系統疾病、
The scientific focus of pathology is on the etiology of disease, the mechanisms of pathogenesis, and the pathways by which morphologic changes occur.  Pathogenesis of diseases will be discussed on the molecular basis to facilitate the understanding of difficult concepts. The content of this coursed are design to fit the requirement for who will be working in the field of nursing.   
The curriculum is divided into 2 major parts: (1) General Pathology and (2) Systemic Pathology.      General Pathology introduces the effects of exogenous injurious agents on the cells and tissues, and the resultant cellular changes, reactions and diseases.  The contents include: introduction, cell injury and cell death, metabolic disturbances of the body fluids, immunologic disorders, inflammation and repair, neoplasia, genetic disorders, chemical and physical injuries and metabolic and nutritional diseases.    
Systemic pathology discusses the etiology and pathogenesis of various disease entities from the aspects of each organ system.  This covers the diseases of the cardiovascular system,  the respiratory system, the digestive system, the musculoskeletal system and nervous system;   the disorders of the endocrines, the kidneys, the male reproductive organs, the breast and the female reproductive organs and the skin.
全18週

The main teaching activities are problem based learning, though the clinical cases reports, interactive discussions and conferences, the student recognize the pathological phenomenon of human diseases.

Basic Nursing and Practicum
本課程培養學生具有護理專業之基本知識與技能。課室內容包括觀察與專業性人際關係、醫療環境、個案各種基本需要之護理等。學生透過討論、反思、技術練習、回示教、自主學習體驗活動等多元教學策略與學習方法，學習主動展現關懷、基本護理學相關知識及技能並發揮團隊合作完成課室指定之報告，以達成學生對基本護理學之知識、態度與技能的學習，並能運用於臨床實務中。
This course provided for developing students' foundational knowledge and skills in nursing. The content includes professional interpersonal relationships, healthcare environments, and the fundamental needs of patients. Employing a rich array of teaching methodologies, including discussions, reflection, technical practice, guided instruction, and independent learning experiences, students are actively encouraged to demonstrate compassionate care, acquire pertinent knowledge and skills, and collaborate within teams. Ultimately, the objective is to equip students with the capability to apply their acquired knowledge, attitudes, and skills in real-world clinical practice.

Nutrition & Nutrition Experiment
本課程是以營養學為基礎，搭配如理想體重、飲食指南、飲食指標、DRIs、食物代換表、營養標示等單元介紹，並以六大類營養素為主軸結合疾病療養學的應用，例如介紹熱量的概念後，以體重控制為例；介紹碳水化合物的生理功能後，搭配糖尿病的飲食保健；介紹脂肪的生理功能時，搭配心血管疾病的飲食保健；在蛋白質單元課程則與慢性腎衰竭營養治療飲食原則結合；維生素單元以抗氧化劑的介紹為搭配；礦物質的介紹則以骨質疏鬆症的營養保健搭配；另一方面介紹住院病人營養評估、營養支持與腸道營養配方等單元，讓學生可以把基礎營養學與相關的疾病營養照護的概念聯成一氣，培育保健照護產業中關懷助人及敬業樂群的護理專業實務人才。
The course of Clinical Nutrition is design for the 4- year program of Nursing 
Department consists two parts. The first part introduces the concept of nutrition. Such 
as body weight management, dietary guideline, dietary goal, DRIs, exchange list, 
nutrition label.The second part introduces the nutritional care and the diet therapy on 
various diseases, such as obesity, DM, atherosclerosis disease, chronic renal failure, 
osteoporosis, nutritional deficiency (such anemia) etc.

Physical Examination and Practice
本課程旨在提供已具有解剖、生理、病理及心理學知識的學習者，學習身體評估之知識與技巧。課程目標在增進學生身體評估技術的正確性與完整性，進而培育學生關懷、溝通與合作的專業素養; 教學策略將針對不足之學理，進行澄清和討論，各項評估能力則利用角色扮演並藉由示教及分組練習，使學生能有系統的進行個案整體性的身體評估。課程內涵強調以人為本及整體觀，使學生能於設計的模擬情境中展現臨床決策、溝通能力、關懷與專業倫理，並應用於護理情境中。
This course is designed to provide students who already have knowledge of anatomy and physiology to learn the knowledge and skills of physical examination. The goal of the course is to improve the correctness and completeness of students' physical examination techniques, thereby develop students' professional qualities of care, communication, and cooperation. The teaching strategy will be to clarify and discuss deficiencies in academic theory, and to practice physical examination through role-play, demonstration, and group practice. Thereafter, students can systematically conduct a comprehensive physical examination of different cases. The content of the course emphasizes a person-centered and holistic view, enabling students to demonstrate clinical decision-making, communication skills, caring and professional ethics in designed simulated situations, and allow students to apply them in actual nursing situations.
全18週

01
Pathology
病理學是探討疾病的原因、機轉、病理變化及過程、預後等的一門學問 課程分二大部分1.概論2.各論。 概論主要介紹外來的傷害與疾病的刺激對細胞與組織所造成的共通的變化、與反應與機轉。詳細內容包括細胞傷害與死亡、炎症與癒合、細胞生長發育的異常、體液代謝障礙、免疫與腫瘤、遺傳、代謝與營養疾病。 各論討論各器官系統其各類疾病的致病原因、機轉，病理變化及臨床表現等。詳細 的內容包括心臟血管系統疾病、呼吸系統疾病、肝臟及膽管系統疾病、消化系統及 胰臟疾病、內分泌系統疾病、血液與淋巴系統疾病、腎臟疾病、男性生殖系統疾病、
The scientific focus of pathology is on the etiology of disease, the mechanisms of pathogenesis, and the pathways by which morphologic changes occur.  Pathogenesis of diseases will be discussed on the molecular basis to facilitate the understanding of difficult concepts. The content of this coursed are design to fit the requirement for who will be working in the field of nursing.   
The curriculum is divided into 2 major parts: (1) General Pathology and (2) Systemic Pathology.      General Pathology introduces the effects of exogenous injurious agents on the cells and tissues, and the resultant cellular changes, reactions and diseases.  The contents include: introduction, cell injury and cell death, metabolic disturbances of the body fluids, immunologic disorders, inflammation and repair, neoplasia, genetic disorders, chemical and physical injuries and metabolic and nutritional diseases.    
Systemic pathology discusses the etiology and pathogenesis of various disease entities from the aspects of each organ system.  This covers the diseases of the cardiovascular system,  the respiratory system, the digestive system, the musculoskeletal system and nervous system;   the disorders of the endocrines, the kidneys, the male reproductive organs, the breast and the female reproductive organs and the skin.
全18週

病理學實驗教學旨在使學生融合病理知識與疾病的臨床表徵. 課程內容包括: 實驗病理學、感染性疾病、,臨床病理學、心臟血管系統疾病、呼吸系統疾病、肝臟及膽管系統疾病、消化系統及肝胰臟疾病、 內分泌系統疾病、血液與淋巴系統疾病、腎臟疾病、男性生殖系統疾病、乳房及女性生殖系統疾病、骨骼肌肉系統、神經系統疾病、皮膚疾病的病例說明與病理討論。

The main teaching activities are problem based learning, though the clinical cases reports, interactive discussions and conferences, the student recognize the pathological phenomenon of human diseases.

Basic Nursing and Practicum
本課程培養學生具有護理專業之基本知識與技能。課室內容包括觀察與專業性人際關係、醫療環境、個案各種基本需要之護理等。學生透過討論、反思、技術練習、回示教、自主學習體驗活動等多元教學策略與學習方法，學習主動展現關懷、基本護理學相關知識及技能並發揮團隊合作完成課室指定之報告，以達成學生對基本護理學之知識、態度與技能的學習，並能運用於臨床實務中。
This course provided for developing students' foundational knowledge and skills in nursing. The content includes professional interpersonal relationships, healthcare environments, and the fundamental needs of patients. Employing a rich array of teaching methodologies, including discussions, reflection, technical practice, guided instruction, and independent learning experiences, students are actively encouraged to demonstrate compassionate care, acquire pertinent knowledge and skills, and collaborate within teams. Ultimately, the objective is to equip students with the capability to apply their acquired knowledge, attitudes, and skills in real-world clinical practice.

Nutrition & Nutrition Experiment
本課程是以營養學為基礎，搭配如理想體重、飲食指南、飲食指標、DRIs、食物代換表、營養標示等單元介紹，並以六大類營養素為主軸結合疾病療養學的應用，例如介紹熱量的概念後，以體重控制為例；介紹碳水化合物的生理功能後，搭配糖尿病的飲食保健；介紹脂肪的生理功能時，搭配心血管疾病的飲食保健；在蛋白質單元課程則與慢性腎衰竭營養治療飲食原則結合；維生素單元以抗氧化劑的介紹為搭配；礦物質的介紹則以骨質疏鬆症的營養保健搭配；另一方面介紹住院病人營養評估、營養支持與腸道營養配方等單元，讓學生可以把基礎營養學與相關的疾病營養照護的概念聯成一氣，培育保健照護產業中關懷助人及敬業樂群的護理專業實務人才。
The course of Clinical Nutrition is design for the 4- year program of Nursing 
Department consists two parts. The first part introduces the concept of nutrition. Such 
as body weight management, dietary guideline, dietary goal, DRIs, exchange list, 
nutrition label.The second part introduces the nutritional care and the diet therapy on 
various diseases, such as obesity, DM, atherosclerosis disease, chronic renal failure, 
osteoporosis, nutritional deficiency (such anemia) etc.

01
Environmental Education
本課程旨在闡述環境永續發展的意義與重要性，教學內涵希望提昇學生永續發展的覺知，增加永續發展的概念知識，培養正確的永續發展態度與價值觀，並發展永續發展的行動技能與行動經驗。課程強調在環境中進行教育，學習有關環境的知識、態度、技能，並且為實踐永續環境而準備。環境教育包含六個核心的學習要素：自然資源保育概念、環境管理概念的融入；生態原理、互動與互賴概念的融入；以及融入環境倫理與永續性的概念等。
    課程內容涵蓋環境概論、環境倫理、環境教育法規、環境變遷與防災、節能減碳與能源管理、與永續發展與生態保育等主題內容。教學策略運用：做中學、在真實的情境中體驗、合作學習法、運用感官學習、探索環境議題等項目。教學方法採取課堂講解、分組討論、專題討論、現地參訪等方式進行，並以多媒體教材教學。期望藉由環境議題的認識與討論，深入環境的內涵；透過對於環境問題的觀察與思考，了解環境永續的本質及善盡環境保護的義務。環境教育是一種教育的過程，在過程中個人認識他們的環境，以及組成環境的生物、物理和文化間的交互作用，得到知識、技能和價值觀，並能個別或集體地了解並解決現在和將來的環境問題。
Environmental education is designed to explain the meaning and importance of environment and sustainable development. It refers to organized efforts to teach how natural environments function, and particularly, how human beings can manage behavior and ecosystems to live sustainably. It is a multi-disciplinary field integrating disciplines such as biology, chemistry, physics, ecology, earth science, atmospheric science, mathematics, and geography. The term often implies education within the school system, from primary to post-secondary. However, it sometimes includes all efforts to educate the public and other audiences, including print materials, websites, media campaigns, etc. 
  Environmental education consists of six core elements: the concept of conservation of natural resources, environmental management into ecological principles, into the concept of interaction and interdependence; and the concept of integration of environmental ethics and sustainable environment. Environmental education is the teaching of individuals, and communities, in transitioning to a society that is knowledgeable of the environment and its associated problems, aware of the solutions to these problems, and motivated to solve them.Environmental education is an educational process, in the process of personal awareness in their environment, and form an environment of interaction between biological, physical and cultural, are knowledge, skills, and values, and individually or collectively, can understand and solve current and future environmental problems.
全18週

本課程旨在培養學生獲得緊急處置之知能及公共安全問題之認知。課程內容主要包括：緊急救護法規及政策、緊急救護系統、災難處置、逃生知識及傷病患疏散、救護等緊急處置。使其在發生緊急事故或災害之際，能冷靜、評估且迅速的做適當處理，使生命的傷害及財產損失降至最低。

properties.

Introduction of Long Term Care
本課程目的是使學生獲得長期照護之整體性基本概念。課程之設計參考當前國家法令、政策、社會發展照護問題等相關議題與護理實務。課程內容包括：長期照護需求、國內外長期照護的發展與現況、長期照護的概論（本質、理念、定義、服務範圍）、長期照護相關政策及法規、我國現行長期照護體系、居家照護、日間照護及安寧護理（沿革、現況、相關護理實務）、機構式長期照護（如護理之家沿革、現況及住民常見護理問題等）、長期照護相關議題（含個案管理、社會資源應用、活動、動物輔助治療、美術治療等另類輔助治療及倫理議題）等。
This course is aimed at integrating basic concepts about long-term care globally.  It’s designing is dealing with current conditions and social development in related themes and practice about long-term care.  Course content include need, status, development and introduction（essences, philosophy, definition and service eligibility）, policy , rules , regulation , and current delivery system in our count, i.e. home care, day care, hospice care, institutionalized care and special topics on long-term care.

This course aims to improve the students’ the basic English conversation in ordinary health care encounters . Through this course, the students will be able to enhance their interest and ability in English in terms of "listening" and "speaking" used in daily life health care situations, and then develop a habit of lifelong learning attitude in mastering English competency.

01
Medical-Surgical Nursing Practicum  I
本實習課程為初級內外科護理實習，協助學生運用內外科護理學I的知識與技能，學習以批判性思考分析評估及確立病人的健康需求，依病人需要擬定可行性護理計畫，執行正確及安全的護理活動並評值其成效。學生在實習過程中視實習單位特性，需要時可見習手術室、恢復室、特殊檢查室等特殊單位，並學習參與醫療小組溝通及互動，同時體驗內外科護理情境中護理人員的角色功能，並分享自己的專業成長感受與角色適應。
This is the fundamental course of medical-surgical nursing. The primary purpose of this course is to enhance the student’s professional nursing competence caring for clients with medical-surgical disorders. Students have opportunities to apply knowledge and skills learned in Medical-surgical Nursing I to assess the psychical, psychological, and social behavioral responses of clients, utilize critical thinking to analyze holistic needs and identify health needs of clients, design feasible nursing care plan based on client’s individual needs, perform accurate and safe nursing activities, and evaluate effects of nursing care. Students are encouraged to participate in communicate and cooperate with the healthcare team. Also, they can recognize function and role of nurse in medical-surgical unit and share their feelings of adaptation to professional development.

Medical-Surgical Nursing Practicum  II
本實習課程主要是協助學生整合基礎醫學及內外科護理學I、II知識應用於臨床情境中。實習中學生能以護理專業知識為基礎，運用批判性思考及護理過程處理個案常見之健康問題，並判斷優先順序，擬定及執行個別性的護理措施，同時能提供個案及家屬所需的護理指導，並評值護理措施的成效。學生在實習過程中展現自我學習及參與醫療團隊的互動，藉以學習溝通合作能力，並分享其臨床實習之感受與角色適應。
This course aims to facilitate students to integrate knowledge learned in basic medicine courses and Medical and Surgical Nursing I and II in clinical situation. Students will be able to apply concepts of critical thinking and nursing process based on knowledge of nursing to identify health problems, design proper nursing activities and health education, and evaluate outcomes to clients with medical and surgical disorders. Observation activity in OR, recovery room or special exam rooms may be arranged if it can enhance students learning. Students also have opportunities to demonstrate self-directed learning, participate in interactions with medical team, and practice communication and cooperation abilities. Students are encouraged to share their feelings and role adaptation through the process of clinical practice.

Introduction to Logic
邏輯涉及論證與推論，它的主要功用在於提供若干方法，使我們可據以區 別正確與不正確的推論（論證）。本課程係概論性質。在導論中，首先針對 本學科關鍵詞（推論、論證、命題、有效性……）給予一概念清晰的定義， 以明確界定邏輯的範圍。其次，為加強學習者在從事思考、溝通與討論的 過程中，能具體應用相關的知識，特專章介紹非形式謬誤及語言的陷阱。 傳統邏輯的基本內涵，如演繹法與歸納法，也是本課程的重點，包括定言 論證、假言論證、兩難法、類比法、枚舉歸納法等等。
Logic is a method of reasoning that means related to the argument and the inference. The primary function of Logic is to provide some methods by which we could distinguish between the correct and incorrect inference (arguments). Here belongs to a kind of general course. Within the introduction, we firstly point at the keywords of the discipline itself (e.g. inference, arguments, propositions, validity, etc.) and give them the clear definition in order to precisely define the extent of Logic. Secondly, for the purpose of enhancing the ability of the students whereby those who are able to concretely apply those relative knowledge in the way of thinking, communicating and discussing, there is thus one special part to introduce the informal fallacies and the other possible traps of the language. By any means, deduction and induction, which are both the basic contents of traditional Logic are of course our core subjects, including the categorical argument, the conditional argument, Dilemma, Analogy, and Induction by enumeration etc.
全18週

01
PE-Table Tennis3
此課程是先學習與養成良好的基本技術與接發球技術後再加強雙打戰術理論與應用。學習「雙打戰術理論模式」就是以理論為基礎，以提升雙打戰術觀念。而雙打注重的是技術與兩位球員搭配之默契並運用各種戰術以全面、快速、變化之打法獲得有效之成果或在比賽中贏取勝利。
In this course, a player should learn and cultivate good basic skills and the skills in receiving and serving the ball first, and then reinforce the theory and applications of doubles tactics. To learn “the model of doubles tactics theory” is to enhance the concept of doubles tactics based on theories. In doubles, the skills and the unspoken consensus of cooperation between the two players are emphasized; also, various kinds of tactics are applied, so as to use comprehensive, rapid and variable playing skills to obtain effective results or triumph.
全18週

01
Medical-Surgical Nursing Practicum  I
本實習課程為初級內外科護理實習，協助學生運用內外科護理學I的知識與技能，學習以批判性思考分析評估及確立病人的健康需求，依病人需要擬定可行性護理計畫，執行正確及安全的護理活動並評值其成效。學生在實習過程中視實習單位特性，需要時可見習手術室、恢復室、特殊檢查室等特殊單位，並學習參與醫療小組溝通及互動，同時體驗內外科護理情境中護理人員的角色功能，並分享自己的專業成長感受與角色適應。
This is the fundamental course of medical-surgical nursing. The primary purpose of this course is to enhance the student’s professional nursing competence caring for clients with medical-surgical disorders. Students have opportunities to apply knowledge and skills learned in Medical-surgical Nursing I to assess the psychical, psychological, and social behavioral responses of clients, utilize critical thinking to analyze holistic needs and identify health needs of clients, design feasible nursing care plan based on client’s individual needs, perform accurate and safe nursing activities, and evaluate effects of nursing care. Students are encouraged to participate in communicate and cooperate with the healthcare team. Also, they can recognize function and role of nurse in medical-surgical unit and share their feelings of adaptation to professional development.
第1週

01
Introduction to Nursing Research
本課程旨在提供學生基本的研究知識與批判技能，了解理論與知識之建立依據，並建立應用研究科學方法探索解決健康照護實務問題之基本概念，在實作課程中學生經由研究文獻批判之討論，提升對護理實務現象之研究質疑，進而能了解各類研究設計及相關之研究信效度等基本概念，提升團隊合作、克盡職責、批判性思考等能力，並認識護理臨床實務之研究發展趨勢。
This course is an introductory course on nursing research and practice.  Students will have the opportunity for a systematic investigation of a health-related topic of the student’s interest demonstrating knowledge and skills of research methodology.  This course provides students step by step guidance of the research process as well as the critique of in-progress and completed research.
全18週

01
Maternal-Newborn Nursing Care and Practice
本課程旨在培養學生婦嬰照護的專業能力，課程內容強調正確臨床決策、不傷害的概念、以服務對象為中心的人際互動、護理指導、婦嬰實務及尊重文化差異等。課程結構以運用模擬情境為主，透過情境教學討論培養學生分析、綜合、批判、思考、創意等能力，並能於虛擬情境中融合婦嬰照護的專業知識、技能與態度完成護理過程。
The purpose of this course is to assist the students having the professional abilities of Maternal-Newborn nursing Care which including precious decision-making, client-centered interrelationships, nursing direction, clinical practice and respecting cultural differences. 
The structure of this course is emphasized on the modified clinical situation where the students could generate the knowledge, skills, and attitude related to Maternal-Newborn Nursing Care to apply nursing processes and perform the professional abilities in helping woman and her family to adapt the processes of pregnancy and childbirth. The contents include: 
1. Family-centered maternity nursing care,
2. Physical assessment,
3. Childbirth education,
4. Child-parental attachment, 
5. Breast feeding, and
6. Culture and birth.
第1~3週

PE-Badminton3
本課程透過對羽球雙打常用技術及比賽概念的介紹，引導學生體驗羽球雙打比賽的奧妙。授課內容包括發球、網邊球、挑球、切球、平擊球、高遠球、殺球、球路組合、雙打站位、比賽規則與戰術介紹及實際比賽體驗。
This program leads students to experience the secret of badminton doubles through the introduction of the common skills and game concept of badminton doubles. Course content includes service, drop shot, lobs, cut, drive, clear, smashes, technique combination, doubles standing position, game rules, tactic introduction and actual experience of games.

邏輯涉及論證與推論，它的主要功用在於提供若干方法，使我們可據以區 別正確與不正確的推論（論證）。本課程係概論性質。在導論中，首先針對 本學科關鍵詞（推論、論證、命題、有效性……）給予一概念清晰的定義， 以明確界定邏輯的範圍。其次，為加強學習者在從事思考、溝通與討論的 過程中，能具體應用相關的知識，特專章介紹非形式謬誤及語言的陷阱。 傳統邏輯的基本內涵，如演繹法與歸納法，也是本課程的重點，包括定言 論證、假言論證、兩難法、類比法、枚舉歸納法等等。
Logic is a method of reasoning that means related to the argument and the inference. The primary function of Logic is to provide some methods by which we could distinguish between the correct and incorrect inference (arguments). Here belongs to a kind of general course. Within the introduction, we firstly point at the keywords of the discipline itself (e.g. inference, arguments, propositions, validity, etc.) and give them the clear definition in order to precisely define the extent of Logic. Secondly, for the purpose of enhancing the ability of the students whereby those who are able to concretely apply those relative knowledge in the way of thinking, communicating and discussing, there is thus one special part to introduce the informal fallacies and the other possible traps of the language. By any means, deduction and induction, which are both the basic contents of traditional Logic are of course our core subjects, including the categorical argument, the conditional argument, Dilemma, Analogy, and Induction by enumeration etc.
全18週

01
Medical-Surgical Nursing Practicum  I
本實習課程為初級內外科護理實習，協助學生運用內外科護理學I的知識與技能，學習以批判性思考分析評估及確立病人的健康需求，依病人需要擬定可行性護理計畫，執行正確及安全的護理活動並評值其成效。學生在實習過程中視實習單位特性，需要時可見習手術室、恢復室、特殊檢查室等特殊單位，並學習參與醫療小組溝通及互動，同時體驗內外科護理情境中護理人員的角色功能，並分享自己的專業成長感受與角色適應。
This is the fundamental course of medical-surgical nursing. The primary purpose of this course is to enhance the student’s professional nursing competence caring for clients with medical-surgical disorders. Students have opportunities to apply knowledge and skills learned in Medical-surgical Nursing I to assess the psychical, psychological, and social behavioral responses of clients, utilize critical thinking to analyze holistic needs and identify health needs of clients, design feasible nursing care plan based on client’s individual needs, perform accurate and safe nursing activities, and evaluate effects of nursing care. Students are encouraged to participate in communicate and cooperate with the healthcare team. Also, they can recognize function and role of nurse in medical-surgical unit and share their feelings of adaptation to professional development.
第1週

01
Medical-Surgical Nursing Practicum  II
本實習課程主要是協助學生整合基礎醫學及內外科護理學I、II知識應用於臨床情境中。實習中學生能以護理專業知識為基礎，運用批判性思考及護理過程處理個案常見之健康問題，並判斷優先順序，擬定及執行個別性的護理措施，同時能提供個案及家屬所需的護理指導，並評值護理措施的成效。學生在實習過程中展現自我學習及參與醫療團隊的互動，藉以學習溝通合作能力，並分享其臨床實習之感受與角色適應。
This course aims to facilitate students to integrate knowledge learned in basic medicine courses and Medical and Surgical Nursing I and II in clinical situation. Students will be able to apply concepts of critical thinking and nursing process based on knowledge of nursing to identify health problems, design proper nursing activities and health education, and evaluate outcomes to clients with medical and surgical disorders. Observation activity in OR, recovery room or special exam rooms may be arranged if it can enhance students learning. Students also have opportunities to demonstrate self-directed learning, participate in interactions with medical team, and practice communication and cooperation abilities. Students are encouraged to share their feelings and role adaptation through the process of clinical practice.
第9~18週

Medical-Surgical Nursing and Practice II
本課程是以國人常見健康議題及現今內外科照護趨勢而設計，課程內容銜接內外科護理學與實作I，包括住院老人、癌症、傳染性疾病、急重症、燒傷等個案照護，學生能運用批判性思考進行整體性評估、辨識個案的健康問題、執行可行性護理措施於理論及實作課程中，以增進學生認識未來臨床護理實務發展趨勢。
This course extends contents from Medical-surgical Nursing Theory and Laboratory I with a consideration of current trends and topics in healthcare. With a core concept of nursing process, the course contents include topics related to medical-surgical nursing, assessment of physical, psychological, and social aspects of clients, critical thinking, and evidence based theories. Students will be able to apply course contents to identify health problems, design proper nursing activities, and evaluate outcomes of clients with medical and surgical disorders in nursing lab.
第1~8週

Introduction to Nursing Research
本課程旨在提供學生基本的研究知識與批判技能，了解理論與知識之建立依據，並建立應用研究科學方法探索解決健康照護實務問題之基本概念，在實作課程中學生經由研究文獻批判之討論，提升對護理實務現象之研究質疑，進而能了解各類研究設計及相關之研究信效度等基本概念，提升團隊合作、克盡職責、批判性思考等能力，並認識護理臨床實務之研究發展趨勢。
This course is an introductory course on nursing research and practice.  Students will have the opportunity for a systematic investigation of a health-related topic of the student’s interest demonstrating knowledge and skills of research methodology.  This course provides students step by step guidance of the research process as well as the critique of in-progress and completed research.
全18週

Critical Nursing and Practice
本課程旨在於協助學生獲得基本常見成人重症照護知識，應用整體性照護及全腦教育理念，能夠經由體驗、觀察及主動的實驗等途徑，有創意和安全地照顧生命受到嚴重威脅的個案。課程內容主要教授成人重症有關的生理、病理變化、相關治療、藥物使用、儀器操作和重症護理實務；並藉情境模擬、特定主題的讀書報告和議題討論，來協助學生以護理過程的方式發展護理計劃並評值。
This course is to offer students the necessary knowledge and skills of nursing that apply holistic nursing care to provide direct patient care in critical care units. This course is based on the nursing management process, including planning, organizing, human resources management, leadership and controlling, etc. The curriculum focuses on the physiology, pathology, treatment and drug therapy. It is also demonstrate equipments and nursing care in critical care as well. Students are expected to initiate their knowledge and interests in nursing administration, and utilize these knowledge and skills in the future nursing career.

01
Games and Strategies
「賽局理論」對多數人來說或許都是一個遙不可及的名詞。也許有一部份人從《美麗境界(a beautiful mind)》這部電影所描述的John Forbes Nash, Jr.生平事蹟獲得一些概念，也許一部份概念來自諾貝爾經濟學獎自1994頒發給包括Nash的三位專攻賽局的經濟學家（以及其後包括2005年的 ROBERT J. AUMANN 與THOMAS C. SCHELLING和2007年的LEONID HURWICZ , ERIC S. MASKIN , 與ROGER B. MYERSON）。儘管有這些訊息，賽局這個概念對多數人還是非常模糊。
簡單地說，賽局在討論決策者在特定情境下的互動關係。從前面所提到這些學者的背景可以知道，賽局的研究在經濟學（以及數學）的應用相當重要而廣泛。事實上，賽局理論更明確的角色與地位應該屬於一種分析工具（或思考邏輯）。從這樣的界定裡，賽局的應用將更寬廣。不論是前面提到的經濟學、數學或是政治學、社會學、管理學乃至於生物學都可以看到賽局的蹤跡。
Game theory has become an enormously important field of study. It is now a vital methodology for researchers in many disciplines, including economics, business, political science, biology and law. The goals of the course are to provide a basic level of introduction of the subject and applications. We start from some familiar examples and application that we may easily observe. Along the introduction and discussion of the examples, we will incorporate some basic yet important concepts and terminologies of game theory.
全18週

01
Profession and Ethics
本課程旨在使學生獲得專業與倫理之基本知識、概念及各種護理倫理困境之分析與決策能力，進而激發學生發展批判性的倫理思考與判斷之潛能。課程內容以專業倫理之基本概念及倫理理論與原則之護理實務應用為主，透過講解、分析與問題導向學習等教學方法，檢視價值觀與衝突、倫理與道德觀、病人權利與責任、護理師權利與責任、倫理理論、基本倫理原則、倫理困境與倫理決策等等議題。
The purposes of this course are to help students to gain the basic knowledge, concepts and standardized behavior of nursing ethics, to distinguish clinical ethical issues, as well as the ability to analyze and make decisions of ethical dilemma in order to urge them to develop critical thinking and proper judgment. The concepts of this course focus on the ethical basic concepts and the application of ethical principles: including the analysis and discussion of ethics and moral concepts; the formation and conflicts of values, the rights and responsibilities of patients and nurses; the cooperational relationships of medical team; application the main theories and principles of ethics; nursing code, ethical dilemma, and the ethical decision framework.
全18週

Evidence-Based Practice in Healthcare
本課程目標在協助學生獲得實證護理相關的知識與技能。課程以執行實證五步驟為架構，內容包含:介紹實證護理概念、提出實證可以回答的臨床問題(PICO)、文獻資料庫與搜尋最佳證據、評析文獻與實證護理應用。實作方面包含:運用學習小組練習以PICO詢問臨床問題、搜尋回答問題之最佳證據、練習評讀隨機控制研究、判斷證據等級、提出臨床決策建議及閱讀系統性文獻回顧文章。
This course aims to introduceevidence-based nursing and strengthen knowledge and skills of evidence-based nursing for nursing students. Course contents includefundationalconcepts of evidence-based nursing, concepts of systematic review and clinical guideline, PICO, searching for the current best evidence, methodologyappraisal, and analyzing data. Students will have the opportunity to practice skills of using PICO to ask answerable clinical questions, searching the evidence and assessing quality of a randomized controlled trial, levels of evidence, and reading articles of systema tric review .
全18週

01
Practicum on Psychiatric Nursing
本實習課程旨在協助學生應用壓力適應模式與精神衛生護理相關理論，提供個案精神衛生之基本照顧活動與服務，含：建立治療性人際關係，進行整體性護理評估，提供精神衛生照顧與護理指導，探索精神衛生護理人員的角色與功能、認識與精神衛生治療相關的模式、法律知識、社區資源，進而體會到精神衛生對個人健康的重要性，並展現自我覺察、自治、自學的態度。
The purpose of this course is to cultivate the student an individual Psychiatric nursing ability. This course emphasis on that the students apply their psychiatric nursing knowledge and nursing skill in the clinical psychiatric nursing situation. The students are expected to experience the process of the therapeutic nurse- patient relationship, realize the therapeutic use of self, help client to develop a positive self-concept and corrective relationship、view and emulate the role and function of the psychiatric nurse.
第1~13週

Psychiatric Nursing and Practice
本課程旨在培養四年制學生具備執行精神衛生護理的關懷、溝通與合作與批判思考等基本能力。課程內容包括我國精神衛生有關的政策、法律、業務與推展現況、基本理念、常用的精神衛生照護模式及處置，並期許學生增進精神衛生護理知識、態度與技能。
This course provides nursing students with the basic knowledge and skills about psychiatric patient nursing care. The major elements include the policies, laws, regulations, theories and skills of advanced psychiatric mental health nursing, and missions of psychiatric nursing organizations. Students are required to identify and establish their own philosophy of nursing as well as to recognize psychiatric mental health nurse’s roles and functions. Nursing assessment, interventions and evaluation used by psychiatric clinicians are presented and discussed in this class.

Introduction for Nursing Employment
本課程旨在協助學生未來能順利的適應職涯的環境，透過討論、講授、參與職涯講座、資料搜尋、自學及分組報告等方式，認識台灣各層級醫院、優質護理職場之條件、職場相關議題和護理新鮮人可能面臨的問題，進而協助學生能有適當的選擇就業職場。
The purpose of the course is to guide and prepare students for the practicum of obtaining nursing employment. Through lecturing and discussion, students will be familiar with the purposes and agendas of the practicum, and knowing how to prepare themselves in advance to facilitate their learning during the practicum. Through the preparation of the course, students are expected to be able to integrate and apply nursing theories, related knowledge, and skills in nursing practice. In together with the practicum for obtaining nursing employment course, this course is aimed to develop students’ clinical competence in providing evidence-based, individualized, and prioritized nursing care.
全18週

Community Health Nursing Practicum
學生能於實習過程中進行家 庭的健康問題評估、分析影響因素並協助庭處理健康問題；能進行社區或群體評估並發現 社區或群體健康問題， 以期整合資源達到促進及維護個人、家庭團體和社區健康。
The practice of the community health nursing is designed to assistant the students to develop the ability of family health nursing including assessment, analysis, diagnosis, implementation and evaluation. Meanwhile, in the process of practice, students can make use of professional role and function to engage individual, family and community nursing care and discover the health problem, design the health plan, and evaluate the affection of health program. By integration the source of community, the practice of the community health nursing can improve the holistic health of person, family, group and community.
第1~13週

01
Community Health Nursing and Practice
本課程以社區為導向之社區衛生護理相關概念，以奠定學生從事社區衛生護理工作的基礎。透過實作練習共同參與、團體互動、增進彼此溝通，培養其社區健康評估的知識和技能，期望學生能向下紮根做好個案及家庭護理，向外能敏銳的發現團體及社區健康問題，以期整合社區資源，達到促進及維護個人、家庭、團體和社區之整體健康。
This course is designed to provide community health services based on the diverse perspectives. The course includes the theoretical framework of community health nursing, primary health care system, community health assessment, diagnosis and intervention, characteristic and health promotion of human developed stage, family assessment and nursing, chronic physical health problem, impact of culture to community health nursing, environmental influence on community health, and long term care. In the end of the course, students may provide integrated individual and family care and be aware of community health problems, and use the community resource to achieve community development.
第1週

Through the preparation of the course, students are expected to be able to integrate and apply nursing theories, related knowledge, and skills in nursing practice. In together with the practicum for obtaining nursing employment course, this course is aimed to develop students’ clinical competence in providing evidence-based, individualized, and prioritized nursing care.
全18週

Community Health Nursing and Practice
本課程以社區為導向之社區衛生護理相關概念，以奠定學生從事社區衛生護理工作的基礎。透過實作練習共同參與、團體互動、增進彼此溝通，培養其社區健康評估的知識和技能，期望學生能向下紮根做好個案及家庭護理，向外能敏銳的發現團體及社區健康問題，以期整合社區資源，達到促進及維護個人、家庭、團體和社區之整體健康。
This course is designed to provide community health services based on the diverse perspectives. The course includes the theoretical framework of community health nursing, primary health care system, community health assessment, diagnosis and intervention, characteristic and health promotion of human developed stage, family assessment and nursing, chronic physical health problem, impact of culture to community health nursing, environmental influence on community health, and long term care. In the end of the course, students may provide integrated individual and family care and be aware of community health problems, and use the community resource to achieve community development.

Profession and Ethics
本課程旨在使學生獲得專業與倫理之基本知識、概念及各種護理倫理困境之分析與決策能力，進而激發學生發展批判性的倫理思考與判斷之潛能。課程內容以專業倫理之基本概念及倫理理論與原則之護理實務應用為主，透過講解、分析與問題導向學習等教學方法，檢視價值觀與衝突、倫理與道德觀、病人權利與責任、護理師權利與責任、倫理理論、基本倫理原則、倫理困境與倫理決策等等議題。
The purposes of this course are to help students to gain the basic knowledge, concepts and standardized behavior of nursing ethics, to distinguish clinical ethical issues, as well as the ability to analyze and make decisions of ethical dilemma in order to urge them to develop critical thinking and proper judgment. The concepts of this course focus on the ethical basic concepts and the application of ethical principles: including the analysis and discussion of ethics and moral concepts; the formation and conflicts of values, the rights and responsibilities of patients and nurses; the cooperational relationships of medical team; application the main theories and principles of ethics; nursing code, ethical dilemma, and the ethical decision framework.
全18週

Evidence-Based Practice in Healthcare
本課程目標在協助學生獲得實證護理相關的知識與技能。課程以執行實證五步驟為架構，內容包含:介紹實證護理概念、提出實證可以回答的臨床問題(PICO)、文獻資料庫與搜尋最佳證據、評析文獻與實證護理應用。實作方面包含:運用學習小組練習以PICO詢問臨床問題、搜尋回答問題之最佳證據、練習評讀隨機控制研究、判斷證據等級、提出臨床決策建議及閱讀系統性文獻回顧文章。
This course aims to introduceevidence-based nursing and strengthen knowledge and skills of evidence-based nursing for nursing students. Course contents includefundationalconcepts of evidence-based nursing, concepts of systematic review and clinical guideline, PICO, searching for the current best evidence, methodologyappraisal, and analyzing data. Students will have the opportunity to practice skills of using PICO to ask answerable clinical questions, searching the evidence and assessing quality of a randomized controlled trial, levels of evidence, and reading articles of systema tric review .
全18週

Clinical Practice in Child Health Nursing
本課程設計旨在協助學生運用基礎生物醫學科學、一般臨床護理技能與批判性思考技巧於兒童及家庭之照護。課程內容以「家庭為中心」及「兒童發展理論」為主軸，探討各年齡層兒童生理、心理、社會發展及常見之健康議題，於臨床討論中展現關懷與克盡職責能力及對護理倫理議題之關注，透過臨床實作、反思、小組討論與分享等多元教學策略，發揮溝通合作與培養終身學習之能力，以達成本實習目標。
This course focuses on the application of nursing process in prevention, maintenance and restoration of common children health problems. The content includes etiology, pathophysiology, treatment and nursing modalities of these health problems. Application of theoretical concepts of growth and development related to nursing care of the child and his/her family is strongly emphasized.
第1~8週

Practicum on Psychiatric Nursing
本實習課程旨在協助學生應用壓力適應模式與精神衛生護理相關理論，提供個案精神衛生之基本照顧活動與服務，含：建立治療性人際關係，進行整體性護理評估，提供精神衛生照顧與護理指導，探索精神衛生護理人員的角色與功能、認識與精神衛生治療相關的模式、法律知識、社區資源，進而體會到精神衛生對個人健康的重要性，並展現自我覺察、自治、自學的態度。

The students are expected to experience the process of the therapeutic nurse- patient relationship, realize the therapeutic use of self, help client to develop a positive self-concept and corrective relationship、view and emulate the role and function of the psychiatric nurse.

本課程設計旨在協助學生運用基礎生物醫學科學、一般臨床護理技能與批判性思考技巧於兒童及家庭之照護。課程內容以「家庭為中心」及「兒童發展理論」為主軸，探討各年齡層兒童生理、心理、社會發展及常見之健康議題，於臨床討論中展現關懷與克盡職責能力及對護理倫理議題之關注，透過臨床實作、反思、小組討論與分享等多元教學策略，發揮溝通合作與培養終身學習之能力，以達成本實習目標。
This course focuses on the application of nursing process in prevention, maintenance and restoration of common children health problems. The content includes etiology, pathophysiology, treatment and nursing modalities of these health problems. Application of theoretical concepts of growth and development related to nursing care of the child and his/her family is strongly emphasized.
第4~18週

Characteristics and Development of the disabilities
本課程旨在建立學生對身心障礙者身心特質與需求的認識。學生在生理心理學基礎下，進一步認識各類身心障礙的生理與病理成因、障礙模式與需求評估、家庭與社會調適，以及生涯發展與轉銜等議題。課程透過課室講授、案例分析、專題討論等活動，強化學生對身心障礙者的認識，並啟發與此類個案互動及從事此項工作的興趣。
This course aims to establish students' understanding of the physical and mental characteristics and needs of the physically and mentally handicapped. On the basis of physiological psychology, students will further understand the physiological and pathological causes of various physical and mental disorders, obstacle models and needs assessment, and issues of family and social adjustment, career development and transfer. Through classroom lectures, case studies, and topic discussions, the course strengthens students’ understanding of the physically and mentally handicapped, and inspires their interest in interacting with such cases and engaging in this work.

01
Forgiveness Education
完美的世界不需要道歉，因為世界是不完美的，所以我們不能沒有道歉。道歉是個人真誠表達認錯與謝罪。真誠的使用道歉的六種語言，可以帶來人際關係的成長，生命中的衝突事件充斥在生命中每個不同的階段、不同的關係與不同的角落中，寬恕是愛護自己、疼惜自己與善待他人的積極選擇。寬恕並不等於和好，寬恕是個人的選擇，放下心中的憤怒及怨恨的情緒，而和好是雙方共同的意願及努力的結果，其中的關鍵因素之一是道歉。如果我們不了解道歉的語言及方法，我們可能永遠不會被真正的原諒，當事人受傷害的關係也可能得不到永遠的修復。
近年來「寬恕」在諮商領域有廣泛的討論及深入的研究。本課程是寬恕心理學的基礎課程，主要介紹寬恕的內涵及相關研究，內容包含人際關係的衝突與傷害、道歉的重要性、學習道歉的五種語言（表達歉意、承認錯誤、彌補過失、真誠悔改、請求饒恕）、如何進行寬恕教育、如何修復破壞的人際關係、重新展開健康的未來。
An apology is a statement with two key elements.: (1) It shows you feel remorse over your actions. (2) Acknowledges the hurt that your actions caused to someone else. Sincere apologies help to rebuild relationships with people you've hurt. That could be colleagues, clients, friends, or family.
     In the life of many persons, relations between some members of the family get strained and hurted. Forgiveness is a choice and help us to  resolve anger and restore hope. As one forgive , one grows a person capable of courage, nurturance of others, and love. This course will make the students aware that forgiving is a sensible choice, for avoiding our painful living, reducing tension & depression, & restarting dialogue, relationship & a peaceful normal life, by gradual change. 
    Just as we have a different love language, we also hear and express the words and gestures of apology in a different language. Apology is not just a matter of will--it's a matter of how. By helping students identify the languages of apology, this course clears the way toward healing and sustaining vital relationships. We share detail proven techniques for giving and receiving effective apologies.
全18週

Ethics  of Professional Counseling
旨在使學生獲得專業與倫理之基本知識、概念及各種護理倫理困境之分析與決策能力，進而激發學生發展批判性的倫理思考與判斷之潛能。課程內容以專業倫理之基本概念及倫理理論與原則之護理實務應用為主，包含價值觀與衝突、倫理與道德觀、病人權利與責任、護士權利與責任、倫理理論、基本倫理原則、倫理困境與倫理決策等之分析與討論。
The purposes of this course are to help students to gain the basic knowledge, concepts and standardized behavior of nursing ethics, to distinguish clinical ethical issues, as well as the ability to analyze and make decisions of ethical dilemma in order to urge them to develop critical thinking and proper judgment.     The concepts of this course focus on the ethical basic concepts and the application of ethical principles: including the analysis and discussion of ethics and moral concepts; the formation and conflicts of values, the rights and responsibilities of patients and nurses; the co-operational relationships of medical team; application the main theories and principles of ethics; nursing code, ethical dilemma, and the ethical decision framework.

The course will introduce and integrate the space theory of funeral and the tools needed for practical operation. In the space of funeral, we first introduce the model of the space view of the East and the West. From these models, we try to compare how to plan a funeral space that conforms to the "time-based system." The second is to introduce the various tools needed to build a funeral space. This will make the funeral venue a beautiful, safe and comfortable space. Finally, I will bring in how to design the funeral venue into a healing venue, so that it has the functional space of sad counseling.

Introduction and Practice to Solution Focused Brief Therapy
本課程旨在協助學生了解焦點解決短期心理諮商學派的基本概念與理論架構，增進學生運用焦點解決短期心理諮商的實務能力。課程內容包括短期心理諮商的基本概念、理念、工作流程與技術、解決架構的建構途徑與實例運用及演練等。課程設計則強調透過演練與討論，增加學生對焦點解決短期心理諮商理論的體驗與提昇，而能活用於實務。
This course provides students with the theory and practice of solution focused brief therapy by introducing basic process and skill and practices it.
    Course contents includes the development of and practices related to major solution focused brief therapy theories, counseling in medical settings , implementation of solution focused brief therapy skills, and rehearsal.
    The course emphasizes the importance of in-class discussion and role play. So that students understand theories of solution focused brief therapy, as well as foster their competency skills in using it for counseling practices.

Terminal Care Practice
本課程為臨終照護的實作課程，為兩學分四小時的實務操作課。實作課程之進行是於本系的臨終病房體驗專業教室上課，希望提升同學能以人文關懷與尊重生命的專業素養來服務往生者和悲傷的家屬，而其培訓的方式透過學生親身體驗處在臨終階段的病人、家屬與助人者的角色位置，增進對臨終階段的體認覺察，進而能深化人性的關懷。整體而言，臨終照護的實作課程目的在增加學生體驗臨終病人在身體、心理、靈性及社會的知覺感受，及學習如何在臨終階段予以柔適的全人關懷照顧，進而能反思何謂生命的尊嚴與全人的關懷。
Students who want to be a professional member in funeral services, or students who want to learn more about hospice care and dying, are welcome to take this course.  This course requires 4 hours per week in our hospice-ward-classroom, students will learn how to use alternative ways to care dying patients. Moreover, students will learn by practice, and role- play experiences. They will be required to play roles of terminally ill patients, family members, and helpers.

01
Issues of Thanatology in Movies
「生死學」是「研究與生死相關的行為、思想、情感及現象的學科」。「欣賞電影」是閱讀他人的生命故事，透過電影所呈現的精彩片段，欣賞不同的人，在人生所扮演的各種角色，藉此討論相關生死議題，進而增加對生命的體會。
　　本課程結合生死學與電影欣賞的觀點，透過電影的鑑賞與電影文學的閱讀，從不同角度探討與生死相關的現象與行為，如「生死的原因」、「生命與死亡的意義」、「臨終者的內在經驗」、「喪親者的悲傷過程」、「喪葬及哀悼的社會風俗」、「生命權倫理難題之抉擇」、「臨終病人及家屬的照顧及服務」、「不同宗教信仰的生死關」、「生死教育的實施」。
Thanatology can be defined as the scientific study of death, its causes and phenomenon. This course study five main issues of thanatology  (copying with dying, coping with death, coping with grief, dealing with end of life decision, dealing with disaster.) in the movies. This developing field proffers an understanding that death is not only the underlying driving force in nearly all cinematic narratives or television genres, but its various forms and portrayals are a psychological response to a deep-seated human need to confront the concept and inevitability of death.
If death is the central tenet of narrative , then perhaps our infatuation with television and the movies is based on the notion that they provide a sanctuary of viewing an unfolding of what has been called the ”little deaths” of others, so that appears, we are more prepared and accepting of the inevitability.
第1~14週

Tour Planning and Design
依據ASTA（American Society of Travel Agents）對遊程的解釋是「遊程是事先計劃完善的旅行節目，包括了交通工具、住宿、遊覽及其它有關之服務」，為旅行業銷售的主要「產品」。本課程教導內容包括遊程規劃及成本分析，冀望學生在學習課程後，未來進入職場能分類剖析市場旅遊產品並設計出與業界優質行程相當的遊程。
According to the definition of ASTA（American Society of Travel Agents）, a tour is a planned program of travel, normally for pleasure, usually including transportation, hotel, sightseeing and other services. Spatial Data Analysis
課程主要將介紹如何運用地理資訊系統(Geographic Information System-GIS)來呈現與健康相關之資
料，此課程主要的目標在於利用實務操作的方式來提昇學生管理與呈現健康相關資料之能力。課程中
將運用 ArcGIS 地理資訊套裝軟體來學習以下相關資料管理與分析策略：1) 基本空間資料呈現與空間
資料的特性；2) 座標投影系統的介紹；3) 如何將住址轉換成空間座標；以及 4) 空間資料的分析方式。
本課程主要的教學方式為課程講授並且利用實際練習操作 ArcGIS 地理資訊套裝軟體等方法，落實學
習分析空間計量資料與管理的技能。
This course provides a basic understanding of the concepts of Geographic Information System (GIS) and
how to apply this skill to public health-related research. Basic descriptive and analytical function of GIS will be introduced along with additional spatial concepts including 1) the features of spatial data, 2) map projections, 3) coordinate systems and geocoding, and 4) spatial data analysis. This is an course with a strong emphasis on students gaining a hands-on experience in the use of GIS software to manage health-related spatial data.

The objective of this course is to provide students with advanced practical applications of bio-statistical methods by running the SAS statistical software. Several clinical data in the health related agendas will demonstrate and analyze effectively. Major topics and headings will include (1) overview of SAS statistical software, (2) data arrangement, (3) regression analysis, (4) classification and diagnosis analysis, (5) clinical trial. The advance ability toward the management of quantity data will be the core of teaching plan and interactive procedure. The aims of this course are to promote and reinforce students actually understand the whole-spectrum of advanced statistics and its practical directions.

01
Internet of Things on Healthcare
本課程將以物聯網資訊促進健康發展為基礎導論，分別由健康、亞健康以及失能照護等分階段進行簡介，其中特別著重高齡照護議題，藉由專家訪談、案例分享，及進行課堂討論，讓學員認識健康照護物聯網的應用之效益。
在資訊技術的導引方面，物聯網的概念已從傳統式的單一產品與技術導向，進而邁向大規模生活應用、醫療健康、與資料分析的發展模式；本課程將引導學員從物聯網基本架構、裝置開發實務進行個案了解，並以此延伸開始認識三段五級的健康促進與預防等概念，進而激發學員發揮健康照護與醫療資訊跨領域的創新結合。
This course mainly discusses the theory of healthcare on elderly who are classified as healthy, partial healthy, and disabled. Through case analysis, trend analysis, and expert interview, students are able to explore the application of Internet of Things (IOT) technology on healthcare of elderly and the current development of healthcare industry. Internet of Things refers to the interactive activities among machines. In this course, we introduce the basic concept and the application of IOT technology, the trend and challenge of IOT technology, how to connect IOT technology and healthcare service, and the application of IOT technology on healthcare of elderly.
全18週

in our pockets and hands. The purpose of this course is to teach students how to build

本課程將教授學生如何透過大數據發展過程與產業/領域應用案例，掌握產業經營如何與大數據分析結合，掌握產業的發展、成本與費用的控制、經營效率管理技巧。本課程將讓學生整合數據分析與商業管理理論，透過策略規劃掌握企業發展，控管企業營運執行，奠基學生養成以大數據分析作為企業經營分析與決策之依據。
This course will demonstrate how to aggregate industrial operating performance data through understanding of history and case of data analysis. This help student to master big data analysis, cost/expense control, and operational efficiency management skills. This course will allow students to integrate data analysis and business management theory in order to realize the framework of business development and business execution performance, which is the foundation for students applying big data analysis as the basis of enterprise business analysis and decision-making.

User Experience Design
本課程旨在介紹學生使用者體驗(UX)與使用者介面(UI)設計中使用的方法和工具。使用者體驗設計專注於產品生命週期的早期設計階段，旨在確保產品滿足使用者需求；涵蓋的範例工具和方法包括角色、場景、故事板、焦點團體、線框圖、原型設計等，以及InVision、Áxure、Balsamiq等軟體。
在本課程中，學生將透過三個團隊活動實際演練當今行動科技的產品設計中一個或多個使用者體驗設計的方法，藉以讓學生清楚瞭解使用者體驗與使用者介面設計的概括全貌。
This course provides an introduction to the fields of UX research and design. Students will gain an understanding of what is involved in UX research, including conducting interviews, evaluating systems, and analyzing systems using principles of good design. Students will also learn about the work involved in UX Design, including the generation of promising design solutions and the creation of prototypes at multiple levels of fidelity. By interleaving successive phases of UX Research and Design, students will see how to learn from inevitable mistakes and improve towards a product with a great UX.
第1~14週

Functional Strengthening Exercise
功能強化運動主要是針對身體的狀況， 結合適當的運動計畫執行之後，改善原本功能退化的狀況，進而讓身體在運動計畫的訓練之後，能夠恢復到健康的狀態。本課程的理論基礎是以運動改善下半身的循環促進，並進而帶動全身的循環以促進健康。從下肢訓練開始設計不同強度的訓練模式，並進而連接到各個部位所需要的運動如50肩 、坐骨神經痛、足底筋膜炎、尿失禁、經前症候群等等。透過適當的運動訓練計畫，讓身體再找回健康，是這門課的主軸。
Functional strengthening exercise is mainly aimed at the physical condition, combined with the implementation of the appropriate exercise plans, to improve the original function degradation condition, so that the body can recover to a healthy state after the training of the exercise plan. The theoretical basis of this course is to improve the circulation of the lower body by exercise, and then drive the circulation of the whole body to promote health. To start from the lower limb training, different intensity training modes are designed, and then connected to the required exercises of various parts such as 50 shoulders, sciatica, plantar fasciitis, urinary incontinence, premenstrual syndrome and so on. Through the appropriate sports training plan, let the body regain health, is the main axis of this course.
全18週

本課程以解剖生理學與運 動等科知識為基礎，並且根據之論配合解剖生理學與運 動等科知識為基礎，並且根據之論配合解剖生理學與運 動等科知識為基礎，並且根據之論配合動生理學與應用相關之實驗論操作，進而協助習評估人類行活的變 動生理學與應用相關之實驗論操作，進而協助習評估人類行活的變 動生理學與應用相關之實驗論操作，進而協助習評估人類行活的變 化，同 時預測運動能力表現 或評估運動訓練效益 ；本課程同時會探討有氧、無運動能力身體組 本課程同時會探討有氧、無運動能力身體組 本課程同時會探討有氧、無運動能力身體組 本課程同時會探討有氧、無運動能力身體組 本課程同時會探討有氧、無運動能力身體組 成評估方法、 成評估方法、 身體醣類代謝能力、 身體醣類代謝能力、 低氧保健相關議題、 低氧保健相關議題、 應用運動生理學之發展趨勢。 應用運動生理學之發展趨勢。 此外，學生將 此外，學生將 此外，學生將 學習建置常壓低氧保健設施所需之原理，並且熟悉相關康監控器材實作項目 學習建置常壓低氧保健設施所需之原理，並且熟悉相關康監控器材實作項目 學習建置常壓低氧保健設施所需之原理，並且熟悉相關康監控器材實作項目 。修習本課程後， 學生可對運動理領域 有更深一層的 認識 ，並瞭解運動生理學之與實作 。
This course is designed to extend the fundamental knowledge of anatomy and physiology to an advanced level in applied exercise physiology.  We combine both basic applied and exercise physiology theories and experiments to help students learn how to evaluate physiological changes in response to physical activity and exercise.  In addition, students can understand how to predict exercise performance and benefits of exercise training.  In this course, experimental methods for evaluating aerobic/anaerobic exercise performance, body composition, and carbohydrate metabolism during exercise are covered, and trends in the development of exercise physiology are discussed as well.  In the completion of this course, students can integrate the knowledge from both fundamental theories and experimental aspects.

Advanced clinical audiology
本科目注重個別測驗的理論發展基礎及在診斷上與其他測驗相較的優勢和併用性分析。內容同時強調各測驗施測時影響結果因素的分析,不良因素的排除技巧應用, 和各項測驗數據意義的解析和跨測驗結果的綜合判讀。

01
Clinical Speech-Language Pathology
語言是人類用來做思想溝通知識交流經驗傳承的工具與能力。這工具的獲得是透過中樞神經學習機制在適當的環境刺激下逐步建立。所牽涉到的機制是感官對外界刺激的感知和解碼，以及進入中樞神經之後的知覺聯繫，以及利用神經認知記憶系統的統整活動所產生。臨床語言障礙包羅萬象，涵蓋病人年齡層由小至老，言治療師必須習得基礎的中樞神經運作機制與臨床語言異常症狀配合，方能在日後做病理的判斷和治療方針的擬定有合宜的思考。
Language is the ability and tool to share and inherence experiences and thoughts. With central neuro-mechanism, language is learnt with proper environmental stimuli, which involves sensory perception and encoding. Clinical speech and language pathology concerns with patient ranging from children to adults. Therefore, the class is designed to help students combine the knowledge with neuro-mechanism and language disorders for the future diagnosis and treatment.
全18週

Cochlear Implants
本科目之教學設計為橫向整合內耳前庭功能評量與復健、臨床聽力學、電生理聽力學，縱向銜接聽力科學、聽力障礙學。
This course aims to provide students with an understanding of clinical and scientific aspects of cochlear implants. Central topics related to cochlear implants will be covered. These topics will include: basic surgical and engineering aspects of cochlear implants, clinical considerations, device safety, efficacy outcomes, and aural rehabilitation in adult and pediatric implant users. We will also discuss the trends in cochlear implants, such as issues related to bilateral implantation, combined electric and acoustic stimulation, virtual channels, etc. Students who take this course will develop skills in integrating various sources of information and apply it to
clinical practice and research.

Aural Rehabilitation Practicum
本課程主要將介紹為聽損者進行聽能復健的原理及方法。授課內容以聽能復健學課程為基本架構，期能帶領學生熟悉學理基礎以及臨床實務上的應用。課程內容將著重於帶領學生進行聽能復健的訓練與實作，如聽能訓練、讀話訓練、溝通策略訓練，最後將進一步訓練學生撰寫不同年齡層所適用的聽能復健計畫。
This course will provide hands-on activities designed to prepare students to easily implement aural rehabilitation into clinical settings.
At the end of the course the student will be familiarized with various approaches to aural rehabilitation and learn to design treatment plan for different age groups.

Introduction to Illness in Infant and Child
本課程包括有認識正常嬰幼兒的成長與發育，以及生長發育異常兒童之發現與處理方式，新生兒篩檢，嬰幼兒異常症狀早期發現之要點，兒童各器官系統正常與異常情況之理學評估和比較，並需實習身體評估與照護之要領。課程之平時作業為每位同學回顧及探討自身的出生史、生長史、預防注射紀錄、疾病史和家族史，藉此能知己而後知彼、將心比心，深刻了解生長發育與疾病之要義。學期中亦安排分組專題報告、特殊疾病之專家演講，參訪醫院或嬰幼兒保育機構，以及新生兒篩檢實驗室。
This study includes “Introduction of Pediatrics, Normal and Abnormal Growth of Infant and Child, Newborn Screening, Immunization, Physical Assessment of All the Organ Systems of Infant and Child, Basic Knowledge of Abnormal Symptoms and Signs of Infant and Child, Identification of Children with Illness, Appropriate Way of Caring and Management of Abnormal Children”.

Guidance of Child Behavior Problems
本課程介紹有關兒童行為觀察與輔導基本概念，以及兒童行為輔導的策略與技巧，配合課堂補充講義學習兒童行為觀察量表之使用與了解問題行為發生原因，進一步應用行為輔導介入之策略。課程內容包含常見問題行為特徵與輔導策略介紹，以及認識有特殊需求兒童之行為輔導（包括智能障礙、語言障礙、身體病弱、情緒障礙、多重障礙、自閉症、注意力缺陷過動症、發展遲緩等特殊兒童之教育與輔導策略）。藉由本課程內容安排，期盼可以培養學生對兒童行為輔導工作的熱誠與能力，並將所學運用於實際教學環境中。
This course was base on theories of psychology and sociology .The major purpose was to discuss some effective strategies for solving the problems of child behavior, so that will be useful to the students in their professional career. This curriculum includes three parts, the first is theories and skills of child behavior guidance; the second is problems of behavior which were found on most of child, it includes: aggressive behavior, feeding problem, toilet training, sleeping problem, emotional problem, hyper-activity, social behavior, etc.; the third is behavior disorder of childhood, it includes: anxiety disorders, depression and peer relations, learning disabilities, over-activity disorder, mental retardation autism and childhood schizophrenia, etc.

Infant & Child Care Practice (Basic)

Curriculum Design for Preschools
課程設計能力係屬幼兒教師、保育人員之專業能力，為提昇教保品質之基本條件。本課程旨在幫助學生建立自己的教保課程設計理念、培養實際設計課程活動之能力。主要內容包含課程之基本概念、幼兒教保課程的基礎、要素與設計發展、以及設計幼兒教保活動的主要方式。學生應能根據課堂所學及視實務機構所需，分組合力進行課程設計。
This course deals with the theory and practice of curriculum design. Participants will learn the theoretic underpinnings which inform the practical problems of making curriculum and the how to do curriculum design. This course will begin with the curriculum rationale and then explore contemporary design models as expressed in the literature.

01
The Design and Practice for Children's Science-Education Course
科學概念的啟蒙與培養，應從幼兒學前教育階段為佳。但現行教育保育人
員本身科學相關知能的訓練稍嫌不足，恐怕難深談對幼兒科學活動的設計。
本課程是以幼教或幼保系學生現有的科學知能背景為考量，安排科學基礎
課程來加強、提昇學生本身相關的科學素養。另外將設計一系列可供學生發
揮並能達到幼兒科學觀念培養的相關教材，讓學生實際操作與演練。將科學
基礎課程與幼教專業實務間作一聯結，以期學生能將科學知能與態度應用於
幼教學理中。
The cultivation of science education should begin way before children enter
elementary school. However, nowadays many preschool teachers do not possess enough
science knowledge or acquire systematic scientific trainings for them to design and
implement appropriate science curriculum for young children. As we know, teacher’s
Teacher’ s academic code：078
attitude toward certain course subject will influence how students look at the subject,
thus will affect their leaning results and related achievement. Therefore, it will be hard
for preschool kids to be able to enjoy science learning or to engage themselves in any
type of science experiments if their teacher does not like science at all.
This project intends to help college students in the department of infant and child
care (who will be preschool teachers after graduation) learn both basic science
knowledge and the design of science curriculum for young children. Furthermore,
students will have the opportunities to explore many real-life science experiments and
to practice their skills in designing scientific experiments for young children as they
attend basic science course plus advanced curriculum design course. In addition, they
will also have the chances to observe and learn from other college students as they
participate in the integrated preschool science-learning-activity design competition.
全18週

Montessori Method
本課程之宗旨為讓學生知道蒙特梭利教學法的理論與實務之大概以及啟發學生深入學習蒙特梭利教學法的興趣。蒙特梭利教學法雖於1907年開始萌芽，經各國文化與社會變遷的洗禮，能和諧地融入各國文化與社會。台灣幼兒教育的主流教學模式為以主題為中心的單元、主題或方案課程，蒙式則以學習區的教具操作為主，目前台灣已能將主題中心教學模式與蒙特梭利的教學相互融合。本課程從整體觀的概念介紹蒙特梭利教學法的理論與實務，並說明與主題中心式教學模式融合的可能性。
The purposes of the course are understanding theory of Montessori education and to familiar with the practice of Montessori Method and integrating theme teaching and Montessori method.
全18週

Preschool Classroom Management
本課程旨在協助學生了解班級經營之理論基礎與實務內容，增進學生未來從事班級教學及行政經營的知能。課程內容包括班級經營基本概念和學理依據、班級行政經營、班級環境經營、班級教學經營、班級常規輔導、班級人際關係的經營和班級危機管理等。課程設計則強調透過實際參與班級經營活動，增加學生對班級經營理念的體驗與了解，而能運用於實際工作中。
The purpose of the course is to development classroom management skills in preschool teachers 
to be. The positive discipline skills center in developing mutual respect, cooperation and 
responsibilities in the classroom.
Learning proper management techniques is the key to having a pre-school classroom that's 
free from chaos and confusion. The techniques that a preschool teacher uses to manage her 
classroom can have far-reaching effects, not only on a student's self-esteem and motivation to 
excel, but also on the teacher's mental well-being. For any technique to be successful, it must be 
one that resonates with the teacher so it can grow organically along with the teacher-student .

Teaching Materials and Methods for Young ChildrenⅡ
課程設計與教學能力係屬幼兒教保工作人員之專業能力，為提升教保品質之基本條件，不可或缺。衡量當今幼兒教育思潮、幼兒發展需求與社會發展狀況，本課程從統整理念出發，依據「幼兒園教保活動與課程大綱」（新課綱）之精神及內涵，幫助學生建立以幼兒為中心之幼兒教材教法觀念、培養學生實際進行幼兒教保活動之能力。主要內容包含瞭解幼兒園教學之理念與實務，認識新課綱身體動作與健康領域、語文領域、社會領域之課程目標與學習指標，以及各領域之教學內容與教學方法，包含學習區教學。學生應能根據課堂所學，設計教學活動並實施，之後進行檢討。
The purposes of this course are to explore the characteristics, contents, and trends of teaching methods and materials for preschoolers. Due to the limitation of course schedule, this course will focus on six major child development aspects. The contents focus both theories and practices in this topics. Students will also be able to design different lesson plans for children in its different development stages by using what they learned in this course.
全18週

Curriculum Models for Infant & Child Care
本課程旨在介紹並探討不同類型之教保模式。保育模式於本課程中被定義為嬰幼兒園所依循一教育理念，並將其實踐於課程與教學中而形成的一種教學與保育的模式。課程內容包含對重要教育理念的介紹，及依循不同教育理念衍生出之各類型教保模式之探討。針對各類型教保模式，探討其教育理念、對兒童看法、教學方式、教師角色、與反映在教育方法上的異同等。並就各教學模式於當前台灣幼兒園之實施現況，進行分析與評論。
The purpose of this course is to explore approaches and models related to infant and childcare.  Curriculum content includes introduction of major educational theories, and exploration of various teaching models such as the project approach and the Reggio Emilia.  When examining each teaching approach, the class will explore its educational belief, beliefs about children regarding how they learn and develop, its teaching methods, teacher’s roles, and differences from other approaches.  One aim of this course is to know the current applications of these teaching models in Taiwan.

Perceptual-motor Play
本課程主要目的在使學生能將知覺動作遊戲之理論實際應用至嬰幼兒保育及幼兒園的課程設計上。課程的實施是以理論架構之介紹及實際操作應用兩者相互搭配，首先介紹知覺動作遊戲之理論基礎、嬰幼兒知覺動作之正常及異常發展，再依據知覺動作遊戲之設計及操作原則，讓學生直接至遊戲教室參與並設計知覺動作遊戲，最後再介紹特殊障礙兒童之知覺動作遊戲設計、實施原則並實際示範，以期望學生能將知覺動作遊戲理論實際應用至一般及特殊嬰幼兒之保育上。
Babies are born to learn from experimenting the relationship between their body and the environment.  Based on the tactile and other sensory systems they are born with, this curriculum aims to help students learn how to design sensory and motor activities for parents and babies.  The various baby activities aim to build up a vocabulary of sensory experiences (e.g. visual, auditory and tactile), to enhance physical contact (massage, reflexology, touching, cuddling and rocking) and motor interaction between parents and their baby.
全18週

The Seminar in The Topics of Early Child Care
課程目標在於激勵學生能夠選擇與觀察嬰幼兒教保育現場的相關問題，以當代家庭、托育服務提供及社會等相關議題或時事作深入探討。學生各自組成團隊並針對議題進行資料收集、分析、研討與報告撰寫，任課老師與業界專業人員則擔任「導師」的角色協助團隊找出解決策略，進而建構出實做能力與成果。在經歷團隊合作的過程後，完成專題發表的經驗，期望可以讓學生累積並建構未來邁入職場的探索與統整能力。
The goal of the course is to motivate students to choose and observe relevant issues in the field of infant and child care, and to conduct in-depth discussions on relevant issues or current events such as contemporary families, childcare service provision, and society. Students form their own teams to collect data, analyze, discuss and write reports on the issues. Teachers and professional practitioners act as "mentors" to help the team find solutions and then build practical capabilities and results. After experiencing the process of teamwork, the experience of completing the topic publication is expected to allow students to accumulate and build the ability to explore and integrate into the workplace in the future.
全18週

Physiology

Service Learning

These will be helpful students for their future jobs and their quality of life.

01
Microbiology and Immunology
醫用微生物與免疫學隸屬基礎醫學門，為醫學與護理之專業核心科目之一。近二十多年來,因分子生物學之蓬勃發展，使得微生物學與免疫學之內容日趨複雜。唯有以分子生物學為基礎來解說本課程,才能脫離以往只能說明表相之教學窠臼。
本課程之設計配合前述趨勢，內容傾向臨床應用,並使學生易於瞭解。先由宿主與寄生者間競爭優勢之生態看感染性疾病之發生，免疫反應在此過程中決定了疾病之形成與否,由此介紹人體免疫的基本構成成員與免疫反應的種類與運作。再以人體之器官系統為主軸，分別介紹各種傳染性疾病及其病原體。由分子生物學之觀點探討疾病機制及現象，以預防醫學之角度看傳染性疾病之發生與控制。
傳染性疾病由微生物造成，生態環境與生活方式之改變，使得傳染性疾病之面貌與半世紀前大不相同。傳染性疾病之控制，包括預防與醫療成為重要課題，微生物學著重此方向之探討。人體除藉由免疫系統防禦感染並負起消除不正常細胞之重責，因而健全之生理得以維持。萬一免疫系統之運作失調，除了無法對付感染之外，還可能反而造成對自身之傷害，現已知許多疾病即肇因於此。因此免疫學同列為本課程教學內容。
The knowledge in the field of both medical microbiology and immunology has accumulated amazingly. Taking into account the changes that are currently taking place in the teaching of medical microbiology in medical schools worldwide, the content of this course is geared towards making the subject more accessible and relevant to clinical practice.
At the beginning of this course, we introduce infectious diseases regarding the conflict between the host and the parasite. Immunology plays a central role in this conflict, as a given microbe can infect and cause disease only if it can survive under the multitude of the immune response of the host. From this point of view, current basic concepts of immunology and the pathogenesis of immune disorders are introduced in the second section of this course. In the third part, clinically based accounts of infectious diseases are classified according to the particular organ system involved. We also place particular emphasis on pathogenesis, clinical symptom, control, and prevention as well as possible molecular mechanisms of the diseases. Moreover, we discuss the infectious diseases that burst out locally or somewhere in the world at present.
全18週

Introduction to Nursing Profession
本課程旨在使學生對護理專業有初步認識，瞭解護理人員在目前健康照護體系中所扮演角色與功能，並培養專業護理人員應有的智能與態度。同時認識目前護理專業發展現況及影響因素，能體認護理專業未來發展趨勢，以激發學生投入護理專業的興趣與意願。
This course will assist students to understand the basic concepts of nursing profession, realize the professional nursing role and functions in health care delivery system, and foster the competence and attitudes of professional nurses. In addition, students would understand nursing profession development, contemporary challenges and influencing factors to nursing profession and can realize the future trends in nursing profession. Through this course, students are encouraged to the interest and will to invest the nursing profession.

本課程設計旨在協助學生培養服務的精神，藉由至服務機構提供服務，落實課堂所學之服務知識與理念，並進而從服務中學習、瞭解服務於社區之重要性與體驗服務之意義，培養正向的服務態度，以期自我省思、瞭解自我進而促進自我成長與肯定生命價值。
This course is provided to introduce the basic concepts of volunteer, and help the students with fundamental understanding in non-profit organization (NPO). The class will be guided by different instructions of lecture, group discussion, homework and test. By the end, the students will have basic understanding on concepts, principle, and management model in volunteer works and NPO. These will be helpful students for their future jobs and their quality of life.
全18週

01
Microbiology and Immunology
醫用微生物與免疫學隸屬基礎醫學門，為醫學與護理之專業核心科目之一。近二十多年來,因分子生物學之蓬勃發展，使得微生物學與免疫學之內容日趨複雜。唯有以分子生物學為基礎來解說本課程,才能脫離以往只能說明表相之教學窠臼。
本課程之設計配合前述趨勢，內容傾向臨床應用,並使學生易於瞭解。先由宿主與寄生者間競爭優勢之生態看感染性疾病之發生，免疫反應在此過程中決定了疾病之形成與否,由此介紹人體免疫的基本構成成員與免疫反應的種類與運作。再以人體之器官系統為主軸，分別介紹各種傳染性疾病及其病原體。由分子生物學之觀點探討疾病機制及現象，以預防醫學之角度看傳染性疾病之發生與控制。
傳染性疾病由微生物造成，生態環境與生活方式之改變，使得傳染性疾病之面貌與半世紀前大不相同。傳染性疾病之控制，包括預防與醫療成為重要課題，微生物學著重此方向之探討。人體除藉由免疫系統防禦感染並負起消除不正常細胞之重責，因而健全之生理得以維持。萬一免疫系統之運作失調，除了無法對付感染之外，還可能反而造成對自身之傷害，現已知許多疾病即肇因於此。因此免疫學同列為本課程教學內容。
The knowledge in the field of both medical microbiology and immunology has accumulated amazingly. Taking into account the changes that are currently taking place in the teaching of medical microbiology in medical schools worldwide, the content of this course is geared towards making the subject more accessible and relevant to clinical practice.
At the beginning of this course, we introduce infectious diseases regarding the conflict between the host and the parasite. Immunology plays a central role in this conflict, as a given microbe can infect and cause disease only if it can survive under the multitude of the immune response of the host. From this point of view, current basic concepts of immunology and the pathogenesis of immune disorders are introduced in the second section of this course. In the third part, clinically based accounts of infectious diseases are classified according to the particular organ system involved. We also place particular emphasis on pathogenesis, clinical symptom, control, and prevention as well as possible molecular mechanisms of the diseases. Moreover, we discuss the infectious diseases that burst out locally or somewhere in the world at present.
全18週

Introduction to Nursing Profession
本課程旨在使學生對護理專業有初步認識，瞭解護理人員在目前健康照護體系中所扮演角色與功能，並培養專業護理人員應有的智能與態度。同時認識目前護理專業發展現況及影響因素，能體認護理專業未來發展趨勢，以激發學生投入護理專業的興趣與意願。
This course will assist students to understand the basic concepts of nursing profession, realize the professional nursing role and functions in health care delivery system, and foster the competence and attitudes of professional nurses. In addition, students would understand nursing profession development, contemporary challenges and influencing factors to nursing profession and can realize the future trends in nursing profession. Through this course, students are encouraged to the interest and will to invest the nursing profession.
全18週

Physiology
本課程以基礎醫學的觀點，由淺入深詳細探討人體生理學原理，尤其加強各器官系統間之調節機轉，進而切入於生理失衡之分辨及科技新知之相關應用。內容包括生理機制概論、細胞生理學、神經系統功能、肌肉生理、內分泌之調控、心臟及血流動力循環生理學、呼吸、消化生理及代謝之調節、腎臟生理學、生殖與幹細胞之展望。
The purpose of this course is to introduce physiological principles and regulatory mechanisms in terms of cells, organs and systems, further helps students to integrate concepts of diverse normal human functions, and applied to related disease mechanism.
